These derogatory marks have significantly impacted my credit score, and I believe they are being reported erroneously.

Details of the Inaccuracies : 1. Incorrect Payment Status : Several accounts are being reported as late or in collections, even though I have made payments or resolved disputes. These include : XXXX XXXX ( Experian and XXXX ) Reported as 90 days late despite payments being made. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Experian and XXXX ) Reported as late 120 days, though this account should not have been marked delinquent due to resolved payments.

2. Charge-Offs for Paid or Resolved Accounts : The following accounts are listed as charge-offs, but I have either paid them off or reached settlement agreements that should have updated their statuses : XXXX XXXX  ( Experian and XXXX ) Charge-off status persists despite payments made. 
XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Experian and XXXX ) Multiple accounts still marked as charged off after disputes were resolved. 
XXXX XXXX and XXXX ( Experian and XXXX ) These accounts were charged off but should reflect resolved balances due to settlements made.

3. Inaccurate Balances : Some revolving accounts are showing high balances that are outdated or incorrect. This includes : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Experian and XXXX ) Reported balances remain high despite recent payments.

4. XXXX XXXX ( Experian and XXXX ) The account is listed as a resolved dispute, though I disagree with the outcome, and the derogatory mark is incorrect.

5. Duplicate or Repetitive Accounts : XXXX is reporting duplicate entries for the following accounts, which unfairly impacts my credit score : XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX Multiple listings for the same account appear on my XXXX report. 
XXXX XXXX  The same account is reported more than once, and the duplicate entry contributes to an incorrect number of derogatory accounts.

6. Outdated Information : Some accounts, such as XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, appear to have been listed as derogatory for an extended period, longer than the statutory XXXX years for charge-offs and collections. These outdated entries should be removed.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to request the immediate deletion of a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) account from my credit report. This account contains inaccuracies, disputed charges, and information related to identity theft. Furthermore, XXXX 's handling of my billing dispute and related inquiries has been unprofessional and in violation of multiple federal and state laws. Relevant Legal Violations : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Under the FCRA, I have the right to request the removal of fraudulent or inaccurate information from my credit report. XXXX has failed to correct inaccuracies related to this account, specifically refusing to remove it despite its connection to identity theft and unauthorized charges. Violation : XXXX  refusal to remove this fraudulent information from my credit report violates my rights under the FCRA. Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) 15 U.S.C. 1666 The FCBA requires creditors to promptly investigate billing disputes and provide written explanations of their findings. XXXX failed to conduct a thorough investigation regarding a {$1000.00} debit card charge associated with this account and did not provide an adequate explanation. Violation : XXXX  mishandling of the billing dispute violates the FCBA 's investigation and dispute resolution provisions. Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) 15 U.S.C. 1693f The EFTA governs the resolution of unauthorized electronic fund transfers. The {$1000.00} charge is unauthorized, and XXXX has not investigated or reversed the transaction, despite my provision of sufficient documentation. Violation : XXXX has violated the EFTA by failing to investigate and resolve unauthorized charges as required by law. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C. 1692c The FDCPA prohibits unfair and deceptive collection practices, including reporting inaccurate or disputed debts. XXXX continues to report this account as charged off or past due, despite the ongoing dispute, which has harmed my credit score and financial standing. Violation : XXXX  reporting of this account as delinquent, despite the ongoing dispute, constitutes a violation of the FDCPA. Ohio Consumer Sales Practices Act ( CSPA ) Ohio Rev. Code 1345.02 The Ohio CSPA prohibits suppliers from engaging in unfair, deceptive, or unconscionable acts in consumer transactions. XXXX  failure to investigate my billing dispute and unauthorized charges, along with their lack of clear communication, falls under deceptive practices as defined by Ohio law. Violation : XXXX conduct constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under the Ohio CSPA. Ohio Identity Theft Law Ohio Rev. Code 2913.49 Ohio 's identity theft laws protect consumers from the adverse effects of fraudulent information. XXXX has refused to correct or remove fraudulent information from my credit report, which continues to harm my financial standing. Violation : XXXX  refusal to remove identity theft-related information from my credit report violates Ohios identity theft law. Summary of Violations : Inaccurate Information Reporting ( FCRA ) : XXXX has failed to remove inaccurate information despite evidence of its connection to unauthorized charges and identity theft. Failure to Investigate Billing Disputes ( FCBA ) : XXXX has not properly investigated my billing dispute. Unauthorized Charges ( EFTA ) : The {$1000.00} charge is unauthorized, and XXXX has failed to investigate or reverse it. Unfair Debt Collection Practices ( FDCPA ) : XXXX continues to report the account as delinquent despite the ongoing dispute. Deceptive Practices ( Ohio CSPA ) : XXXX  mishandling of my dispute and failure to correct inaccuracies constitute unfair practices. Failure to Correct Identity Theft Information ( Ohio Identity Theft Law ) : XXXX  refusal to remove identity theft-related information is unlawful. Desired Outcome : Immediate Deletion of the XXXX  Account : I request that XXXX  be required to delete this disputed account from my credit report across all credit bureaus ( Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ). This account contains fraudulent charges and disputed information that have not been resolved appropriately. Reimbursement of {$1000.00} for Unauthorized Debit Card Charge : I seek reimbursement for the {$1000.00} unauthorized debit card charge. If XXXX can not provide this reimbursement, I request that they block and delete the account from my credit report immediately. Correction of Credit Report : XXXX must notify all credit bureaus of the account deletion and ensure that any derogatory marks related to this account are permanently removed from my credit file. Conclusion : I trust that the CFPB will take prompt action to ensure my rights as a consumer are upheld. XXXX has failed to follow federal and state laws in handling my dispute and reporting accurate information. I respectfully request the CFPB 's assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring that XXXX corrects the ongoing damage to my credit report.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
COMES NOW, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Living, Breathing, Sentient Man bring forth this claim against Navy Federal Credit Union ( `` NFCU '' ) for violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( " FCRA '' ), specifically pertaining to the furnishing of false, inaccurate, and misleading information on my consumer report. 

1. Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( 7 ) ( A ) : Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies NFCU has failed to adhere to its responsibilities as a furnisher of information. Under 1681s2 ( 7 ) ( A ), furnishers are required to provide accurate information to consumer reporting agencies. I have identified multiple instances where NFCU reported incorrect information regarding my credit account, which has adversely affected my credit score and caused me significant distress. 

2. Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681c ( 5 ) : Requirements Relating to Information Contained in Consumer Reports NFCU has also contravened 1681c ( 5 ), which mandates that information regarding accounts in collection must be reported accurately. Notably, NFCU charged off my account but failed to provide me with a copy of the Form 1099-C, which is necessary for my tax filings. According to the Internal Revenue Service, a charged-off amount is considered taxable income that should be reported on my 1040 tax return, not on a consumer report. This misreporting further misrepresents my financial status and creditworthiness. 

3. Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) : Compliance Procedures Under 1681e ( b ), NFCU is obligated to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information it furnishes. The false and misleading information provided in my report indicates a lack of such procedures, resulting in a significant breach of the FCRA. 

4. Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681n : Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance NFCUs actions constitute willful noncompliance with the FCRA, as they knowingly and willingly reported inaccurate information regarding my account status. Under 1681n, I am entitled to seek civil liability for these violations, which have caused me both financial harm and emotional distress. 

Supporting Case Law Additionally, in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), the court found that a data furnisher can be held liable for reporting inaccurate information if it fails to conduct a reasonable investigation after receiving a consumer dispute, reinforcing the obligations of furnishers under the FCRA. 

Furthermore, in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX ), the court emphasized that data furnishers must be proactive in ensuring the accuracy of the information they report, highlighting the legal expectation for compliance with the FCRA. 

In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), the Supreme Court underscored the necessity for accuracy in credit reporting and the implications of inaccuracies on consumer rights. The court emphasized that consumers must be protected from the repercussions of erroneous information, as such inaccuracies can severely impact their ability to obtain credit. 

Lastly, in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX ), the court ruled that furnishers of information have a duty to ensure that the information they provide is accurate and that consumers have the right to seek redress when this duty is not fulfilled.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I started using this credit account from PayPal this year in XXXX. They gave me six months of no interest.

However, I noticed they did charge me XXXX dollars of interest in my second month of having an account. I paid {$100.00} roughly {$100.00} a month toward my balance but by the time my six months came around I still had a balance of over {$400.00}. Because of this high balance, I was not able to fully pay it off in one payment so they started to charge me a very high amount of interest. I noticed they also would charge me a late fee if my posted payment was a day late which I called about and they reversed XXXX of them but with the interest and the other late fees, they did not reverse. My balance is {$220.00} of interest and late fees and I owe a total of {$300.00} roughly. So I really only owe them {$79.00} And I can definitely pay that off, the XXXX $ is a very high balance. I asked if they would remove any of the other fees and they some agents said they would not that it was applied just fine. A lot of the customer service people Ive spoken to over chat had a rude sentiment with me. I didnt feel like they were really trying to help me. It sounded more like they were accusing me of not wanting to pay at all and trying to get over on them and just being a bad customer just were very rude. 

I did not have a good experience with the customer service and they refused to help me and wanted to cut off my conversation shirt. I did, however, speak to two agents over chat who offered to take off all of my interest and my late fees so I could pay the balance, and unfortunately, my browser would refresh when they asked me how I could pay and they were asking me to pay through the chat. 
When I tried to reconnect, mysteriously I was given a new agent and that person said they can see that although I was given an interest and late fee refund offer they would refuse and didnt say exactly why. They just said it was not possible. With the other two agents, it was possible so I am very confused. Id like to know exactly why I was offered this with two agents and then never again offered with any other agents. And what that meant exactly that I could pay them through the chat. For some reason, no one knows what or why that was offered to me and can not answer these questions. Or they refuse to answer these questions.

This is very Misleading and a bit deceitful. And predatory in my opinion. I would like to pay off my balance and take the offer that the two agents offered me.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to demand the immediate resolution of Capital Ones improper handling of my account, which was closed despite ongoing billing errors and securitized debts. This has led to unlawful collection practices. I demand restitution of the principal and interest collected and request that monthly payments be made directly to me as compensation. Should Capital One fail to comply with this demand, I will pursue arbitration based on our agreement and relevant legal protections.

1. Securitization of Debt and Improper Collections According to Capital Ones financial disclosures ( see Exhibit A ), the debt tied to my account was likely securitized and sold to investors. Once securitized, Capital One relinquished its right to collect payments directly from me, as ownership of the debt was transferred. However, Capital One has continued to collect payments from me despite no longer holding the debt. This action is in violation of the Holder in Due Course Rule and constitutes unjust enrichment, as Capital One has already been compensated through the securitization process. 
Based on Capital Ones 10-K filings, the company has profited substantially from the securitization of consumer debts, generating significant capital through these transactions. This profit was earned while Capital One continues to unlawfully collect direct payments from consumers like myself, which is not only unjust but also violates principles of fair debt collection and transparency.

In Heritage Bank v. Bruha, it was established that collecting payments on a debt that has been sold or securitized amounts to unjust enrichment, as the creditor can no longer collect from the consumer. Capital Ones continued collection efforts have caused financial harm, and I demand restitution of these payments.

2. Restitution of Principal and Interest As the account holder and holder in due course, I am entitled to the full restitution of all principal and interest collected unlawfully. Under the precedents set in Cain v. Midland Funding, LLC, any interest and principal collected on a securitized debt must be returned to the consumer. Capital Ones actions have caused undue financial strain, and I demand that all principal and interest be refunded immediately.

3. Monthly Payments in Accordance with Legal Rights Under established principles of equitable restitution and unjust enrichment, I am exercising my right to demand that monthly payments be made to me to compensate for the improper handling of this debt. Since the debt has been securitized and Capital One continues to unlawfully profit, I demand monthly payments equivalent to the amount unlawfully collected until this matter is fully resolved.

4. Holder in Due Course Rule As the holder in due course, I retain the right to assert defenses against Capital Ones unlawful collection efforts. Capital One has failed to provide full disclosure regarding the securitization of my debt, and under the Holder in Due Course Rule ( 16 CFR Part 433 ), I am protected from further collection efforts. I am formally exercising my right under this rule to demand the cessation of any further collection attempts.

5. Account Closure and Unjust Actions Capital Ones decision to close my account without proper notice or correction of the billing errors constitutes a violation of consumer protection laws. Precedents set in Krieger v. Bank of America show that such actions by a creditor without rectifying billing errors or informing the consumer about the securitization of debt violate the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ). I demand that the account be reinstated, and that billing errors be rectified immediately, along with restitution of any wrongful charges.

6. Arbitration Notice In accordance with applicable laws and our agreement, I am notifying Capital One that should this issue not be resolved promptly, I will pursue arbitration as a means of resolving this dispute. Both federal and state laws governing debt collection and arbitration provide for a fair and binding resolution process. I am entitled to seek redress for the financial harm caused by Capital Ones actions, and I fully intend to pursue my legal rights through arbitration if this matter is not addressed within the specified time.

Consumer complaint narrative: So Capital One has been the only the most confusing but the most unhelpful car company bank account people I've ever come across ... this instance is after multiple weeks of having my new credit card and making the deposits to bring my credit line back and using it virtual cards and the real card number on XXXX and other things like that there was no issue up until about 2 days ago when I was opening the banking app, and I tried to replace a virtual card my text alerts told me that my account was restricted and then I needed to call Capital One to get it unrestricted and they were telling me that we were just wondering if these deposits were legitimate or not and that unless I was able to have the person that fully only account that the the most recent deposit request was legitimate and that there was no illegal issues or falsified transfers happening... mind you that the deposit request that they were most concerned about was a {$3.00} deposit request, all while the past deposits that have gone through and had no issue whatsoever were in the ballpark of {$130.00} to {$350.00} and so on ... no issue there and they weren't concerned about anything until that {$3.00} deposit request and they said I'm less I can get the other person up to bank account on the phone to give specific information to verify that my account was going to be restricted and then when I tried to make a payment with my other account, that was not possible. Even though I had three customer service agents say it was. And so me being a beneficiary of the account that was used means that they are wanting the fiduciary, and my dad is the fiduciary of the account that I have been using to make my deposits it is my first bank account I used XXXX XXXX once because my host home provider was willing to help me out in the time of need because I needed to get out of a sticky situation and my fiduciary was leaving to go on a trip to XXXX which is where they are now. And so that was that and now they're making it to wear apparently they can't close my account I can't open another account I can't make a payment I can't do anything with my account whatsoever nor am I seeing proper account balance that I need to pay off the point where I don't know exactly what to do I don't want this to cause my credit report to go down especially cuz I just this is my first credit card and I don't want it to negatively affect my credit report I don't want to have a bad banking history that might or might not affect future bank accounts that I might have and overall I just I'm needing to either come my account closed or have it reopened so that I can actually also pay my bills pay the outstanding balance and actually be able to function as a human being cuz I use that for gas I use that for work I use that for everything and with it being restricted I have no access to groceries gas food Lord asked anything and they are basically making me feel like they're giving me the runaround cuz I'm a new member cuz I've gone on and researched that Capital One can close your account, but the company itself has to do it I can't do it from my end ... and so overall there's no legitimate reason for this whole situation that I'm currently in now and I really would rather not just sit by and wait for a miracle to happen or for them to come to their senses or actually follow through with them saying they are going to send me important information and whatnot or mail me information that hasn't happened yet ... and I honestly don't think they're actually going to send me mail me or even really do anything to help rectify the situation

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a fraudulent scam letter in the mail on XX/XX/year> which I initially noticed that the envelope post marked from XXXX, OR and when I took the letter out it said that the letter was from the " law office '' of Quest Legal Group which is their office is located in XXXX XXXX, CA. As I started reading the letter it said that they represent a pay day loan company called XXXX which then I XXXX the company XXXX and I read that XXXX is owned by a pawn broker called XXXX XXXX so I started thinking that this is part of a scam but regardless the letter continued on saying that I had until XXXX XXXX to pay off the debt owed to XXXX in the amount of {$1500.00}. The other part of the notice which is strange is that it says it says that that the loan was taken out while I was working for a company called XXXX XXXX so now there is another company that is involved in this scam. The worrisome part of the letter is that they print family member 's names on the letter where they say that they will subpoena your family members and take them to court as well to testify against and also that they will call XXXX to damage your credit score which they actually print a fake credit score at the bottom of the letter so all this is from the first letter I received on XXXX XXXX. 
The second notice I received in the mail from Quest Legal Group which this one was actually post marked from California I received on XX/XX/year> which said the exact thing as the first notice except that the amount decreased to to {$490.00} instead of the {$1500.00} that they were demanding from the first notice. The notice said that they were going to be nice with me and help settle the debt as long as I pay them the {$490.00} by XXXX XXXX and if they did receive the payment then they would purse on taking me to court. 
Obviously I have never even heard anything or seen any of these companies or even worked at any of these companies in my life until i received this fraudulent scam letter from Quest Legal Group. I started doing some research online and I have read other warning notices from other victims that say that they too have received the same weird fraudulent scam letter from XXXX or from Quest Legal Group and in all the letters it says that they need to pay them the money that the victim supposedly took out with XXXX if not that they will be taken to court and legal action will be obtained. The other victims of this scam also say that they have never heard of Quest Legal Group or XXXX until they opened the scam letter that they received in the mail. I even read a complaint on XXXX  about another victim that received a notice from XXXX so I ; m not sure if all this scam companies are working together to create this fraudulent scam or could just be 1 person using all these companies including the law office of quest Legal Group to create this scam. 
I did check with XXXX representative to see if someone might have used my information to take out a pay day loan using my personal information but the XXXX representative guaranteed me that there is no activity on my credit report from any company called XXXX or XXXX XXXX or any from any debt collectors under the name Quest Legal Group so then raises the question where are these scammers getting people 's information tocreate these fake debts which are obviously fraudulent scams

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to request the immediate deletion of a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) account from my credit report. This account contains inaccuracies, disputed charges, and information related to identity theft. Furthermore, XXXX 's handling of my billing dispute and related inquiries has been unprofessional and in violation of multiple federal and state laws. Relevant Legal Violations : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Under the FCRA, I have the right to request the removal of fraudulent or inaccurate information from my credit report. XXXX has failed to correct inaccuracies related to this account, specifically refusing to remove it despite its connection to identity theft and unauthorized charges. Violation : XXXX  refusal to remove this fraudulent information from my credit report violates my rights under the FCRA. Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) 15 U.S.C. 1666 The FCBA requires creditors to promptly investigate billing disputes and provide written explanations of their findings. XXXX failed to conduct a thorough investigation regarding a {$1000.00} debit card charge associated with this account and did not provide an adequate explanation. Violation : XXXX  mishandling of the billing dispute violates the FCBA 's investigation and dispute resolution provisions. Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) 15 U.S.C. 1693f The EFTA governs the resolution of unauthorized electronic fund transfers. The {$1000.00} charge is unauthorized, and XXXX has not investigated or reversed the transaction, despite my provision of sufficient documentation. Violation : XXXX has violated the EFTA by failing to investigate and resolve unauthorized charges as required by law. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C. 1692c The FDCPA prohibits unfair and deceptive collection practices, including reporting inaccurate or disputed debts. XXXX continues to report this account as charged off or past due, despite the ongoing dispute, which has harmed my credit score and financial standing. Violation : XXXX  reporting of this account as delinquent, despite the ongoing dispute, constitutes a violation of the FDCPA. Ohio Consumer Sales Practices Act ( CSPA ) Ohio Rev. Code 1345.02 The Ohio CSPA prohibits suppliers from engaging in unfair, deceptive, or unconscionable acts in consumer transactions. XXXX  failure to investigate my billing dispute and unauthorized charges, along with their lack of clear communication, falls under deceptive practices as defined by Ohio law. Violation : XXXX conduct constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under the Ohio CSPA. Ohio Identity Theft Law Ohio Rev. Code 2913.49 Ohio 's identity theft laws protect consumers from the adverse effects of fraudulent information. XXXX has refused to correct or remove fraudulent information from my credit report, which continues to harm my financial standing. Violation : XXXX  refusal to remove identity theft-related information from my credit report violates Ohios identity theft law. Summary of Violations : Inaccurate Information Reporting ( FCRA ) : XXXX has failed to remove inaccurate information despite evidence of its connection to unauthorized charges and identity theft. Failure to Investigate Billing Disputes ( FCBA ) : XXXX has not properly investigated my billing dispute. Unauthorized Charges ( EFTA ) : The {$1000.00} charge is unauthorized, and XXXX has failed to investigate or reverse it. Unfair Debt Collection Practices ( FDCPA ) : XXXX continues to report the account as delinquent despite the ongoing dispute. Deceptive Practices ( Ohio CSPA ) : XXXX  mishandling of my dispute and failure to correct inaccuracies constitute unfair practices. Failure to Correct Identity Theft Information ( Ohio Identity Theft Law ) : XXXX  refusal to remove identity theft-related information is unlawful. Desired Outcome : Immediate Deletion of the XXXX  Account : I request that XXXX  be required to delete this disputed account from my credit report across all credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion ). This account contains fraudulent charges and disputed information that have not been resolved appropriately. Reimbursement of {$1000.00} for Unauthorized Debit Card Charge : I seek reimbursement for the {$1000.00} unauthorized debit card charge. If XXXX can not provide this reimbursement, I request that they block and delete the account from my credit report immediately. Correction of Credit Report : XXXX must notify all credit bureaus of the account deletion and ensure that any derogatory marks related to this account are permanently removed from my credit file. Conclusion : I trust that the CFPB will take prompt action to ensure my rights as a consumer are upheld. XXXX has failed to follow federal and state laws in handling my dispute and reporting accurate information. I respectfully request the CFPB 's assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring that XXXX corrects the ongoing damage to my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear XXXX XXXX, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from Experian, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution.

Below is why I am requesting all of my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance. 

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from Experian, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly 15 USC 1681. The accounts listed below have egregiously violated my right to privacy and the accuracy of reporting :. Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  . Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX My Credit Report was updated in XX/XX/year> to which the Credit Bureau knowingly furnished inaccurate and incomplete information.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Sec. 602 ( A ) States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Under 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ), consumer reporting agencies are legally required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy in their reports. This has clearly not been done in my case, and the errors remain unaddressed.

Under 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ), it is the agencys responsibility to promptly delete or correct any information found to be inaccurate and incomplete during a dispute. Despite this legal requirement, the inaccuracies continue to persist on my report, causing unnecessary hardship.

Under 15 USC 1681s-2 explicitly states that furnishers must not report information they know, or have reasonable cause to believe, is inaccurate. These accounts have been reported in violation of this law.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST Collection agency name : MIDLAND CREDIT MANAGEMENT Address : XXXX, MI XXXX Account number : XXXX Your NAME : XXXX XXXX Your address : XXXX Highway XXXX, XXXX SC Dear MIDLAND CREDIT Management I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 
Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Your Name XXXX XXXX Your Address XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX SC XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX SC XXXX Collection Agency Name Midland Credit Management XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Zip XXXX, XXXX XXXX RE : Account # ( Fill in Account Number ) XXXX To Whom It May Concern : Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. 
This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. 
At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the XXXX major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character. 
I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. 
If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond to this validation request within XXXX  days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. 
It would be advisable that you and your client assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action. 
CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION Please provide the following : Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. 
Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he/she agreed to pay the creditor. 
Any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account. 
Any Judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account. 
Name and address of alleged creditor. 
Name on file of alleged debtor. 
Alleged account number. 
Address on file for alleged debtor. 
Amount of alleged debt. 
Date this alleged debt became payable. 
Date of original charge off or delinquency. 
Verification that this debt was assigned or sold to collector. 
Complete accounting of alleged debt. 
Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful. 
Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for COLLECTIONAGENCY in case legal action becomes necessary. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of the above is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please allow 30 days for processing after I receive this information back. 
Best Regards

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
During the XXXX pandemic, I was involved in a car accident that resulted in both the loss of my job and significant medical bills. The other driver had stolen the vehicle and, as a wanted criminal in three states, I was unable to receive compensation for the damages. Despite my efforts, including multiple attempts to resolve the matter, I encountered significant difficulties with the collection agency handling the medical bills related to my transportation to the hospital.

I contacted the collector several times, informing them that they needed to coordinate with my insurance provider, BCBS, to arrange payment. XXXX confirmed over the phone that they required the collector to communicate directly with them to process the payment. However, when I requested to speak with a supervisor at the collection agency, they refused to contact XXXX or participate in a XXXX call, which would have resolved the issue. The collector, Wakefield Associates, refused to authorize the connection and insisted that I was responsible for the payment.

Despite my repeated attempts to work toward a solution, they continued to demand payment and reported me as delinquent, severely impacting my credit. The delays caused by the collection agencys unwillingness to cooperate have now left me unable to secure coverage from XXXX, as the debt has become too old to be processed. I have exhausted every avenue to resolve this matter, yet the company refuses to comply with my requests. This situation has had a lasting negative effect on both my financial situation and credit.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Impersonated attorney, law enforcement, or government official
Consumer complaint narrative: I XXXX XXXX am writing a formal complaint to the Bureau, who has jurisdiction over this matter under sections 1053 and 1055 of the CFPA 12 U.S.C. 5563 and 5565, Section 814 ( b ) of the FDCPA 15 U.S.C 16921 ( b ), and Section 621 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( H ) of th FCRA, 15 U.S.C 1681s ( b ) ( 1 ) ( H ). MIDLAND CREDIT MANAGEMENT, their attorneys, servants, and agents have made several false representations to me a consumer regarding an alleged debt.. MCM in concert with their attorneys filed a frivolous claim for an alleged debt allegedly owed to XXXXXXXX XXXX in the XXXX District Court of XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX MCM brought an action against me falsely representing the amount and status of an alleged debt. They never provided me with a debt validation notice, MCM communicated with me without my consent, MCM and their attorneys filed a legal collection lawsuit without providing verification for the alleged debt, refused to provide me with the verification information in regards to the alleged debt that I requested, they are reporting false and inaccurate information on my consumer report, their attorneys falsely represented themselves as attorneys when they are debt collectors, MCM and their attorneys created and furnished misleading forms and affidavits, and the falsely represented the fact that they were legal debt collectors when they don't have a debt collectors license as the state of Michigan requires. Their conduct is abusive, oppressive, harassing, defaming, intimidating, and it causes me emotional distress. Their actions are grossly negligent and violates several provisions of the XX/XX/XXXX CFPB consent order.

Product: Credit card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year> i was called by Nordstrom credit card company, stating that my account was delinquent. I spoke to two representatives in the credit department on XX/XX/year>, from XXXX. I told them i had not received any billing statements for these " past due '' amounts. I was told that the billing statements had been sent to my home address and emails. None of which was true, but I agreed to pay the balance, less a {$40.00} late fee, per the representative. He told me to pay {$440.00}, then they would adjust the {$40.00} late fee off of my account, but I had to pay the bill in full first. I paid thru my XXXX XXXX XXXX bill pay on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX. I never got any statements, nor was I able to log into my Nordstrom account on-line. On XX/XX/year> I was denied on a XXXX credit card application because Nordstrom has reported me past due on payments. I have no letters, emails or statements from Nordstrom until today, XX/XX/year>. I received a past due statement in my email! What kind of scam is this? I get no bills until ther report me delinquent and trash my credit history and score? This does not seem right. 
I moved to XXXX in XX/XX/year>, and I explained that to the representative in XXXX. 
I have a XXXX XXXX and use XXXX XXXX to communicate to the US. 
No mail has been sent to my US address and no emails, so how can they just report me delinquent when there is no record of charges, and or adjudication after my XX/XX/XXXX payment? 
The last time I spoke with them, they told me that they don't keep recorded conversations or communications, but I am supposed to know when my account is delinquent? How can they tell me there is no record of mailed billing statements? How can that be? This all seems like it is set up to " catch '' creditors. I would like an explanation of my charges, since nothing has been sent to me personally. They were paid in XXXX, what happened between then and now? I have not used the card or charged anything, since it is not in my possession. This is so unfair credit practices if ever there was!

I just did a bank of america request online to request more compensation. During the time I had the prepaid card..my card was always locked and I had minimal access to my funds. I'm a single mom and that was devastating. My account was also compromised so I did some disputes and they were denied at the time. I believe they are still some benefits ( cash ) I haven't recieved ....

Consumer complaint narrative:
I sent a request for full validation of debt and Midland Credit Management via certified/return mail on XXXX and Midland on XX/XX/XXXX in response sent quite a list documents attempting to validate but only provided partial validation. In addition, on the cover page, the Midland provided contradictory information related to the balance owed on this account. In one section of the cover letter they state the 'Total due ' is {$2600.00} and just a few lines below that statement, on the same page of the document, Midland states the delinquent outstanding balance is {$5200.00}. I made a payment on this account in fear of being sued as Midland filed legal papers for in a XXXX XXXX court in an attempt to collect on this debt. 

I live in XXXX  and have since XXXX and was unable to appear so I made a payment on this account in fear of being sued. I am disputing the amount owed on this account and have requested full validation of the debt. Midland has only provided a partial validation as they have not provided a complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. As such, they have not provided verification by line item ( with an explanation of each item such as when the purchase took place, how much the item was, were the goods received, when were the goods received, etc. ) for the entire amount you say I owe obtained directly from the Original Creditor. 

Midland XXXX XXXX have violated my rights under FDCPA Section 809 ( b ), as they are not allowed to pursue collection activity until this debt is validated. They should be aware that in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), the court ruled that reporting a collection account is, indeed, considered collection activity.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

Please remove the following items from my credit report, immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the deletion of inaccurate information on my Experian credit report concerning a XXXX XXXX account ( account number : XXXX ). This account has already been deleted from my XXXX credit report and should therefore also be removed from my Experian report. 
According to 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), consumers have the right to dispute inaccuracies on their credit reports, and the credit bureau must reinvestigate the accuracy of the disputed information. 
The presence of this XXXX XXXX account on my Experian report is a clear discrepancy, as it has already been verified and deleted from my XXXX report. I have attached a copy of my XXXX credit report reflecting this deletion for your reference. 
Please take immediate action to delete this inaccurate information from my Experian credit report. I expect confirmation of the deletion within the legally mandated time frame.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer, Financial Protection Bureau I sent a dispute letter on XX/XX/year>, to Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and ACHIEVE PERSONAL LOANS about inaccurate and incomplete information that is being furnished on my consumer report XXXX, XXXX, and Experian. 

This is the letter I sent to XXXX XXXX  XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and ACHIEVE Personal Loans XX/XX/year>. 

you furnished alleged transaction on my Experian, XXXX, and XXXX that you identified as late. 
15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction ( 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; My transactions and experiences with your company are excluded from the consumer report.

You have no right to furnish my transactions and experiences when the law clearly states that this information is excluded from my consumer reports.

The only way a creditor can treat a payment as late falls under 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) Time to Make Payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

In order for any creditor to treat a payment as late you must prove that : The information required under 15 USC 1637 ( b ) of this title was mailed out or delivered 21 Days before the payment due date please provide the proof that this information was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) is very specific on all required information needed or that must be mailed or delivered to the consumer! You have 10 days to send me all the required information.

A creditor can not treat a payment as late without complying with this section of the law! I request in good faith under rule 1002 the documents that shows proof that the information pursuant section 15 USC 1666b and 1637 ( b ) of this title was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date. 
Do not rely to me stating that you are furnishing accurate information because we both know your not. 
Do not tell me this information is verified because you have not submitted proof of compliance with section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai and 15 USC 1666b & 1637 ( b ).

If you can not provide the proof of the mailing or delivery of the information required by section 1666b you can not treat a payment as late which means you have also violated section 15 USC 1681s-2. You have 10 Calendar days from the receipt of this notice to provide the required information or delete the transaction you have listed as late : It has been well over 30 days XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and Achieve Personal Loans hasnt responded to my letter. This information by law must be deleted Immediately off my Consumer Report XXXX XXXX  XXXX { XX/XX/year>, XXXX am } by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX } ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/year>, XXXX am ) by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX ) ( XXXX XXXX ) ACHIEVE PERSONAL LOANS ( XX/XX/year>, XXXX am ) by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX ) ( XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have multiple, active, in progress, unresolved consumer disputes in my CFPB account. 
As of XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed my credit report has decreased by over XXXX points for each credit bureau. The CFPB has failed to comply with : 15 U.S. Code 6805 - Enforcement- ( a ) In general Subject to subtitle B of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 [ 12 U.S.C . 5511 et seq. ], this subchapter and the regulations prescribed thereunder shall be enforced by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, the Federal functional regulators, the State insurance authorities, and the Federal Trade Commission with respect to financial institutions and other persons subject to their jurisdiction under applicable law. 

12 CFR 1016.4 Initial privacy notice to consumers required- ( a ) Initial notice requirement. You must provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects your privacy policies and practices to : ( 1 ) Customer. An individual who becomes your customer, not later than when you establish a customer relationship, except as provided in paragraph ( e ) of this section; and ( 2 ) Consumer. A consumer, before you disclose any nonpublic personal information about the consumer to any nonaffiliated third party. 


12 CFR 1016.7 Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods- ( a ) ( 1 ) Form of opt out notice. If you are required to provide an opt out notice under 1016.10 ( a ), you must provide a clear and conspicuous notice to each of your consumers that accurately explains the right to opt out under that section. The notice must state : ( i ) That you disclose or reserve the right to disclose nonpublic personal information about your consumer to a nonaffiliated third party ; ( ii ) That the consumer has the right to opt out of that disclosure; and ( iii ) A reasonable means by which the consumer may exercise the opt out right.

( 2 ) Examples ( i ) Adequate opt out notice. You provide adequate notice that the consumer can opt out of the disclosure of nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party if you : ( A ) Identify all of the categories of nonpublic personal information that you disclose or reserve the right to disclose, and all of the categories of nonaffiliated third parties to which you disclose the information, as described in 1016.6 ( a ) ( 2 ) and ( 3 ) of this part, and state that the consumer can opt out of the disclosure of that information; and ( B ) Identify the financial products or services that the consumer obtains from you, either singly or jointly, to which the opt out direction would apply. 
( ii ) Reasonable opt out means. You provide a reasonable means to exercise an opt out right if you : ( A ) Designate check-off boxes in a prominent position on the relevant forms with the opt out notice ; ( B ) Include a reply form together with the opt out notice that, in the case of financial institutions described in 1016.3 ( l ) ( 3 ) of this part, includes the address to which the form should be mailed ; ( C ) Provide an electronic means to opt out, such as a form that can be sent via electronic mail or a process at your Web site, if the consumer agrees to the electronic delivery of information ; or ( D ) Provide a toll-free telephone number that consumers may call to opt out. 
( iii ) Unreasonable opt out means. You do not provide a reasonable means of opting out if : ( A ) The only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt out right; or ( B ) The only means of opting out as described in any notice subsequent to the initial notice is to use a check-off box that you provided with the initial notice but did not include with the subsequent notice. 
( g ) Time to comply with opt out. You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it. 
( h ) Continuing right to opt out. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time.

( i ) Duration of consumer 's opt out direction.

( 1 ) A consumer 's direction to opt out under this section is effective until the consumer revokes it in writing or, if the consumer agrees, electronically. 

On XX/XX/XXXX via the CFPB complaint website, I have opted out of Experian, XXXX, XXXX reporting services according to 12 CFR 1016.7 for the accounts : 1. XXXX XXXX 2. XXXX XXXX According to the Fair Fredit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy ''. Experian, XXXX, XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the consumer. I have a right to make sure that my private information is not shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information ''. XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX are financial institutions by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 states " Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX  XXXX, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to Experian, XXXX, and XXXX whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, or implied are now all revoked. 
15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unlessthe consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option ''. XXXX XXXX  XXXX and XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my non disclosure option. In addition, 15 U.S.C. 1681a section 603 states that " ( II ) adverse to the interests of the consumer ''. CFPB, Experian, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX has committed continuous adverse reporting against my interests by reporting derogatory marks on my credit report, decreasing my credit score by over XXXX points in XXXX hours without regard to my active CFPB complaints, and by also reporting high credit card utilization, and late payments. 
15 U.S. Code 1681e states " Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title ''. CFPB, Experian, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX  XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. 

Total Damages pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance- {$55000.00} 2ND OPT OUT NOTICE BEFORE LAWSUIT- Pursuant to 12 CFR 1016.7- " You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it. Continuing right to opt out. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time ''. I XXXX XXXX, am opting out of CFPB, Experian, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and XXXX  XXXX reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative: A FCRA violation refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies ( CRAs ) follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports.If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter is not 100 % correct and i demand them to be investigated completely.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Request to Block Fraudulent Information Pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I am writing to formally request that you block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud, as provided under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ). I expect this action to be completed within four business days of your receipt of this complaint. 

The following accounts are fraudulent, inaccurate, and were not opened by me : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date Fraud Began : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$700.00} XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date Fraud Began : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$1000.00} XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date Fraud Began : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$8200.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date Fraud Began : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date Fraud Began : XX/XX/XXXX These fraudulent accounts have resulted in numerous unauthorized hard inquiries and collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I do not recognize these accounts, collections, or inquiries as they were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All mentioned accounts are the direct result of identity theft and fraud. 

I have attached a copy of my FTC Identity Theft Complaint # XXXX as proof that these accounts and inquiries are fraudulent. 

Please confirm receipt of this request and inform me of the actions taken regarding my credit report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681, section 602 ( a ), consumer reporting agencies must carry out their duties with fairness, impartiality, and respect for consumers ' privacy. XXXX, Experian, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies bound by these principles. As a consumer, I am entitled to ensure my private information is safeguarded, supported by 15 U.S.C. 6801, which obligates financial institutions to protect customers ' nonpublic personal information. 

15 U.S.C. 1681, section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), states that consumer reporting agencies can only furnish a consumer report with the consumer 's written instructions. Neither XXXX, Experian, XXXX, nor any financial institution providing information to these credit agencies has my explicit written consent to share my information. Therefore, any previous consent, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked. 

15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) ( c ) mandates that financial institutions can not disclose nonpublic personal information to third parties without giving consumers the option to opt out. I was not informed of my right to opt out by any information furnishers. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) prohibits consumer reporting agencies from including adverse information older than seven years in a consumer report, except for criminal convictions. The adverse item reported on my account without my consent violates this regulation. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) prohibits furnishing information to a consumer reporting agency if it is known or believed to be inaccurate. Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681e requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain reasonable procedures to avoid violations of section 1681c and limit the furnishing of consumer reports to permissible purposes. 

XXXX, Experian, and XXXX are not adhering to these procedures. Under 12 C.F.R. 1016.7, I am exercising my right to opt out of their reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this FTC Identity Theft Affidavit to report 3separate fraudulent inquiries appearing on my consumer FICO credit report which I do not recognize as reported and which are the result of identity theft and fraud. These fraudulent inquiries have affected my life have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX demand that the aforementioned fraudulent items be removed from each of my consumer credit reports and that all collection activity related to said items cease pursuant to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws.

CFPB Complaint against Credit Reporting Agencies Experian What happened ( statement of pertinent facts ) : Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX SSN ), Consumer Date of Birth : Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the Experian credit reporting agency, block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent inquiries have resulted in several fraudulent inquiries appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

What would be a fair resolution to this issue? ( demand for relief ) : I request, pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), that Experian credit reporting agency block all of the accounts, collections, and hard inquiries identified in this CFPB complaint from my consumer credit file within 4 business days of receiving said complaint. I request that all written confirmation regarding this CFPB complaint be sent to me via email to the email address XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
AFFIANT/BENEFICIARY- .Cartina-Jovanna : XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX SSN XXXX CERTIFIED MAIL # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCT # XXXX XX/XX/year> DEFENDANT-EXPERIAN Information Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject XXXX Notice of Violations of Title 15 USC 1681n, USC 1666b, 1681i, and 1681s for Non-Compliance and Negligence INACCURATE INFORMATION Dear Defendant EXPERIAN I am writing to formally notify you of multiple violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Title 15 USC 1681n, 1681i, and 1681s, which pertain to civil liability for willful noncompliance, procedures in case of disputed accuracy, and responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies. I have identified discrepancies in the reporting of late payments on my account # XXXX with [ XXXX ]. Specifically, the late payments are reported for different months on my XXXX and Experian reports, which is inconsistent and incorrect. Additionally, this account has been deleted from my XXXX report. 
These inaccuracies are a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically USC 1681n ( civil liability for willful noncompliance ) and USC 1666b ( correction of billing errors ). I request that you investigate this matter and correct the inaccuracies in my credit report.

Enclosed are copies of my credit reports from XXXX XXXX Experian highlighting the discrepancies, as well as any supporting documentation. 
Please confirm receipt of this letter and inform me of the results of your investigation at your earliest convenience. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

which constitutes a misrepresentation under USC 1681 ( i ) ( s ).

Specifically, I request the following actions : 1. Provide Documentation : Please provide documents showing where the payment for this account came from.

2. Correct Inaccuracies : Correct the inaccuracies related to this account immediately.

3. Delete the Account : Delete this account from my credit report as it has been removed from Experian and XXXX. 
XXXX. Prevent Future Violations : Ensure compliance with the FCRA to prevent future violations. 
According to Title 15 USC 1681n, any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer for actual damages sustained, punitive damages, and the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees. Additionally, under Title 15 USC 1681i, you are required to follow specific procedures in case of disputed accuracy, and under Title 15 USC 1681s, furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies have specific responsibilities to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information provided.

Failure to address these issues will result in legal action to enforce my rights under the law. This misrepresentation is clearly fraudulent and appears to be maintained for profit. 
Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a written response within 30 days, detailing the steps taken to correct the inaccuracies and prevent future violations. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, .Cartina-Jovanna XXXX XXXX XXXX Living Woman UCC1-308 WITHOUT PREJUDICE BENEFICARY OF acct # XXXX XXXX XXXX NOT THE TRUSTEE THIS LETTER IS EVIDENCE PROVIDED VIA TO THE CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION BUREAU ( CFPB ). THE CFPB IS AUTHORZED TO FULLY INVESTIGATE THIS MATTER AND RECEIVE ANY INFORMATION RELATED TO THERTO. BE ADVISED, IF YOU FAIL TO COMPLY WITH THIS LETTER, I MAY TURN THE MATTER OVER TO A CONSUMER ATTORNEY ALSO YOU MAYBE SUED BY THE CFPB. FOR TREBLE DAMAGES BY ME Sending it via certified mail with a return receipt requested can help ensure that XXXX receives it and you have proof of delivery.

These entries were made without my knowledge or consent, and they violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. # # # Unauthorized Inquiries : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ), a consumer reporting agency may only furnish a consumer report with the explicit authorization of the consumer. The follorwing inquiries were made without my authorization : Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Experian These inquiries were unauthorized and are negatively affecting my credit score. I have contacted the companies responsible, and they have no record of any authorization from me. This violates the FCRA, and I am requesting immediate removal of these inquiries from my credit report. Collection Accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Despite providing all the necessary documentation and complying with the required procedures, the credit reporting agencies have failed to remove the fraudulent items within the legal time frame. These errors have negatively impacted my credit score and have created undue hardship for me. I am seeking your assistance to ensure that these fraudulent items are permanently removed from my credit report and that the credit reporting agencies comply with the obligations set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Team, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against the credit reporting agencies, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX, for their ongoing violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). It appears that these credit bureaus have decided to disregard the law due to their own greed, failing to provide accurate and complete information regarding my credit accounts, which constitutes a violation of Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA.

Furthermore, I am requesting proof of any previous investigations conducted regarding my complaints. I would like to know the methods used in these investigations and request all records of communication with the lenders involved, including : 1.The contact information of the lenders ( name, address, and phone number ).

XXXX is the only bureau that is reporting as paid on time.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX SSN XXXX CERTIFIED MAIL # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCT # XXXX XX/XX/year> DEFENDANT-EXPERIAN Information Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject XXXX Notice of Violations of Title 15 USC 1681n, USC 1666b, 1681i, and 1681s for Non-Compliance and Negligence INACCURATE INFORMATION Dear Defendant EXPERIAN I am writing to formally notify you of multiple violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Title 15 USC 1681n, 1681i, and 1681s, which pertain to civil liability for willful noncompliance, procedures in case of disputed accuracy, and responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies. I have identified discrepancies in the reporting of late payments on my account # XXXX with [ XXXX ]. Specifically, the late payments are reported for different months on my XXXX and Experian reports, which is inconsistent and incorrect. Additionally, this account has been deleted from my XXXX report. 
These inaccuracies are a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically USC 1681n ( civil liability for willful noncompliance ) and USC 1666b ( correction of billing errors ). I request that you investigate this matter and correct the inaccuracies in my credit report.

Enclosed are copies of my credit reports from XXXX XXXX Experian highlighting the discrepancies, as well as any supporting documentation. 
Please confirm receipt of this letter and inform me of the results of your investigation at your earliest convenience. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

which constitutes a misrepresentation under USC 1681 ( i ) ( s ).

Specifically, I request the following actions : 1. Provide Documentation : Please provide documents showing where the payment for this account came from.

2. Correct Inaccuracies : Correct the inaccuracies related to this account immediately. 
XXXX. Delete the Account : Delete this account from my credit report as it has been removed from Experian and XXXX. 
XXXX. Prevent Future Violations : Ensure compliance with the FCRA to prevent future violations.

According to Title 15 USC 1681n, any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer for actual damages sustained, punitive damages, and the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees. Additionally, under Title 15 USC 1681i, you are required to follow specific procedures in case of disputed accuracy, and under Title 15 USC 1681s, furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies have specific responsibilities to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information provided.

Failure to address these issues will result in legal action to enforce my rights under the law. This misrepresentation is clearly fraudulent and appears to be maintained for profit.

Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a written response within 30 days, detailing the steps taken to correct the inaccuracies and prevent future violations.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
