Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my credit report, I identified several inaccuracies related to my XXXX XXXX account ( Account Number : XXXX ), including errors in the reported credit limit, last payment date, term length, late payment activity, and date of the last report. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumer reporting agencies are legally obligated to maintain accurate and complete information. These errors are in violation of this obligation, and they have the potential to misrepresent my financial standing.

Under the authority of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that consumer reporting agencies must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccuracies related to my XXXX XXXX account ( Account Number : XXXX ). The errors include incorrect reporting of the credit limit, last payment date, term length, late payment activity, and date reported.

As required by law, I am requesting that these inaccuracies be thoroughly investigated and corrected. Due to the nature of these violations, I am requesting that this account be completely removed from my credit reports across all three major bureaus within 15 days. Failure to rectify this promptly may result in further legal action to enforce my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602a states - " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' Experian is a consumer reporting agency and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 The financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' I was never informed of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information. Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. Experian is not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services. The following accounts are in violation of my consumer rights and shall be REMOVED IMMEDIATELY! Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  The following accounts are in violation of my consumer rights and shall be REMOVED IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Dispute Request for Removal of Incorrect Addresses, Names, and Employers I am writing to formally dispute incorrect information on my credit report related to my addresses, names, and employers. I have previously submitted disputes to correct this information, but my requests were ignored, and no action has been taken. As a result of your inaction, I am also filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to address your failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Under the FCRA, you are required to ensure the accuracy of the information you report. The following inaccuracies must be corrected immediately : Incorrect Addresses : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Incorrect Names : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Incorrect Employers : XXXX XXXX FCRA Violations and My Rights According to Section 611 of the FCRA, you are required to investigate and resolve disputes within 30 days of receiving notice. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted from my report promptly. Your failure to act on my previous disputes is a violation of this federal requirement.

Additionally, Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA mandates that you maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy. The presence of inaccurate addresses, names, and employers reflects a breach of this duty.

Demand for Immediate Action and Penalties I demand that you : Immediately remove all incorrect addresses, names, and employers from my credit report.

Provide written confirmation of these corrections.

Ensure future inaccuracies are promptly addressed and corrected.

Apply all applicable penalties under the FCRA for failing to address these disputes properly and in a timely manner.

If the requested changes are not made within 14 days, I will pursue legal action for non-compliance and further escalate my complaint with the CFPB.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I expect written confirmation of the corrections within the specified timeframe.

I only have one Correct Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, ohio, XXXX I only have one Correct Spelling of my name when applying for Credit i dont use my middle name : XXXX XXXX I Only have one correct employer : XXXX XXXX XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon checking my personal EXPERIAN account, I realized that I have incorrect information in my credit report. The accounts are : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. There is a record of late payments and that is not correct. 

According to consumer protection, EXPERIAN is violating the following laws : 1. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 and 15 U.S. Code 1681i.

2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of these late payments violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness.

3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payments may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts.

4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information.

5. It should be noted that the dates on which the alleged late payments are being reported coincide with the date on which the covid-19 pandemic began, violating a very important law which is the ''The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security ( CARES ) Act ( 2020 ) '' The dates on which the incorrect late payments appear are described in each account as follows : Account # XXXX dates : XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. 

Account # XXXX, date : XX/XX/year>. 

Account # XXXX, dates : XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. 

Account # XXXX, dates : XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. 

EXPERIAN must respect consumer protection laws and assume its responsibility to take care of citizens and not take advantage of wanting to benefit from inaccurate information.

This is not the first time I have tried to contact experian and they have not shown any interest in resolving the errors they are making and are affecting my credit history.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On both XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>, my XXXX XXXX card was charged {$24.00} by XXXX ( XXXX Experian ). The charged indicated it was a membership fee. I do not have and have never signed up for an Experian membership. I disputed the charge, but XXXX XXXX denied the dispute, stating it was a valid fee. When this did not work, I attempted to sign in to my Experian account and was not able to do so. My password was not recognized, I was unable to reset my password and I was directed to call the company. When I called the number provided, I was not able to reach a person. The system took me in circles and redirected me back to the webpage. Finally, I found a number that connected me to an agent. This person checked my accounts and confirmed that I have no memberships active. They opened a case, which remains open and unresolved. I have called back to check on it multiple times, and no movement has happened. 
The recurrence of the charges in XXXX confirmed that this is part of a membership and XXXX company has ignored my case and request to cancel.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Authorized Representative UCC 1-308 NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX This notice is to inform you that you are unlawfully reporting an unauthorized inaccurate INFORMATION. 

This is my ( 4TH ) time DISPUTING to DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report. The Consumer reports must be accurate this is the law! 

Under the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ), I am a federally protected consumer with rights. Not granting me my rights is in direct violation of 15 USC 1681 and all its subsections. 
XXXX # XXXX : Charged-off account reporting a balance XXXX Charged-off on payment history extending the reporting period. Errors were not corrected on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX # XXXX : Reporting a credit limit on a charged-off account XXXX charged-off on payment history /Errors not corrected on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX # XXXX : Auto loan showing a {$11000.00} balance on a charged-off account ; should report XXXX Charged off on payment history extending the reporting period.Errors were uncorrected on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX # XXXX : Credit card reporting a {$5000.00} limit on a charged-off account. Errors remain after the XXXX dispute. Uncorrected as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX # XXXX : Reporting a {$3000.00} limit on a charged-off account, violating FCRA rights. 3Charged off on payment history extending the reporting period. Errors were not resolved on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX # XXXX : Reporting a {$2000.00} limit incorrectly. Errors unaddressed from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. 2Charged-off on payment history extending the reporting period.Not corrected as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX : Shows a {$19000.00} limit on a charged-off account.9 Charged off on payment history extending the reporting period. Errors were not rectified on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX # XXXX : Balance never updated ; reinvestigation not conducted. 
XXXX # XXXX : Reporting a {$1500.00} limit incorrectly ; errors from XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX uncorrected as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX charge-offs were reported, extending the reporting period. Errors uncorrected as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX charge-offs present, with errors remaining unaddressed since XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX # XXXX : The account was marked as verified ; no reinvestigation was done. 

15 U.S. Code 1681 - Congressional Findings and Statement of Purpose ( b ) REASONABLE PROCEDURES It is the purpose of this subchapter to require that consumer reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures for meeting the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance, and other information in a manner that is fair and equitable to the consumer, with regard to the confidentiality, accuracy, relevancy, and proper utilization of such information in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter. 

15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual whom the report relates. 

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact.

PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something 15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you EXPERIAN are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency. 

You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information 15 USC 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 
In conclusion, I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting.

This is a final opportunity to DELETE these erroneous, inaccurate accounts from my Consumer report.

YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! or I will take legal action for consumer law violation under 15 USC 1681n, 15 USC 1681o and 15 USC 1692k.

DELETE THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT/S FROM YOUR RECORDS This agency is in violation of 15 USC 15 USC 1681i XXXX in your repose to my dispute you claimed that the account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX You have validated inaccurate information and this account is hereby disputed. The information on this account being furnished on my consumer report in fact inaccurate. 

15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) TREATMENT OF INACCURATE OR UNVERIFIABLE INFORMATION ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referenced account, and send out a free copy of my report after the changes have been made will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation of Character ( per se ) 2. Negligent Enablement of Fraud 3. Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692g violations. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15USC 1681 violations for will noncompliance - 616. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Violation of 605B Rule and Unlawful Reinsertion of Fraudulent Accounts Without Notification Issue Summary : I am filing this complaint against Experian for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) specifically related to the unlawful reinsertion of fraudulent accounts into my credit report without proper notification. Details of the Complaint : Two fraudulent accounts were previously removed from m
y credit report after I filed an identity theft dispute under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( 605B ). However, these accounts have since been reinserted into my credit report without notification, which violates 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ( ii ). I never received written or electronic notice of the reinsertion within XXXX business days, as required by law. The fraudulent accounts are : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Acct XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Acct XXXX XXXX These accounts were initially removed due to identity theft, and their reappearance on my credit report without notice constitutes a serious violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. Additionally, the accounts have been reinserted as charge-offs, which is also unlawful because charge-offs representing income are prohibited from being reported on my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ).

Relevant Legal Requirements : Certification Requirement : The FCRA requires the furnisher of the information to certify that it is accurate and complete before it can be reinserted.

Notification Requirement : The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must notify me within XXXX business days of the reinsertion, including the name, address, and phone number of the information furnisher.

To date, Experian has failed to meet these legal requirements.

Supporting Case Law : Cushman v. Trans Union Corp., 115 F.3d 220 ( 3rd Cir. 1997 ) Credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure accuracy.

Dennis v. BEH-1, LLC, 520 F.3d 1066 ( 9th Cir. 2008 ) CRAs are required to notify consumers when information is reinserted.

Pinner v. Schmidt, 805 F.2d 1258 ( 5th Cir. 1986 ) Failure to properly notify consumers of reinsertion violates their rights.

Desired Resolution : I request the following actions from Experian : Immediate removal of the fraudulent accounts from my credit report.

Written confirmation that these accounts will not be reinserted.

Copies of the certification from the furnishers of the information, confirming its accuracy, as required by law prior to reinsertion.

Failure to take immediate corrective action will leave me no choice but to pursue further legal recourse, including filing additional complaints and pursuing claims under the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

Account name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX, Account name : OFFICE OF THE ATTY GENER Account Number # : XXXX, Account name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : # XXXX, Account name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX, has violated my rights. 

15 U.S.C. 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C. 1681 section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C. 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from Experian, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 
Below is why I am requesting all of my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under XXXX XXXX, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance.

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from Experian, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely,
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Inaccurate information I am listing account below that have been reported inaccurately on my credit report. In compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and as a gesture of respect to the Federal Trade Commission Committee on accuracy and completeness of credit information I am formally writing in today to dispute negative information appearing on my credit. This incorrect information is greatly hindering me from getting the credit score I deserve and hopefully, this letter will resolve all the issues on my credit. I demand to see Verifiable Proof ( an original Consumer Contract with my Signature on it ) of the accounts listed below. Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. This company is reporting inaccurate high credit amounts, Last reporting dates, Date last Active, and Date of last payment. In pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681 Congressional Findings, The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. 

Please Remove Accounts and Inquiries listed below XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear XXXX  XXXX, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from Experian, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 
Below is why I am requesting all of my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance.

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from Experian, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Experian for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Experian for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report following XXXX reinvestigations, which is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Account Information : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge Off : XX/XX/2022 Amount : {$0.00} Despite providing clear evidence of the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account and requesting its removal from my credit report, Experian has failed XXXX comply with the law and has retained the inaccurate account information. 
The Fair Credit Reporting Act mandates that if a reinvestigation does not resolve a dispute, the credit bureau must delete the disputed information within five business days. The repeated failure of Experian to adhere to this requirement is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and has caused me financial harm and distress. 
I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take immediate action against Experian for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate deletion of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Experian upholds its obligations under the law. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Last reported XX/XX/year> {$620.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX Original creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Last reported XX/XX/year> {$300.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX Original creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Last reported XX/XX/year> {$230.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX Original creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Last reported XX/XX/year> {$130.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Original creditor XXXX Original creditor is XXXX  on all 4 marks right when my student loans and bankruptcy is off my record almost 2 years ago this creditor is making it so I can never own a credit card and I never once had a credit card in my life ..the way he is marking up my credit I will never be able to use a real actual credit card.. I dont think anyone knows what life is like without one..and my accounts have been frozen for Almost 2 years.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX, and Experian are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and Experian do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, Experian, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX, XXXX, and Experian are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting a formal complaint against the credit reporting agency Experian, which has failed to correct inaccurate information on my credit report following XXXX formal dispute attempts. On both occasions, I provided the necessary documentation to demonstrate that the reported late payments on the account in question were inaccurate. However, the information continues to appear on my credit report without the requested corrections, negatively impacting my credit profile and my ability to access credit on fair terms. 

Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dates of Reported Late Payments : XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/year> It is important to note that this account is only being reported by Experian and does not appear on the reports of other credit bureaus, suggesting a lack of consistency in the reported information. 
Under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ), it is mandated that if the reinvestigation of a dispute does not resolve the consumers complaint, the credit reporting agency must delete the disputed information within five business days following the conclusion of the reinvestigation. Experian has failed to comply with this regulation by retaining the inaccurate information, constituting a direct violation of the FCRA. 
This negligence not only disregards Experians legal obligations but has also caused significant financial harm and emotional distress by impairing my ability to access credit under reasonable conditions. 
I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and intervene to ensure that Experian fulfills its responsibilities under the FCRA. I am requesting the immediate removal of the disputed account from my credit report and the implementation of necessary measures to prevent this situation from recurring. Additionally, I expect to receive confirmation of the actions taken by the CFPB in response to this complaint. 
Enclosed are supporting documents, including copies of the dispute letters sent to Experian, my credit report, and evidence of the inaccuracies in the reported information. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I trust that a prompt resolution will ensure the accuracy and fairness in the handling of my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
DISPUTED INFORMATION : Items in Dispute : Please be officially informed that there are discrepancies or erroneous accounts or Not my accounts at all CREDIT BUREAU VERIFICATION REQUEST ( 3rd Attempt ) NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION Name XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Sent via Priority Mail RE : 3rd and Final request -- -File Number : XXXX DISPUTED INFORMATION : Items in Dispute : Please be officially informed that there are many discrepancies or erroneous accounts on my credit report, and the items listed below are now under dispute as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ). Additionally these items are now in litigation, and until such litigation process is complete, any negative reported items related to these accounts are to be removed. You may retain any non negative items. The references your company has made on the credit report are incorrect due to their lack of completeness and/or accuracy. As stated in FCRA 623 ( b ) ( 1 ), if the information is not entirely 100 % accurate, it must be removed. A response is legally required from you within 15 days of receiving this letter, failing which the disputed item must be permanently deleted from the record.

ITEMS REQUIRING VERIFICATION : The following listed information is disputed directly with you, the furnisher of information, and we are requesting an investigation of the outlined credit lines showing on the credit report : XXXX account XXXX XXXX This was a discharge of debt. It became income and Income CAN NOT BE REPORTED ON MY CREDIT REPORT. 
Also need a GAAP accounting to show original owner XXXX account -- XXXX This was a

discharge of debt. It became income and Income CAN NOT BE REPORTED ON MY CREDIT REPORT. Also need a GAAP accounting to show original owner XXXX XXXX -- account -- XXXX This was a discharge of debt, It became income and is not even loaned by XXXX XXXX. Income CAN NOT BE REPORTED ON MY CREDIT REPORT Also need a GAAP accounting to show original owner XXXX XXXX -- account -- unknown This was a discharge of debt, It became income and is not even loaned by XXXX XXXX Income CAN NOT BE REPORTED ON MY CREDIT REPORT Also need a GAAP accounting to show original owner. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXThis was a discharge of debt, It became income and is not even loaned by XXXX. Income CAN NOT BE REPORTED ON MY CREDIT REPORT Also need a GAAP accounting to show original owner. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXThis was a discharge of debt, It became income and is not even loaned by XXXX. Income CAN NOT BE REPORTED ON MY CREDIT REPORT CFPB complaint was done with company and this was to be removed due to identity theft. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX -- XXXX I have done a CFPB complaint letting this company know I am a victim of identity theft and this debt is not mine. The original creditor recognized that and closed my account and stopped reporting. They are refusing to do so despite FTC reports and CFPB complaints. This debt is not mine. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have no idea what this is. I am a victim of identity theft and this is not mine. This is listed on my FTC report. See FTC report. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This account was never late. Update account to paid as agreed never late. According to 15 USC 1681 603 ( 2 ) ( A ) a consumer report does not contain transactions or experiences. All of the late payments reported are inaccurate and violating my rights as a consumer. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. This account was never late. Update account to paid as agreed never late. According to 15 USC 1681 603 ( 2 ) ( A ) a consumer report does not contain transactions or experiences. All of the late payments reported are inaccurate and violating my rights as a consumer. This account is in dispute currently with XXXX XXXX as I hold the title and security interest in the vehicle. XXXX  XXXX no longer has security interest in the vehicle. Update this account to paid as agreed, never late. 



XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This account was never late. Update account to paid as agreed never late. According to 15 USC 1681 603 ( 2 ) ( A ) a consumer report does not contain transactions or experiences. All of the late payments reported are inaccurate and violating my rights as a consumer.

REQUEST FOR DETAILED VERIFICATION METHOD : We hereby invoke all rights under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 7 ) and FCRA 623, necessitating a comprehensive explanation of the procedures employed to investigate the disputed items. Please note that a simple e-Oscar 2-digit code readout will not suffice.

Regrettably, credit bureaus frequently rely on a mere software that fails to conduct exhaustive investigations, falling short of the legal standards for verification. Our legal team is keenly interested in understanding the process your investigators follow to reach their conclusions.

15 USC 1681 603 ( A ) ( 2 ) ( E ) The term investigative consumer report means a consumer report or portion thereof in which information on a consumers character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living is obtained through personal interviews with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer reported on or with others with whom he is acquainted or who may have knowledge concerning any such items of information. However, such information shall not include specific factual information on a consumers credit record obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from the consumer.

Verification means to make sure one actually owes the alleged debt, see XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). The definition of verification according to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is... averment that the party pleading is ready to establish the truth of what he has set forth. ... The examination of a writing for the purpose of ascertaining its truth ; or a certificate or af idavit that it is true.. The court said Confirmation of the correctness, truth, or authenticity of a pleading, account, or other paper, by an affidavit, oath, or deposition. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) ; and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ) ; and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). 

I request a complete list of all documents and correspondence ( s ) with the original creditor, including, but not limited to : 1. The names and contact details of ALL employees involved in this investigation.

2. Concrete evidence tracing back to the original creditor ; and 3. Comprehensive information about the entire lifecycle of the loan.

4. The identity of the individual or entity that initially issued the loan.

5. The exact date when the loan was granted.

6. The original contact details associated with the loan.

7. Copies of all correspondence and documents sent in relation to this matter.

8. Copies of insurance contracts paying the creditor, securities held as a result of the contract, or tax benefits they have received from holding this account.

If an investigation can not be conducted or the required documents can not be located, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) mandates the removal of the information from the credit reports, including the complete deletion of the account.

However, if an investigation of the account records can be carried out and inaccurately reported information is identified, it is necessary to update the credit reports to accurately reflect this information.

DEBT INVALIDATION NOTICE - Please find enclosed the correspondence sent to the alleged creditor. The absence of a validation response from the creditor automatically invalidates the account, serving as evidence of identity fraud. By law, this account must be expunged from the credit report. We request an updated credit report reflecting the resolution of the account dispute.

NOTICE OF FRAUD ALERT - This serves as a notice that you are now implicated in fraud by verifying information that can not be substantiated/ validated due to the absence of an authenticated contract with the creditor. If the agency fails to remove this information, we will be compelled to initiate legal proceedings for deliberate non-compliance under FCRA 616 and 15 U.S. Code 1681n.

OPPORTUNITY TO CURE - A point-by-point response to these demands in the form of an afidavit is legally required. As the XXXX, He who does not deny, admits, and An unrebutted affidavit stands as truth. According to Restatement 2nd 69, failure to respond within fifteen days will be taken as an admission that the debt is unverified, all legal claims are relinquished and are to be released, and the entity named on the account is a victim of identity fraud. If the debt is not verified, a demand is made to dismiss and withdraw the claim, and rectify any negative credit reporting that may have been associated with the alleged debt for all Credit Reporting Agencies ( CRAs ) and Credit Bureaus ( CBs ).

FINAL APPEAL TO AVOID LITIGATION - Legal proceedings can be costly and are best avoided. If necessary, I am prepared to represent myself in court and file a case in forma pauperis at no cost. However, I understand that your organization may need to engage an attorney, which could be expensive. This is so even if I choose to utilize Small Claims Court and require all claimants only, to appear with evidence and testify with first hand knowledge only. Therefore, this is a sincere attempt to settle this matter before resorting to litigation. I am open to resolving this issue in a private and amicable manner.

Thank you for your consideration and attention to this matter.

x____________________________________ by : NAME, Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved DATED : XXXX NOTARY ACKNOWLEDGEMENT or WITNESS : State of TEXAS in XXXX XXXX WITNESS : ______________________ According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file before the end of the 30 day period beginning on the date you received this notice.

I demand to see Verifiable Proof ( This should be hard evidence that goes all the way back to the original creditor, not verification from a third-party database. ) you have on file of the accounts listed below. Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the accounts. ( This Letter was dated 9-26-23 ) You have Violated the following as well : ( I ) THE SHERMAN ACT, 15 U.S.C. 1, ET SEQ This conspiracy violates Section 1 of the Sherman Act as i can no longer do trade in commerce.

You have violated FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) as well.

Section 609 ( c ) ( 1 ) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( c ) ( 1 ), requires a consumer reporting agency that compiles and maintains files on consumers on a nationwide basis to establish a toll-free telephone number, at which personnel are accessible to consumers during normal business hours. This telephone number must be provided with each written disclosure of information in the consumer 's file, by the consumer reporting agency to the consumer.

THE LIST OF ACCOUNTS BELOW HAS VIOLATED MY FEDERALLY PROTECTED CONSUMER RIGHTS TO PRIVACY AND CONFIDENTIALITY UNDER 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX HAS VIOLATED MY RIGHTS.

AND ACCORDING TO THE FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT WHENEVER A CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY PREPARES A CONSUMER REPORT IT SHALL FOLLOW REASONABLE PROCEDURES TO ASSURE MAXIMUM POSSIBLE ACCURACY OF THE INFORMATION CONCERNING THE INDIVIDUAL ABOUT WHOM THE REPORT RELATES ACCORDING TO 15 USC 1681 ( E ) ( B ).

AND ACCORDING TO 15 USC 1681S TH
EY ARE SUPPOSE TO DO THIS ( 5 ) TREATMENT OF INACCURATE OR UNVERIFIABLE INFORMATION.

( A ) IN GENERAL. IF, AFTER ANY REINVESTIGATION UNDER PARAGRAPH ( 1 ) OF ANY INFORMATION DISPUTED BY A CONSUMER, AN ITEM OF THE INFORMATION IS FOUND TO BE INACCURATE OR INCOMPLETE OR CAN NOT BE VERIFIED, THE CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY SHALL ( I ) PROMPTLY DELETE THAT ITEM OF INFORMATION FROM THE FILE OF THE CONSUMER, OR MODIFY THAT ITEM OF INFORMATION, AS APPROPRIATE, BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE REINVESTIGATION ; AND ( II ) PROMPTLY NOTIFY THE FURNISHER OF THAT INFORMATION THAT THE ITEM HAS BEEN MODIFIED OR DELETED FROM THE FILE OF THE CONSUMER.

AND ACCORDING TO 15 USC 1681C-2 THEY ARE SUPPOSE TO NOT FURNISH ANY INFORMATION RELATING TO A CONSUMER TO ANY CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY IF THE PERSON KNOWS OR HAS REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE THAT THE INFORMATION IS INACCURATE.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the inaccurate reporting of payment information on my credit report. Specifically, your company has reported 30-day late payments for XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>, which is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This information is incorrect and must be removed immediately.

Furthermore, I have confirmed that XXXX XXXX 's business registration is inactive in the state of Texas, and the companys right to transact business has been forfeited. As such, XXXX XXXX lacks the legal authority to report any account or conduct business activities within the state. 

Additionally, I previously informed your company that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, and no efforts were made to properly verify the legitimacy of this account. I have attached business registration details and data breach documentation to support my dispute. 

Outside of these issues, the account must be removed for the inaccurate payment history alone, which I have also included for your reference. 

Please take immediate action to correct these errors and remove this account from my credit report. I expect written confirmation of the removal within 30 days, as required by law.

Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, Subject : Complaint Against Receivables XXXX XXXX for XXXX XXXX FDCPA ( XXXX U.S.C. XXXX ( c ) ) I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for its failure to comply with my request to cease communication as required under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ). 
On XX/XX/year>, I sent a written notice via certified mail to XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, SC XXXX, requesting that they cease all further communication with me regarding the alleged debt associated with account ( s ) number XXXX. I informed them that I refuse to pay the debt of {$1300.00} originally opened on XX/XX/year> and that any further communication should cease immediately, except for the reasons permitted by the FDCPA. 
Despite my written request, I have continued to receive communication from XXXX XXXX XXXX through phone calls, letters. These communications are in direct violation of my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ). 
I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX for violating the FDCPA. I seek your assistance in ensuring that this agency ceases all further communication with me regarding the alleged debt and that any necessary penalties are imposed for their non-compliance.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Validation of a Debt Request Pursuant to 15 USC 1692gb, Cease and Desist Pursaunt 15 USC 1692 ( C ) ( c ) I recently received communication from you attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt. Your initial communication to me in attempt to collect the alleged debt was within 30 days ago.

Please be advised that I hereby dispute the validity of the alleged debt listed above in its entirety.

Further, I request verification of the alleged debt, specifically, a copy of a contract or agreement. Said contract or agreement must be with the original creditor and signed by all parties involved. You are illegally attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt and money that I do not owe.

Cease and desist all collection activity, including all reporting to consumer reporting agencies.

Promptly request deletion of any and all prior reporting made to any consumer reporting agencies. If you comply with my requests above within 14 days, then you are excused from verification.

Further more pursuant 15 USC 1692 ( e ) ( 3 ) False or misleading representations A debt collector may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation or means in connection with the collection of any debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney.

You have no right under the law to send me any type of communication what so ever. Cease and Desist all communication immediately.

Further More You Are attempting to collect an alleged debt where the so called original creditor has falsely represent the character other Violations under 15 USC 1692 e that you are implementing your self.

Violation : 15 USC 1692b ( 5 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 2 ) ( A ) 15 USC 1692e ( 3 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 6 ) ( B ) 15 USC 1692 ( 9 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 10 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 11 ) This letter is CCed to the Bureau of Consumer Protection Finance as evidence may be provided to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). The CFPB is authorized to investigate this fully matter and receive any related information herein. Be advised, if you fail to comply with this demand letter, I may turn the matter over to an attorney ).

Note I am a very litigious consumer, and I will proceed with legal action for all my consumer rights violations under this subchapter plus all remedies and actual damages as a result of your failure pursuant 15 USC 1692K.

If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity shall CEASE and Desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit.

This includes any listing of information to a credit reporting repository/ agency that could be inaccurate or invalidated.

If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 10 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my consumer report, and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX The Following information is required. Please fill out the form below in its entirety.

1. Name and address of Alleged creditor : 2. Name on file of alleged debtor : 3. Alleged Account # : 4. Address on file for alleged debtor : 5. Amount of alleged debt : 6. Date this alleged became payable : 7. Date of original charge off or delinquency : 8. Was this debt assigned to a debt collector or purchased? No Yes 9. Amount Paid if debt was purchased : 10. Commission for debt if collection efforts are successful : Please attach copies of the following : Agreement with your client that grants COLLECTION COMPANY NAME the authority to collect this alleged debt.

Signed agreement Debtor has made with Debt Collector, or other verifiable proof Debtor has a contractual obligation to pay Debt collector.

Any agreement that bears the signature of Debtor, wherein agreed to pay Creditor.

All statements while this account was open.

Have any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account?

o Yes o No Have any Judgements been obtained by any creditor regarding this account?

o Yes o No Please provide me the name and address of the bonding agent for COLLECTION COMPANY NAME, in case legal action becomes necessary : Date : Authorized Signature of Creditor You must return this completed form along with copies of all requested information, assignments or other transfer agreements, which would establish your right to collect this alleged debt within 30 calendar days from the date of receipt of this letter.

Your Claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of this form is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for Validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

Please allow 30 calendar days for processing after I receive this information.

Thank You.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint Improper Debt Verification and Illegal Reporting Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to submit a formal complaint against Credit Collection Service for improperly reporting a debt on my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This company has failed to contact me or provide any proper validation of the alleged debt, as required by federal law. 

I do not believe that this debt is valid, nor have I had any prior dealings with Credit Collection Services. Furthermore, I suspect that this company illegally obtained my personal information and improperly used it to report inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. 

Under the FCRA, companies reporting debts must take the following steps : Provide written notice of the debt within five days of first contact.

Offer me the opportunity to dispute the debt and request validation within 30 days.

Upon dispute, supply proper documentation that validates the debt, including any original agreements or contracts with my signature.

Credit Collection Services has failed to follow these legal requirements. They did not notify me, provide any form of communication, or supply proper documentation verifying this debt. Reporting unverified information is not only unethical but also illegal under the FCRA. 

I am demanding that XXXX XXXX XXXX remove this unverified and inaccurate debt from my credit report immediately. If this issue is not resolved within 14 days of receiving this letter, I will have no choice but to pursue legal action against the company for violations of my consumer rights. 

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter promptly to ensure compliance and protect my credit profile from further harm. I also ask that written confirmation be provided once this debt is removed. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company can't verify or dispute the facts in the complaint

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: I sold my home in XXXX with which a transfer of a solar panel loan was involved. Before my home sold, we secured an approved transfer of the loan to the buyer ( the process itself was very difficult and the company tried to deny the buyer of the home multiple times without explanation ). After we received an approval, we submitted the transfer and assumption paperwork and our home sold to the buyers a few days later. In XXXX I received notification that the account was in collections in my name, and the company denied ever issuing the approvals even though we have everything in writing and on company letterhead, and emails! They said they issued a denial via mail without informing any of the parties involved in the home sale, days after issuing the approval and only two days prior to when our home was set to be sold to out of state buyers. After I spent countless hours on the phone and via email attempting to resolve this, I am at a standstill. Since XXXX, the company accepted their approval of the loan, and transferred to the buyer. My credit report is still affected almost 90 days later, and as of last week this debt was temporarily removed. This week, the debt was reinstated on my credit report as belonging to me after I submitted a dispute directly with the credit bureau. My credit score was negatively impacted by at last XXXX points for the last 4 months minimum, and it's caused an incredible amount of stress, I've not been able to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX or even open up a new high yield savings account. An account executive confirmed last week XX/XX/XXXX on the phone that in order for it to be re-instated on my credit report, it needs to be confirmed by the company that the information is accurate ( meaning they reinstated the debt and missed payments as belonging to me ). The company also fraudulently back dated the payoff dates in my payment portal to show the loan was paid off XX/XX/XXXX, which is at 10 days before our home sold, to cover up this entire situation. I have proof that this was not done until at least XX/XX/XXXX ( this account view that I downloaded shows the debt on my portal, delinquency letters, etc ). Multiple times throughout this process I requested proof of submission of the correction sent to the credit bureaus, and nothing was provided. The company refused to take accountability for this situation or attempt to resolve this. The account executive I spoke with XX/XX/XXXX had empathy, but also acknowledged this ridiculous situation as something that should never have happened. I have filed formal reports on the company 's website, with the IL Attorney General, with the XXXX and now with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. I have spent an incredible amount of time trying to resolve this myself ( over XXXX hours of work XXXX, phone calls, emails, report filings, consultations with lawyers ) when it should have never been my situation to begin with, it's caused an incredible amount of stress and damage to my financial situation the last 6 months. I am certain that our only way forward on the path to resolution is going to be with legal assistance, and ensuring that this company does not do this again to other people.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against the Huntington Bank XXXX located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, IL XXXX. In the XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

On XX/XX/year> during the morning time. I had a concerning experience with one of the tellers, named XXXX, who was assisting me with my account. During my visit, I had to briefly step aside to make a phone call to my husband. 

Upon returning to the line,. I requested XXXX not to discuss my situation with XXXX and indicated that I was willing to wait for her assistance. Despite my request, XXXX abruptly informed me that she could not help me and directed me to XXXX. XXXX proceeded to process my transaction, and as I was leaving the bank, he called out my name and made unwarranted remarks about my behavior towards XXXX. Allies exact words where XXXX let this be the last time you yell at XXXX, this better be the last one you come in here to yell at XXXX otherwise I will talk to the XXXX and make sure you dont step foot in this office every again XXXX XXXX was not talking to me he yelled this out to me as I was walking out the banking center. While other customers were present. I found Allies behavior to be unprofessional and disrespectful. I am an XXXX  customer with XXXX  XXXX. It may seem like Im talking loudly but it is never on purpose. This is something they do not know or have respect for. No customer should be subjected to such treatment by bank staff. I expect a certain level of professionalism and courtesy when interacting with bank employees, and this experience fell far below my expectations. XXXX 's conduct towards me was nothing short of disrespectful and intimidating. Instead of allowing me to voice my concerns, he threatened me with consequences, including reporting me to the XXXX and barring me from the banking center. This public display of aggression and lack of respect left me feeling deeply humiliated and disrespected in front of other clients present at the time. Dolly Vega 1 ( 312 ) 270-9022

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Debt Amount : {$330.00} Creditor : Midland Credit Management , Inc . 
Date Submitted XX/XX/year> **Key Points of My Dispute : ** 1. **Inaccuracy of Reporting ( FCRA 1681s-2 ) : ** I believe the reported debt is inaccurate, as I have no record of incurring this obligation. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, specifically 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information to credit reporting agencies.

2. **Failure to Validate Debt ( FCRA 1692g ) : ** I invoked my right under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 1692g, to request validation of the debt. To date, I have not received any documentation from Midland Credit Management proving the legitimacy of this debt, which is a violation of my rights. 

3. **Obsolete Information ( FCRA 1681c ) : ** The FCRA, specifically 1681c, prohibits the reporting of debts that are outdated or incomplete. If this debt is tied to an account that exceeds the reporting period or lacks essential details, it should not remain on my credit report. 

I have requested that Midland Credit Management conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and provide written confirmation of their findings. I am seeking the removal of this debt from my credit report if it can not be validated as they are violating my rights.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Account sold or transferred to another company
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern at Synchrony Bank/XXXX  , I am writing to formally file a complaint against Synchrony Bank ( SYNCB ) for inaccurately reporting late payments related to a closed account and for illegally reporting transaction history and income. These actions violate several federal consumer protection laws, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Privacy Act of 1974. 

Violations Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) - Accuracy and Fairness of Credit Reporting Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), furnishers of credit information must implement reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information reported. SYNCB has failed to verify the accuracy of the late payments on my closed account. SYNCB has not provided any validation or sufficient documentation to support these claims. Consequently, my credit report contains false and misleading information that undermines my creditworthiness.

Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681b - Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports According to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies may only furnish a consumer 's report with my consent or for permissible purposes. SYNCB is illegally reporting transaction history and income, which is not permissible under IRS guidelines. I did not authorize the release of this inaccurate information, and my consent has not been properly obtained or documented.

Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), furnishers like SYNCB are prohibited from reporting information if they know or have reasonable cause to believe the information is inaccurate. The late payments being reported are indeed inaccurate, and SYNCB is violating this provision by continuing to report them. Additionally, SYNCB has a duty under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) to correct or update information after a consumer disputes its accuracy. Despite my disputes regarding these late payments, SYNCB has failed to make the necessary corrections.

Violation of the Privacy Act of 1974 SYNCB has an obligation under the Privacy Act of 1974 to protect the privacy of its customers ' financial information. The ongoing reporting of inaccurate late payments without proper validation and disclosure violates my privacy rights and exposes my personal information to third parties without authorization. SYNCB has no
t sufficiently safeguarded my financial information nor provided the required disclosures.

Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681c - Illegal Reporting of Transactions Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ), certain adverse information, including late payments, can not be reported to consumer reporting agencies if it falls outside the permissible scope outlined by the law. SYNCB is currently reporting late payments related to a closed account, which is illegal under the FCRA. This is a direct violation of consumer reporting guidelines and must be immediately corrected.

Violation of 12 CFR 1022.43 - Investigations of Disputes According to 12 CFR 1022.43, if a consumer disputes the accuracy of information being reported, the furnisher must investigate and respond promptly. I have notified SYNCB of the inaccuracies related to late payments on my closed account ; however, they have not conducted a reasonable investigation or provided a timely resolution. This failure constitutes a violation of the law. 
Ongoing Trading on a Closed Account Despite the account being officially closed, SYNCB continues to engage in trading activities related to this account. This practice misrepresents the account 's status and raises serious legal concerns regarding compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, SYNCB is prohibited from reporting any information that misleads consumers about the nature of their accounts. The continued trading on a closed account constitutes a violation of these provisions and undermines my rights as a consumer.

Securities Fraud and Lack of Full Disclosure SYNCBs actions may constitute securities fraud, particularly in light of the lack of transparency regarding financial transactions. The statements I received imply that a payment due is linked to trading activities involving assets assigned to SYNCB for their financial gain. This not only violates the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 but also raises questions about SYNCBs compliance with 15 U.S.C. 78j ( b ), which prohibits deceptive practices in connection with the purchase or sale of securities. The absence of full disclosure regarding how my payments and transactions are handled is a blatant disregard for my rights and trust as a consumer.

Failure to Disclose Accounting Practices SYNCBs failure to disclose accounting practices related to my closed account represents a violation of 15 U.S.C. 6801, which mandates that financial institutions take appropriate measures to safeguard the privacy and confidentiality of consumer information. By not providing clear and accurate documentation regarding how my payments and transactions are recorded, SYNCB is breaching this privacy obligation and potentially violating consumer protection laws designed to promote transparency and fairness. Such practices can lead to severe financial repercussions and further mental anguish for me as the affected party. 

Failure to Provide Notice and Opt-Out Opportunity SYNCB has failed to provide the required notice regarding my right to opt out of reporting my nonpublic personal information to non-affiliated third parties, as mandated by 15 U.S.C. 6802. Creditors are required to provide notice and an opt-out option before sharing such information. The lack of this notice implies a violation of my privacy rights and compliance obligations under the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidelines.

Demand for Action I demand that SYNCB : Correct the reporting on my account to reflect paid as agreed or paid in full.

Direct all payments and securities transferred or assigned to third parties back to me in good faith.

Provide written confirmation of the actions taken.

Damages Due to the mental anguish and emotional distress caused by SYNCB 's actions, I am seeking damages in the amount of {$10000.00}. Additionally, for all other related damages outside the court of law, I am requesting {$50000.00}. If we can not reach an agreement, please be advised that I will provide my fee schedule upon litigation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Seized or attempted to seize your property
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been in private litigation with Bridgecrest since XX/XX/year> ; this dispute has requested evidence proving that I owe a debt they think I must pay. A Bridgecrest representative called my phone and stated that I owned my vehicle! How do I pay for a car that I own? Bridgecrest counsel received my response to their letter on XX/XX/year>. However, I received an email on XX/XX/year> stating, " Payment is needed on or before XX/XX/year> to prevent your vehicle from being assigned for repossession. '' Not only is this threat to put me and my family in a dispossession of what is ours a constitutional violation, but it is also a violation of the FDCPA. As a consumer and creditor under the FDCPA, I have invoked my rights to the information I requested to no avail. Bridgecrest has harassed, abused, and attempted to oppress me by way of threats, obscene language, and harassing me on the phone. Bridgecrest has engaged in deceptive acts to threaten to take legal action, seize my property, and imply that I have committed a crime. It has been unfair that Bridgecrest has continued throughout private litigation to collect any amount from me, threatened to take nonjudicial action depriving me of my due process, and use language in which is in connection with this debt collection. Bridgecrest should know as a debt collector, they have no standing to take any legal action against me & any payment foregoing is not an admission of liability.

Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to address a concerning issue I've encountered regarding my ability to access my credit score online through your platform and other third party websites. Despite being a valued customer and diligently managing my credit, I have encountered difficulties in accessing my credit score online. As a consumer, I am well aware of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant credit laws. These laws emphasize the importance of accurate and timely access to credit information, which is crucial for informed financial decision-making. I believe it is my right to access my credit score through your online platform, as stipulated by credit laws that govern credit reporting agencies like Equifax. I would like to draw your attention to the fact that the FCRA requires credit reporting agencies to provide consumers with access to their credit scores, enabling them to stay informed about their credit standing.

I have no connection to these accounts and urgently request their immediate removal to prevent further harm to my financial well-being.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Equifax Information Services LLC for their failure to adequately respond to multiple inquiries regarding unauthorized changes to my address on my credit report. These unauthorized changes occurred on XX/XX/year>, and XX/XX/year>. 

I have filed several disputes with Equifax to investigate the matter, under the following dispute numbers : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. 

In each instance, I specifically requested information on the creditor or entity responsible for initiating these unauthorized changes to my address. However, despite multiple requests, Equifax has continuously failed to provide this critical information. Instead, their responses have been irrelevant to my requests, dodging my direct inquiries about the identity of the creditor involved.

This pattern of avoidance is concerning, as the unauthorized changes have affected the accuracy of my credit file, and the lack of transparency on the part of Equifax has further exacerbated my frustration with this matter. I am now seeking the assistance of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to ensure that Equifax complies with its obligations to provide me with the information I am entitled to under the law.

Please help facilitate a thorough investigation into this issue, and hold Equifax accountable for their failure to respond appropriately to my requests.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
