Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am formally submitting a complaint against all credit agencies for multiple violations of federal consumer protection laws, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Privacy Act of 1974. These violations have caused me significant harm, including financial loss and emotional distress.

Violations Breach of Privacy The unauthorized furnishing of my account information by third parties has compromised my trust and potentially exposed my identity to unknown entities. This violates 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 602.

Lack of Written Consent You are required to obtain my written consent before adding any information to my consumer report. Since I did not authorize these actions, you are in violation of the FCRA. 

Illegal Reporting of Transaction History The reporting of my transaction history and income discrepancies in violation of IRS guidelines, including certificates of indebtedness, is illegal. This false and misleading reporting has caused me severe harm and mental anguish.

Identity Theft Violation According to 12 CFR 1022.3, identity theft involves using another person 's identifying information without authorization. This definition applies to the fraudulent activity related to my account. 

Unwanted Emails and Phone Calls I have received numerous unwanted emails and phone calls during business hours from fraudulent companies. This constant disruption is unacceptable and violates my rights.

Verification of Identity Credit agencies must verify the identity of prospective users before furnishing a consumer report. You have failed to ensure that reports were furnished for permissible purposes as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681b.

Inaccuracy of Reporting Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), you must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. Your failure to comply with sections 1681b and 1681c demonstrates a lack of adherence to these requirements.

Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance As stated in 15 U.S.C. 1681n, any person who willfully fails to comply with the FCRA is liable for damages. I am entitled to {$1000.00} for each violation due to your noncompliance, which totals {$8000.00} based on the eight violations outlined above.

Emotional Distress The ongoing violations have caused me over four years of duress, significantly disrupting my quality of life. 

Demands I demand immediate correction of false and misleading information reported by XXXX and XXXX, along with the removal of all related inquiries. If we can not come to an agreement, please be advised that I will pursue this matter in federal court. 

Next Steps If these issues are not resolved immediately, I will escalate my complaints to the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the Securities and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) regarding potential securities fraud. 

I expect all credit agencies to take responsibility for these violations. I demand the removal of any outdated or duplicate addresses, phone numbers, and incorrect name variations from my report. Should you fail to address these matters, I will pursue legal action against the credit agencies and their executives for securities fraud. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Reviewing my credit report I get 4 hard inquiries that are not correct EQUIFAX Disputed Inquiry XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX, Unspecified. 


EQUIFAX is violating the following laws : Basis for Dispute Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) states that I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these unauthorized inquiries and remove them from my credit report.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report.

Upon checking my personal EQUIFAX account, I realized that I have incorrect information in my credit report. The accounts are : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. There is a record of late payments and that is not correct. 

According to consumer protection, EQUIFAX is violating the following laws : 1. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 and 15 U.S. Code 1681i.

2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of these late payments violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness. 

3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payments may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts.

4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information.

5. It should be noted that the dates on which the alleged late payments are being reported coincide with the date on which the covid-19 pandemic began, violating a very important law which is the ''The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security ( CARES ) Act XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX '' The dates on which the incorrect late payments appear are described in each account as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

EQUIFAX must respect consumer protection laws and assume its responsibility to take care of citizens and not take advantage of wanting to benefit from inaccurate information. 

This is not the first time I have tried to contact experian and they have not shown any interest in resolving the errors they are making and are affecting my credit history.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Equifax for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ). 
Account Information : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge XXXX Amount : {$0.00} I previously submitted a dispute to Equifax regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, Equifax failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report. 
As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Equifax 's failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress. 
I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Equifax for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Equifax upholds its obligations under the law. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative: A FCRA violation refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies ( CRAs ) follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports.If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter is not 100 % correct and i demand them to be investigated completely.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681, section 602 ( a ), consumer reporting agencies must carry out their duties with fairness, impartiality, and respect for consumers ' privacy. Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies bound by these principles. As a consumer, I am entitled to ensure my private information is safeguarded, supported by 15 U.S.C. 6801, which obligates financial institutions to protect customers ' nonpublic personal information.

15 U.S.C. 1681, section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), states that consumer reporting agencies can only furnish a consumer report with the consumer 's written instructions. Neither Equifax, XXXX, XXXX, nor any financial institution providing information to these credit agencies has my explicit written consent to share my information. Therefore, any previous consent, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked. 

15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) ( c ) mandates that financial institutions can not disclose nonpublic personal information to third parties without giving consumers the option to opt out. I was not informed of my right to opt out by any information furnishers. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) prohibits consumer reporting agencies from including adverse information older than seven years in a consumer report, except for criminal convictions. The adverse item reported on my account without my consent violates this regulation.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) prohibits furnishing information to a consumer reporting agency if it is known or believed to be inaccurate. Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681e requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain reasonable procedures to avoid violations of section 1681c and limit the furnishing of consumer reports to permissible purposes. 

Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are not adhering to these procedures. Under 12 C.F.R. 1016.7, I am exercising my right to opt out of their reporting services.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my credit report, I identified several inaccuracies related to my XXXX XXXX account ( Account XXXX : XXXX ), including errors in the reported credit limit, last payment date, term length, late payment activity, and date of the last report. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumer reporting agencies are legally obligated to maintain accurate and complete information. These errors are in violation of this obligation, and they have the potential to misrepresent my financial standing. 
Under the authority of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that consumer reporting agencies must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccuracies related to my XXXX XXXX account ( Account XXXX : XXXX ). The errors include incorrect reporting of the credit limit, last payment date, term length, late payment activity, and date reported. 

As required by law, I am requesting that these inaccuracies be thoroughly investigated and corrected. Due to the nature of these violations, I am requesting that this account be completely removed from my credit reports across all three major bureaus within 15 days. Failure to rectify this promptly may result in further legal action to enforce my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer, Financial Protection Bureau I sent a dispute letter on XX/XX/year>, to XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX about inaccurate and incomplete information that is being furnished on my consumer report Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX. 

This is the letter I sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year>. 

you furnished alleged transaction on my XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax that you identified as late. 
15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction ( 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; My transactions and experiences with your company are excluded from the consumer report.

You have no right to furnish my transactions and experiences when the law clearly states that this information is excluded from my consumer reports. 

The only way a creditor can treat a payment as late falls under 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) Time to Make Payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 
In order for any creditor to treat a payment as late you must prove that : The information required under 15 USC 1637 ( b ) of this title was mailed out or delivered 21 Days before the payment due date please provide the proof that this information was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) is very specific on all required information needed or that must be mailed or delivered to the consumer! You have 10 days to send me all the required information. 
A creditor can not treat a payment as late without complying with this section of the law! I request in good faith under rule 1002 the documents that shows proof that the information pursuant section 15 USC 1666b and 1637 ( b ) of this title was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date.

Do not rely to me stating that you are furnishing accurate information because we both know your not.

Do not tell me this information is verified because you have not submitted proof of compliance with section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai and 15 USC 1666b & 1637 ( b ).

If you can not provide the proof of the mailing or delivery of the information required by section 1666b you can not treat a payment as late which means you have also violated section 15 USC 1681s-2. You have 10 Calendar days from the receipt of this notice to provide the required information or delete the transaction you have listed as late : It has been well over 30 days XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX and Achieve Personal Loans hasnt responded to my letter. This information by law must be deleted Immediately off my Consumer ReporXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX { XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX  } by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX } ( USPS TRACKING ) XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX  ) by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX ) ( USPS TRACKING ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX ) by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX ) ( USPS TRACKING

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. FDCPA 807 states that these NEGATIVE accounts are misleading false reporting. 
Under 15 USC 1681b - permissible purpose of consumer reports. THE LAW STATES ( a ) In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Under 15 U.S. Code 6802 - I have the right to opt out of any information shared to a financial institution, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice, which I have not received.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear XXXX XXXX, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from XXXX, Equifax and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 

I have sent several notices with a list of XXXX documents to validate the debt but was only sent the loan documents, the note ( not the stamped paid in full copy ) and I requested a signed, certified penalty under purjury affadavit to validate their claim they loaned me money and validate the loan wasn't satisfied at closing. I have yet to receive all requested documents. Instead, they tried to foreclose. 


Below is why I am requesting all my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance. 

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from XXXX, Equifax and XXXX XXXX immediately. My next step is to file my lawsuit to show the securities fraud, breach of contract and compel them to enter all requested documents into discovery to prove my claim. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, Beneficiary Without Prejudice, All Rights Reserved

DISPUTED INFORMATION : Items in Dispute : Please be officially informed that there are discrepancies or erroneous accounts or Not my accounts at all CREDIT BUREAU VERIFICATION REQUEST ( 3rd Attempt ) NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION Name XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX SS # XXXX Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Sent via Priority Mail RE : 3rd and Final request -- -File NumberXXXX DISPUTED INFORMATION : Items in Dispute : Please be officially informed that there are many discrepancies or erroneous accounts on my credit report, and the items listed below are now under dispute as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ). Additionally these items are now in litigation, and until such litigation process is complete, any negative reported items related to these accounts are to be removed. You may retain any non negative items. The references your company has made on the credit report are incorrect due to their lack of completeness and/or accuracy. As stated in FCRA 623 ( b ) ( 1 ), if the information is not entirely 100 % accurate, it must be removed. A response is legally required from you within 15 days of receiving this letter, failing which the disputed item must be permanently deleted from the record.

ITEMS REQUIRING VERIFICATION : The following listed information is disputed directly with you, the furnisher of information, and we are requesting an investigation of the outlined credit lines showing on the credit report : XXXX account -- XXXX This was a discharge of debt. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX REQUEST FOR DETAILED VERIFICATION METHOD : We hereby invoke all rights under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 7 ) and FCRA 623, necessitating a comprehensive explanation of the procedures employed to investigate the disputed items. Please note that a simple e-Oscar 2-digit code readout will not suffice.

Regrettably, credit bureaus frequently rely on a mere software that fails to conduct exhaustive investigations, falling short of the legal standards for verification. Our legal team is keenly interested in understanding the process your investigators follow to reach their conclusions.

15 USC 1681 603 ( A ) ( 2 ) ( E ) The term investigative consumer report means a consumer report or portion thereof in which information on a consumers character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living is obtained through personal interviews with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer reported on or with others with whom he is acquainted or who may have knowledge concerning any such items of information. However, such information shall not include specific factual information on a consumers credit record obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from the consumer.

Verification means to make sure one actually owes the alleged debt, see XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). The definition of verification according to Black 's Law Dictionary is... averment that the party pleading is ready to establish the truth of what he has set forth. ... The examination of a writing for the purpose of ascertaining its truth ; or a certificate or af idavit that it is true.. The court said Confirmation of the correctness, truth, or authenticity of a pleading, account, or other paper, by an affidavit, oath, or deposition. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) ; and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) ; and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ). 

I request a complete list of all documents and correspondence ( s ) with the original creditor, including, but not limited to : 1. The names and contact details of ALL employees involved in this investigation.

2. Concrete evidence tracing back to the original creditor ; and 3. Comprehensive information about the entire lifecycle of the loan.

4. The identity of the individual or entity that initially issued the loan.

5. The exact date when the loan was granted.

6. The original contact details associated with the loan.

7. Copies of all correspondence and documents sent in relation to this matter.

8. Copies of insurance contracts paying the creditor, securities held as a result of the contract, or tax benefits they have received from holding this account.

If an investigation can not be conducted or the required documents can not be located, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) mandates the removal of the information from the credit reports, including the complete deletion of the account.

However, if an investigation of the account records can be carried out and inaccurately reported information is identified, it is necessary to update the credit reports to accurately reflect this information.

DEBT INVALIDATION NOTICE - Please find enclosed the correspondence sent to the alleged creditor. The absence of a validation response from the creditor automatically invalidates the account, serving as evidence of identity fraud. By law, this account must be expunged from the credit report. We request an updated credit report reflecting the resolution of the account dispute.

NOTICE OF FRAUD ALERT - This serves as a notice that you are now implicated in fraud by verifying information that can not be substantiated/ validated due to the absence of an authenticated contract with the creditor. If the agency fails to remove this information, we will be compelled to initiate legal proceedings for deliberate non-compliance under FCRA 616 and 15 U.S. Code 1681n.

OPPORTUNITY TO CURE - A point-by-point response to these demands in the form of an afidavit is legally required. As the XXXX, He who does not deny, admits, and An unrebutted affidavit stands as truth. According to Restatement 2nd 69, failure to respond within fifteen days will be taken as an admission that the debt is unverified, all legal claims are relinquished and are to be released, and the entity named on the account is a victim of identity fraud. If the debt is not verified, a demand is made to dismiss and withdraw the claim, and rectify any negative credit reporting that may have been associated with the alleged debt for all Credit Reporting Agencies ( CRAs ) and Credit Bureaus ( CBs ).

FINAL APPEAL TO AVOID LITIGATION - Legal proceedings can be costly and are best avoided. If necessary, I am prepared to represent myself in court and file a case in forma pauperis at no cost. However, I understand that your organization may need to engage an attorney, which could be expensive. This is so even if I choose to utilize Small Claims Court and require all claimants only, to appear with evidence and testify with first hand knowledge only. Therefore, this is a sincere attempt to settle this matter before resorting to litigation. I am open to resolving this issue in a private and amicable manner.

Thank you for your consideration and attention to this matter.

'' Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies Equifax and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to Equifax, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Equifax for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report following two reinvestigations, which is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Account Information : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge Off : XX/XX/year> Amount : {$0.00} Despite providing clear evidence of the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account and requesting its removal from my credit report, Equifax has failed to comply with the law and has retained the inaccurate account information.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act mandates that if a reinvestigation does not resolve a dispute, the credit bureau must delete the disputed information within five business days. The repeated failure of Equifax to adhere to this requirement is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and has caused me financial harm and distress.

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take immediate action against Equifax for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate deletion of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Equifax upholds its obligations under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear XXXX  XXXX, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from XXXX, Equifax and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 
Below is why I am requesting all of my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance.

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from XXXX, Equifax and XXXX XXXX immediately.

The follorwing inquiries were made without my authorization : Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These inquiries were unauthorized and are negatively affecting my credit score. I have contacted the companies responsible, and they have no record of any authorization from me. This violates the FCRA, and I am requesting immediate removal of these inquiries from my credit report. Collection Accounts : XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Despite providing all the necessary documentation and complying with the required procedures, the credit reporting agencies have failed to remove the fraudulent items within the legal time frame. These errors have negatively impacted my credit score and have created undue hardship for me. I am seeking your assistance to ensure that these fraudulent items are permanently removed from my credit report and that the credit reporting agencies comply with the obligations set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Team, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to seek your assistance regarding an issue I have encountered with a credit bureau that has refused to update my personal information as per my rights as a consumer. 
I have made several requests to the credit bureau to ensure that only the address listed on my identification is maintained on my credit profile. Despite my repeated attempts, they have not complied with my request. I would like to understand if the law permits them to disregard my rights as a consumer in this matter. 
I believe that consumers have the right to have accurate and updated information on their credit profiles, and I am concerned that my rights are not being upheld. I would appreciate any guidance or support you can provide to help resolve this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative: Recently, i did an investigation on my credit report and found severel items that are unauthorized and there are to be inaccurate information. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. Please remove the following items from my credit report, Immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX , This inquiry are not authorized, Please Remove all from my credit report Immediately.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am formally submitting a complaint against all credit agencies for multiple violations of federal consumer protection laws, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Privacy Act of 1974. These violations have caused me significant harm, including financial loss and emotional distress.

Violations Breach of Privacy The unauthorized furnishing of my account information by third parties has compromised my trust and potentially exposed my identity to unknown entities. This violates 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 602.

Lack of Written Consent You are required to obtain my written consent before adding any information to my consumer report. Since I did not authorize these actions, you are in violation of the FCRA. 

Illegal Reporting of Transaction History The reporting of my transaction history and income discrepancies in violation of IRS guidelines, including certificates of indebtedness, is illegal. This false and misleading reporting has caused me severe harm and mental anguish.

Identity Theft Violation According to 12 CFR 1022.3, identity theft involves using another person 's identifying information without authorization. This definition applies to the fraudulent activity related to my account. 

Unwanted Emails and Phone Calls I have received numerous unwanted emails and phone calls during business hours from fraudulent companies. This constant disruption is unacceptable and violates my rights.

Verification of Identity Credit agencies must verify the identity of prospective users before furnishing a consumer report. You have failed to ensure that reports were furnished for permissible purposes as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681b.

Inaccuracy of Reporting Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), you must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. Your failure to comply with sections 1681b and 1681c demonstrates a lack of adherence to these requirements.

Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance As stated in 15 U.S.C. 1681n, any person who willfully fails to comply with the FCRA is liable for damages. I am entitled to {$1000.00} for each violation due to your noncompliance, which totals {$8000.00} based on the eight violations outlined above.

Emotional Distress The ongoing violations have caused me over four years of duress, significantly disrupting my quality of life.

Demands I demand immediate correction of false and misleading information reported by XXXX and XXXX, along with the removal of all related inquiries. If we can not come to an agreement, please be advised that I will pursue this matter in federal court.

Next Steps If these issues are not resolved immediately, I will escalate my complaints to the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the Securities and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) regarding potential securities fraud.

I expect all credit agencies to take responsibility for these violations. I demand the removal of any outdated or duplicate addresses, phone numbers, and incorrect name variations from my report. Should you fail to address these matters, I will pursue legal action against the credit agencies and their executives for securities fraud. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer, Financial Protection Bureau I sent a dispute letter on XX/XX/year>, to Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and ACHIEVE PERSONAL LOANS about inaccurate and incomplete information that is being furnished on my consumer report XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX. 

This is the letter I sent to XXXX XXXX  XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and ACHIEVE Personal Loans XX/XX/year>. 

you furnished alleged transaction on my XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX that you identified as late. 
15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction ( 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; My transactions and experiences with your company are excluded from the consumer report. 
You have no right to furnish my transactions and experiences when the law clearly states that this information is excluded from my consumer reports. 

The only way a creditor can treat a payment as late falls under 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) Time to Make Payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 
In order for any creditor to treat a payment as late you must prove that : The information required under 15 USC 1637 ( b ) of this title was mailed out or delivered 21 Days before the payment due date please provide the proof that this information was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) is very specific on all required information needed or that must be mailed or delivered to the consumer! You have 10 days to send me all the required information.

A creditor can not treat a payment as late without complying with this section of the law! I request in good faith under rule 1002 the documents that shows proof that the information pursuant section 15 USC 1666b and 1637 ( b ) of this title was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date.

Do not rely to me stating that you are furnishing accurate information because we both know your not.

Do not tell me this information is verified because you have not submitted proof of compliance with section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai and 15 USC 1666b & 1637 ( b ). 
If you can not provide the proof of the mailing or delivery of the information required by section 1666b you can not treat a payment as late which means you have also violated section 15 USC 1681s-2. You have 10 Calendar days from the receipt of this notice to provide the required information or delete the transaction you have listed as late : It has been well over 30 days Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and Achieve Personal Loans hasnt responded to my letter. This information by law must be deleted Immediately off my Consumer Report XXXX XXXX  XXXX { XX/XX/year>, XXXX am } by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX } ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/year>, XXXX am ) by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX ) ( XXXX XXXX ) ACHIEVE PERSONAL LOANS ( XX/XX/year>, XXXX am ) by certified mail tracking number # ( XXXX ) ( XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Validation of a Debt Request Pursuant to 15 USC 1692gb, Cease and Desist Pursaunt 15 USC 1692 ( C ) ( c ) I recently received communication from you attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt. Your initial communication to me in attempt to collect the alleged debt was within 30 days ago. 
Please be advised that I hereby dispute the validity of the alleged debt listed above in its entirety. 
Further, I request verification of the alleged debt, specifically, a copy of a contract or agreement. Said contract or agreement must be with the original creditor and signed by all parties involved. You are illegally attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt and money that I do not owe. 
Cease and desist all collection activity, including all reporting to consumer reporting agencies. 
Promptly request deletion of any and all prior reporting made to any consumer reporting agencies. If you comply with my requests above within 14 days, then you are excused from verification. 
Further more pursuant 15 USC 1692 ( e ) ( 3 ) False or misleading representations A debt collector may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation or means in connection with the collection of any debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. 
You have no right under the law to send me any type of communication what so ever. Cease and Desist all communication immediately. 
Further More You Are attempting to collect an alleged debt where the so called original creditor has falsely represent the character other Violations under 15 USC 1692 e that you are implementing your self.

Violation : 15 USC 1692b ( 5 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 2 ) ( A ) 15 USC 1692e ( 3 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 6 ) ( B ) 15 USC 1692 ( 9 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 10 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 11 ) This letter is CCed to the Bureau of Consumer Protection Finance as evidence may be provided to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). The CFPB is authorized to investigate this fully matter and receive any related information herein. Be advised, if you fail to comply with this demand letter, I may turn the matter over to an attorney ).

Note I am a very litigious consumer, and I will proceed with legal action for all my consumer rights violations under this subchapter plus all remedies and actual damages as a result of your failure pursuant 15 USC 1692K.

If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity shall CEASE and Desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. 
This includes any listing of information to a credit reporting repository/ agency that could be inaccurate or invalidated. 
If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 10 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my consumer report, and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX The Following information is required. Please fill out the form below in its entirety. 
1. Name and address of Alleged creditor : 2. Name on file of alleged debtor : 3. Alleged Account # : 4. Address on file for alleged debtor : 5. Amount of alleged debt : 6. Date this alleged became payable : 7. Date of original charge off or delinquency : 8. Was this debt assigned to a debt collector or purchased? No Yes 9. Amount Paid if debt was purchased : 10. Commission for debt if collection efforts are successful : Please attach copies of the following : Agreement with your client that grants COLLECTION COMPANY NAME the authority to collect this alleged debt.

Signed agreement Debtor has made with Debt Collector, or other verifiable proof Debtor has a contractual obligation to pay Debt collector.

Any agreement that bears the signature of Debtor, wherein agreed to pay Creditor.

All statements while this account was open.

Have any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account?

o Yes o No Have any Judgements been obtained by any creditor regarding this account?

o Yes o No Please provide me the name and address of the bonding agent for COLLECTION COMPANY NAME, in case legal action becomes necessary : Date : Authorized Signature of Creditor You must return this completed form along with copies of all requested information, assignments or other transfer agreements, which would establish your right to collect this alleged debt within 30 calendar days from the date of receipt of this letter.

Your Claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of this form is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for Validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. 
Please allow 30 calendar days for processing after I receive this information. 

Thank You.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: i am writing to formally request the immediate removal of inaccurate information from my Transunion credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The following accounts and inquiries are listed incorrectly and are causing significant harm to my credit worthiness. I have previously disputed these items with Transunion, the items still remain on my report. The continued presence of these inaccuracies is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. I kindly request that the Federal Trade Commission intervene to ensure that Transunion remove these inaccurate items from my credit report immediately. The erroneous imformation is adversely affecting my ability obtain credit and causing undue stress. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. i look forward to a swift solution. My information was also sold and bought illegally because I was a victim of the + XXXXdata breach. I want these items Deleted from my credit reports effective immediately. I am attaching proof that XXXX has admitted that! was in fact a victim of this data breach. According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. So I then asked them to provide me a description of the investigation according to 15 USC 1681 ( 7 ) : ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. But they did not do that as well either. They are also breaking these laws as well below : According to 15 USC 1681 ( 5 ) it states this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. According to 15 USC 1681s-2 it states this. ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( i ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Team, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against the credit reporting agencies, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion, for their ongoing violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). It appears that these credit bureaus have decided to disregard the law due to their own greed, failing to provide accurate and complete information regarding my credit accounts, which constitutes a violation of Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA.

Furthermore, I am requesting proof of any previous investigations conducted regarding my complaints. I would like to know the methods used in these investigations and request all records of communication with the lenders involved, including : 1.The contact information of the lenders ( name, address, and phone number ).

2.Documentation that substantiates any claims regarding late payments on my accounts.

Please provide this information within 10 days. If you are unable to furnish the requested documentation in this timeframe, I ask that my account be updated to reflect a status of PAID/LATE. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

XXXX is the only bureau that is reporting as paid on time. 

XXXX AND TRANSUNION A REPORTING IT WRONG

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I sent a formal debt validation request to XXXX XXXX and their assigned third-party debt collection agency, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, regarding an account they claim I owe. I requested proof of the original signed agreement and a detailed breakdown of how the debt amount was calculated. However, I received only account statements, which did not meet the requirements for proper debt validation. 

On XX/XX/year>, I sent a second formal request to the same parties for complete validation of the debt, including the signed agreement and proof of their legal right to collect the debt. As of XX/XX/year>, I have still not received the required documentation. 

Despite failing to provide proper validation, the debt collector continues collection efforts, which includes reporting this debt to credit bureaus. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), collection activities must cease until the debt is validated, and I believe this constitutes a violation of my consumer rights. 

I request that all collection activities be stopped and any negative reporting to credit bureaus be permanently removed, as the debt has not been properly validated according to the law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Dispute and Request to Update Personal Information Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to dispute and request an update to my personal information in your records. I recently obtained a copy of my credit report and discovered that some of the personal information listed is inaccurate or outdated. I kindly request that you investigate and make the necessary updates to ensure the accuracy and integrity of my credit profile. 

Please find below the specific details of the incorrect or outdated information : Name : My current legal name is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, but it is listed incorrectly on my credit report as XXXX XXXX XXXX. I request that my name be updated to reflect the correct information. 


Address : My current residential address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, but my credit report shows an outdated address as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I request that my current address be updated accordingly. 


Contact Information : My only current phone number is XXXX I have enclosed copies of supporting documents to verify the accurate information provided above. The documents include : A copy of my driver 's license or passport displaying my correct name. 
A recent utility bill or bank statement showing my current address. 
A copy of my phone bill or any other official document that displays my correct phone number.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX violates FCRA regulations by reporting the same adverse account TWICE : THERE ARE SAME ACCOUNTS REPORTED NEGATIVELY ( XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX AND XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX are the same account ). Not only that that same account has inaccuracies since they display different data, which XXXX " SUPPOSEDLY '' investigated and then re-investigated, which looks like very DISHONEST, AND DECEPTIVE PRACTICE by private company which XXXX is and with which I have NO CONTRACT WITH, AND WITH WHICH I REVOKE ANY CONSENT- ORAL, WRITTEN, IMPLIED OR OTHERWISE AS OF NOW TO REPORT ANY OF THOSE TWO ACCOUNT ON MY BEHALF. Additionally LVNV FUNDING LLC is a charge off account, but XXXX DECEPTIVELY continued to report it as a charge off every month and in this manner updating it monthly. Charge off account should not have any updates after it was charge off. This inaccurate information falsely manipulates statute of limitations, and proves that XXXX DID NOT INVESTIGATE AND RE-INVESTIGATE THE ACCOUNT. Furthermore, XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual.

15 U.S.C. 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C. 1681 section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C. 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Transunion for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Transunion for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report following two reinvestigations, which is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Account Information : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge XXXX Amount : {$0.00} Despite providing clear evidence of the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account and requesting its removal from my credit report, Transunion has failed to comply with the law and has retained the inaccurate account information.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act mandates that if a reinvestigation does not resolve a dispute, the credit bureau must delete the disputed information within five business days. The repeated failure of Transunion to adhere to this requirement is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and has caused me financial harm and distress. 
I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take immediate action against Transunion for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate deletion of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Ttransunion upholds its obligations under the law. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX took over our loan without our knowledge. It caused for lots of confusion in where payments were going. We had no idea and were paying both mortgage companies for over 6 months. During the transition our home burned down and we were displaced and not regularly receiving mail so I called in multiple times. We were sending payments in to XXXX XXXX but it wasnt going to the correct department. We had no idea. They have provided an incorrect address twice in XXXX  years. They also adjusted our mortgage without our knowledge making the auto pay not be enough to cover. They have never been paid late, as all of our payments have been on auto draft from my bank. Ive been trying to resolve this for a year and Ive been sent to several escalation departments or supervisors but no action taken. Ive provided historic payments for XXXX  months showing money being mailed on the first of each month. When reviewing with customer service they acknowledge that the payments did come in but were not processed timely due to them being in the wrong desk of XXXX XXXX. The supervisor corrected the address with my bank for future payment but refused to modify the adverse reporting. He also share that there was some type of late charge that had been carried over from a previous mortgage when they took my loan. Ive never been told of that but its whats been reported as over 90 days late and transfers month to month. Im in dispute about the {$440.00} late fee and refused to pay it with clear explanation to validate it. That could not be provided. We have over XXXX in equity in our home and recently experienced life altering circumstances forcing us to request equity. Because the the adverse reporting, we are unable to access our equity and when trying to get away from XXXX XXXX, no one will take us due to the late payment reported. The supervisor I mentioned advised me to report this to the credit bureaus and even gave their address and process for adverse reporting. He said he was looking in the notes and could clearly see the problems but was not able to modify on his end but the investigation would show it when they called and it should be corrected. Trans union reached out but said that I need to get XXXX  to change it so thus nothing is being done and my family remains in dire need to access our equity. Please help us!!!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against TransUnion for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report after two previous disputes, which constitutes a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Account Information : - Account Number : XXXX - Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Date of Charge Off : XX/XX/year> - Amount : {$0.00} The account in question is an auto loan that was reported as charge off but has been paid in full. Despite providing documentation in previous disputes that demonstrates the inaccuracies of this information, TransUnion has failed to remove it from my credit report. Additionally, this account is reported solely by TransUnion and not by other credit bureaus, which further indicates an error in the reporting. 
The FCRA requires credit bureaus to delete disputed information within five business days after the reinvestigation if the dispute is not resolved, as stipulated in 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ). The continued presence of this incorrect account on my report violates the following FCRA provisions : 1. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) - Credit bureaus are legally required to ensure maximum accuracy of the information they report. The fact that this charge off appears exclusively in TransUnions report suggests that TransUnion has failed to verify the accuracy of its data.

2. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) - TransUnion is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation when the accuracy of any item in the report is questioned. The failure to correct the disputed information after two attempts constitutes a violation of this obligation. 
TransUnions lack of compliance has caused significant financial damage and emotional distress, impacting my ability to access credit fairly. I request the CFPB to investigate this matter thoroughly and take the necessary actions against TransUnion for its continued non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
I am seeking the immediate deletion of this inaccurate account from my credit report and any other remedies deemed appropriate by the CFPB to ensure that TransUnion fulfills its legal obligations. Attached to this complaint, please find the supporting documentation, including the original disputes, proof of payment for the auto loan, and my current credit report reflecting the erroneous information. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in enforcing compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act, the list of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

The accounts below have violated my rights.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C 1681s-2 ( A ) ( a ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

THE LAW STATES ( a ) In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Under 15 U.S. Code 6802 - I have the right to opt out of any information shared to a financial institution, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice, which I have not received.

Consumer complaint narrative: All prior credit card statements were sent to me. I asked for these documents to show proof that I was illegally charged on my account by Victoria Secret/Comenity Bank for a service that I never agreed to. They have no signature physical or electronic for that service and I have asked them to supply me a copy of the signature that says I signed up for it and they can't because I never did. I paid this credit card off in full. A month later Victoria Secret/Comenity Bank called me trying to sell me a service called XXXX XXXX. I declined these services. Victoria Secret/Comenity Bank then charged my account anyways for a {$0.00} charge labeled XXXX XXXX per the credit card statement. Because of this {$0.00} charge it triggered a minimum interest charge of {$2.00} causing my account to have a balance of {$2.00} after I paid it all off which racked up late fees over time. I tried to tell Comenity Bank, Victoria Secret, and now XXXX XXXX XXXX that this is because of illegal charges on my account. You can not charge someone for credit card insurance that they never agreed to. Noone will listen to me or help me even though they provided me the statement with the proof that clearly says this charge was not for any previous interest, previous purchase, or interest from current billing cycles..Meaning this is not leftover interest from the previous billing cycle which is what they tried to tell me until I showed them the proof. The account was paid off on XX/XX/year>. The illegal charge for the {$0.00} XXXX XXXX insurance was put on my account on XX/XX/year>. Again, I have asked for XXXX and Comenity to supply me with an electronic or physical signature that says I signed up for this to cause this charge and they can't. I paid it off with no intention of ever using it again so there is no reason I would need account insurance. They have to supply proof of this and they can't because I never agreed. Victoria Secret, Comenity, and XXXX should all be held legally liable for the damage they have done and for seeing the proof of what I'm saying is true and pretending they don't. A woman at XXXX even agreed with me that this was illegal then I never heard from her again. They keep trying to come after me for payment anyways. This is all highly illegal.

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX My Credit Report was updated in XX/XX/year> to which the Credit Bureau knowingly furnished inaccurate and incomplete information.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Sec. 602 ( A ) States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Under 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ), consumer reporting agencies are legally required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy in their reports. This has clearly not been done in my case, and the errors remain unaddressed.

Under 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ), it is the agencys responsibility to promptly delete or correct any information found to be inaccurate and incomplete during a dispute. Despite this legal requirement, the inaccuracies continue to persist on my report, causing unnecessary hardship.

Under 15 USC 1681s-2 explicitly states that furnishers must not report information they know, or have reasonable cause to believe, is inaccurate. These accounts have been reported in violation of this law.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

It's been more than 30 days since I filed a complaint with these Bureaus, and yet the disputed accounts have not been updated. If this continues, I will have no choice but to take legal action due to the immense stress this has caused me. Moreover, I am also concerned about the security of my personal data, as it was affected by the XXXX, XXXX, and Transunion data breach.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Based on, 15 U.S. Code $ 1681c-2 a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) this account in violation not reporting 100 % accurate.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the list of accounts has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under the 15 USC 1681. These accounts has violated my rights.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1681 section 602 A states I have the right to privacy.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish accounts without my written instructions.

I am requesting for the original copy of the agreement & terms & condition. Failure to comply will forfeit your claims and will require you to delete all the list of items above. You are required to do what I am asking and block these transactions from being reported to my consumer report WITHIN 4 DAYS from the date of the receipt of this notice. I LOOK FORWARD TO YOUR RESPONSE.
