Consumer complaint narrative: Consumer Name : ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, Consumer Social Security Number : ( ), Cosumer Date of Birth : ( XX/XX/year> ), Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the XXXX credit reporting agency , block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists 7 Separate fraudulent accounts appearing on my consumer FICO report which i do not recognize as reported and which are the result of identity theft and fraud. These fraudulent accounts consist of Accounts : XXXX XXXX Date XXXX ( XXXX {$120.00} ) XXXXXXXX XXXX Date XXXX XXXX ( XXXX {$120.00} ) Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXThese accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # ( XXXX ) as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Collection Accounts and Hard Inquiries Report Number : [ Insert Report Number ] Date of Report : XX/XX/XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and legitimacy of the following negative items on my credit report : 1. Collections Accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$960.00} ( Original Creditor : Independent Emergency Physician ) XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$660.00} ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Hard Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX : Inquiries on XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX ; and XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX : XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX : XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I believe these items are inaccurate for the following reasons : XXXX. Failure to Verify Debt Properly ( Fair Credit Reporting Act - FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) : Under the FCRA, data furnishers and credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. I demand that you provide full documentation and verification from the original creditors or furnishers proving the validity of these debts and inquiries. If you can not provide this documentation, these items must be removed immediately from my credit report.

2. Unauthorized Inquiries ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : Credit inquiries can only be conducted with my express permission. I did not authorize the aforementioned inquiries. Therefore, under the FCRA, these inquiries were illegal and should be removed from my report immediately.

3. Right to Validation ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act - FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : Collection agencies must provide written validation of the debts they are attempting to collect. I request immediate validation of the collections from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX  If this validation is not provided, or the debt is found to be invalid, these collections must be removed from my credit report, and I will consider legal action for damages caused by the inaccurate reporting. 

4. Potential Legal Repercussions : Should Experian and the associated furnishers fail to comply with my legal rights under the FCRA and FDCPA within 30 days of receiving this notice, I will consider filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and my state Attorney Generals office. Additionally, I may pursue legal action for violations of the FCRA and FDCPA, which carry statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation. 

XXXX. Request for Investigation : Under the FCRA, I formally request that you investigate the items listed above and remove any inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information from my credit report. I expect to receive written confirmation of the results of your investigation within 30 days as required by law. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please send all correspondence to the address listed above. Failure to correct these inaccuracies will result in further legal action to protect my rights under federal law. 

.

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Cease and Desist Demand Regarding Account # XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally request that you cease and desist all collection activities regarding the above-referenced account. As it shows a $ XXXX balance on my credit report and is negatively affecting my credit score as of XX/XX/year>. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), I am exercising my right to request that you stop all communication with me regarding this alleged debt. 

Please be advised that I dispute the validity of the debt you claim I owe. I am requesting no further contact, whether by telephone, mail, or any other form of communication, including calls to my place of employment, home, or to third parties. Any further contact from your agency may result in a complaint being filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and/or my states attorney generals office for violation of the FDCPA. 
Please take notice that I demand the following : 1. Immediate cessation of all communications regarding the collection of the alleged debt.

2. That you inform all third parties or affiliates working on this matter of my request for the cessation of all communications. 

This notice is effective upon your receipt of this letter. I request written confirmation that you have complied with my request within 30 days of the date of this letter. 

Failure to comply with this cease-and-desist request will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action to protect my rights. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
THE LIST OF ACCOUNTS BELOW HAS VIOLATED MY FEDERALLY PROTECTED CONSUMER RIGHTS TO PRIVACY AND CONFIDENTIALITY UNDER 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX HAS VIOLATED MY RIGHTS. 
I LOOKED AT MY EQUIFAX CREDIT REPORT ON XX/XX/year> AND NOTICED SOME THINGS ARE INCOMPLETE AND NOT ACCURATE. AND ACCORDING TO THE FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT WHENEVER A CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY PREPARES A CONSUMER REPORT IT SHALL FOLLOW REASONABLE PROCEDURES TO ASSURE MAXIMUM POSSIBLE ACCURACY OF THE INFORMATION CONCERNING THE INDIVIDUAL ABOUT WHOM THE REPORT RELATES ACCORDING TO 15 USC 1681 ( E ) ( B ).

AND ACCORDING TO 15 USC 1681S THEY ARE SUPPOSE TO DO THIS ( 5 ) TREATMENT OF INACCURATE OR UNVERIFIABLE INFORMATION.

( A ) IN GENERAL. IF, AFTER ANY REINVESTIGATION UNDER PARAGRAPH ( 1 ) OF ANY INFORMATION DISPUTED BY A CONSUMER, AN ITEM OF THE INFORMATION IS FOUND TO BE INACCURATE OR INCOMPLETE OR CAN NOT BE VERIFIED, THE CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY SHALL ( I ) PROMPTLY DELETE THAT ITEM OF INFORMATION FROM THE FILE OF THE CONSUMER, OR MODIFY THAT ITEM OF INFORMATION, AS APPROPRIATE, BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE REINVESTIGATION ; AND ( II ) PROMPTLY NOTIFY THE FURNISHER OF THAT INFORMATION THAT THE ITEM HAS BEEN MODIFIED OR DELETED FROM THE FILE OF THE CONSUMER.

AND ACCORDING TO 15 USC 1681C-2 THEY ARE SUPPOSE TO NOT FURNISH ANY INFORMATION RELATING TO A CONSUMER TO ANY CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY IF THE PERSON KNOWS OR HAS REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE THAT THE INFORMATION IS INACCURATE.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Heres a more detailed version of your CFPB complaint : Subject : Repeated Failure to Remove Unauthorized Hard Inquiry FCRA Violation To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against TransUnion for repeatedly failing to remove an unauthorized hard inquiry from my credit report, despite multiple requests and promises that the issue would be resolved. 

The unauthorized inquiry, which was added to my credit report on XX/XX/year>, occurred without my consent or authorization. Upon noticing this, I contacted TransUnion on several occasions to have the inaccurate information removed. Specifically, I reached out on XX/XX/year>, and again on XX/XX/year>. During my most recent interaction on XX/XX/year>, I was provided written confirmation from TransUnion stating that the unauthorized inquiry would be removed within two days. However, despite this written assurance, it has now been more than a month, and the unauthorized inquiry remains on my credit report. 

TransUnions repeated failure to remove this incorrect information constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). As you are aware, the FCRA requires that credit reporting agencies investigate and correct inaccuracies within 30 days. The inquiry has not been removed within this legally mandated timeframe, despite multiple requests on my part and clear communication from TransUnion that they would take action. 

The presence of this unauthorized hard inquiry on my credit report is continuing to negatively affect my credit score, and the lack of resolution is causing me significant frustration and financial harm. I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to ensure that TransUnion fully complies with their legal obligations under the FCRA and removes this unauthorized inquiry from my credit report. 

Additionally, I would like confirmation that my credit score will be updated to reflect the removal of this inquiry, as it has unfairly impacted my overall financial standing. I have documentation of my interactions with TransUnion and am prepared to provide any additional information that is necessary for the investigation. 

Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter. I trust that the CFPB will help to ensure this issue is promptly resolved. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Your Contact Information : Phone and Email ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my credit report, I identified several inaccuracies related to my XXXX XXXX account ( Account XXXX : XXXX ), including errors in the reported credit limit, last payment date, term length, late payment activity, and date of the last report. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumer reporting agencies are legally obligated to maintain accurate and complete information. These errors are in violation of this obligation, and they have the potential to misrepresent my financial standing. 
Under the authority of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that consumer reporting agencies must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccuracies related to my XXXX XXXX account ( Account XXXX : XXXX ). The errors include incorrect reporting of the credit limit, last payment date, term length, late payment activity, and date reported. 

As required by law, I am requesting that these inaccuracies be thoroughly investigated and corrected. Due to the nature of these violations, I am requesting that this account be completely removed from my credit reports across all three major bureaus within 15 days. Failure to rectify this promptly may result in further legal action to enforce my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I sent disputes out on XX/XX/XXXX and received a response dated XX/XX/XXXX from TransUnion with a " stall letter '' explaining to me on why they could not accept my disputes. ( Document Attached ). I then sent out, yet another disputes package that was notarized and mailed Certified mail on XXXX XXXX and they received on XX/XX/XXXX. Their response to my disputes were not compliant to FCRA laws. They are the following : 1. ) My ONLY address that should be on file is the address that is on my Drivers License i ask them to remove any addresses that does not match my copy of my Drivers License that i have attached and they failed to do so. 

2. ) I also have notified them that my Employer on file is inaccurate and I am not an employee at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX' they still refuse to remove this employer from my credit profile. 

3. ) On the XXXX account that is listed on my credit report that i have uploaded, I informed them that the account number was not accurate and i would like to request for the account to be removed due to the violation of 15 USC Sec 1681i ( a ) 4. ) On the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that is listed on my credit report that i have uploaded I informed TransUnion that the account number was wrong and i would like to request for the account to be deleted immediately due to them failing to provide 100 % accuracy on my credit report. They did not execute an internal investigation and they still said that it was validated by the creditor. Violation of 15 USC sec 1681i ( a ) 5. ) XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX On this account ( LISTED ABOVE ) i explained to the Trans Union that the account is a big violation of my FCRA rights and they are also violating Federal laws from the IRS XXXX The law requires that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to report all taxable canceled debt as income on their tax return, even if the amount is less {$600.00} and I didnt receive a 1099-C. Canceled debt is taxed at the same rate as my ordinary income. which can be anywhere from 10 % to 37 % depending on their total taxable income. Since that being said Creditors in the United States must charge- off revolving credit accounts after 180 days. As you can see in the attached letter my alleged last payment was made on XX/XX/XXXX So according to these laws i had not exceeded the 180 days that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX had before they could initially charged this alleged debt off. Also Charge - offs are considered taxable income and income can not be reported on my credit report, ONLY DEBTS. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX} Last Activity date is inaccurate ( Account has been illegally reaged ) I sent out a Request for Validation to XXXX XXXX and never received a response. I recently learned that the credit reports had been having the incorrect address for XXXX XXXX. So I recently did research and learned of a recent address on file that is located in XXXXXXXX XXXX that i will be sending letters to TODAY. Also this alleged debt is Income for the debtor and income is not included in a consumer report. 15 USC 1681a ( d ) /15 USC 1602/ 15 USC 1692 ( e ). The IRS states charged off or dismissed debt is Now ordinary income and the debtor shall file a 1099c. ( PLEASE SEE IRS PUBLICATIONS 4681 Section 4 )

Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Dispute Request for Removal of Incorrect Addresses, Names, and Employers I am writing to formally dispute incorrect information on my credit report related to my addresses, names, and employers. I have previously submitted disputes to correct this information, but my requests were ignored, and no action has been taken. As a result of your inaction, I am also filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to address your failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Under the FCRA, you are required to ensure the accuracy of the information you report. The following inaccuracies must be corrected immediately : Incorrect Addresses : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Incorrect Names : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Incorrect Employers : XXXX XXXX FCRA Violations and My Rights According to Section 611 of the FCRA, you are required to investigate and resolve disputes within 30 days of receiving notice. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted from my report promptly. Your failure to act on my previous disputes is a violation of this federal requirement.

Additionally, Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA mandates that you maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy. The presence of inaccurate addresses, names, and employers reflects a breach of this duty.

Demand for Immediate Action and Penalties I demand that you : Immediately remove all incorrect addresses, names, and employers from my credit report.

Provide written confirmation of these corrections.

Ensure future inaccuracies are promptly addressed and corrected.

Apply all applicable penalties under the FCRA for failing to address these disputes properly and in a timely manner.

If the requested changes are not made within 14 days, I will pursue legal action for non-compliance and further escalate my complaint with the CFPB.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I expect written confirmation of the corrections within the specified timeframe.

I only have one Correct Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, ohio, XXXX I only have one Correct Spelling of my name when applying for Credit i dont use my middle name : XXXX XXXX I Only have one correct employer : XXXX XXXX XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon checking my personal TRANSUNION account, I realized that I have incorrect information in my credit report. The accounts are : # XXXX, # XXXX, # XXXX and # XXXX. There is a record of late payments and that is not correct. 

According to consumer protection, TRANSUNION is violating the following laws : 1. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 and 15 U.S. Code 1681i.

2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of these late payments violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness.

3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payments may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts.

4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information.

5. It should be noted that the dates on which the alleged late payments are being reported coincide with the date on which the covid-19 pandemic began, violating a very important law which is the ''The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security ( CARES ) Act ( 2020 ) '' The dates on which the incorrect late payments appear are described in each account as follows : Account # XXXX, dates : XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. 

Account # XXXX, date : XX/XX/year>. 

Account # XXXX, dates : XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. 

Account # XXXX, dates : XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. 

TRANSUNION must respect consumer protection laws and assume its responsibility to take care of citizens and not take advantage of wanting to benefit from inaccurate information. 

This is not the first time I have tried to contact TRANSUNION and they have not shown any interest in resolving the errors they are making and are affecting my credit history.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
My complaint is regarding the unauthorized addition of an account to my consumer credit report, which is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, an account from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was added to my report without my permission or knowledge. This account had previously been removed from my report on XX/XX/2023, yet it has now been re-added, which constitutes unlawful and inaccurate reporting. 

Details of the Issue : Account in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Removed : XX/XX/2023 File Number : XXXX TransUnions action of re-adding this account is a violation of FCRA 1681b, which governs the permissible purposes for accessing and reporting information on a consumers credit file. No valid or permissible purpose exists for this account to be placed on my credit report again after it had been correctly removed. 

Violations of the FCRA : FCRA 1681b Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports According to FCRA 1681b, a consumer reporting agency can only provide a consumer report under specific circumstances, such as a credit application, insurance underwriting, or court order. In this case, there was no permissible purpose for TransUnion to re-add the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account without my knowledge or authorization. This action is a clear violation of the FCRAs provisions on the use of consumer reports.

FCRA 1681e ( b ) Duty to Follow Reasonable Procedures to Assure Accuracy Under FCRA 1681e ( b ), TransUnion is required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported on my consumer file. By re-reporting an account that was previously removed, TransUnion has failed in this duty, causing inaccurate and damaging information to appear on my report. 

Failure to Comply with Prior Removal Request TransUnion previously acknowledged and removed this account on XX/XX/2023. The fact that this account has been re-added without my consent or notification is further evidence that proper procedures were not followed, and this represents a failure to adhere to the FCRAs provisions on consumer protection. 

Harm Caused : TransUnions illegal re-reporting of this account has caused the following harms : Damage to my credit score as a result of the inaccurate reporting of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account. 
Negative impact on my ability to secure credit, as creditors may view this inaccurately re-reported account as a sign of unresolved financial issues.

Emotional distress, given the unnecessary frustration and time spent addressing an issue that had already been resolved. 
Actions Requested : I demand that TransUnion immediately : Permanently remove the unauthorized XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account from my credit report. 
Cease all future reporting of this account unless properly authorized by me with a legitimate permissible purpose.

Provide written confirmation of the removal of the account and that no further action will be taken to report it.

Investigate how this account was added back to my report without authorization and provide me with a detailed explanation of the findings.

Should TransUnion fail to comply with these requests, I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and consider legal action to seek damages for violations under the FCRA, including but not limited to FCRA 1681n for willful non-compliance and FCRA 1681o for negligent non-compliance.

I expect a timely response and resolution of this issue within 24 hours.

This letter highlights the violation of FCRA laws related to the unauthorized re-adding of the account and emphasizes that the account was previously removed.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general lf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

Back in XXXX  I requested an investigation of the information and/or accuracy of the XXXX XXXX XXXX reference # XXXX that was appearing on my credit report. Due to unverifiable and/or inaccuracy, this bankruptcy was removed from my credit file with XXXX back in XXXX. According to the Fair Credit reporting act, my rights have been violated with XXXX continuing to report this after several attempts to request an investigation and Trans-union reporting verified . Based on the Fair Credit Reporting laws, my rights have been violated based on sections 611-15.U.S.C & 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) : *Prompt Notice of Dispute to Furnisher of Information ( A ) In general. Before the expiration of the 5-business-day period beginning on the date on which a consumer reporting agency receives notice of a dispute from any consumer or a reseller in accordance with paragraph ( 1 ), the agency shall provide notification of the dispute to any person who provided any item of information in dispute, at the address and in the manner established with the person. The notice shall include all relevant information regarding the dispute that the agency has received from the consumer or reseller. 

* ( b ) Duties of Furnishers of Information upon Notice of Dispute 1 ) In general. After receiving notice pursuant to section 611 ( a ) ( 2 ) [ 1681i ] of a dispute with regard to the completeness or accuracy of any information provided by a person to a consumer reporting agency, the person shall ( A ) conduct an investigation with respect to the disputed information ; ( B ) review all relevant information provided by the consumer reporting agency pursuant to section 611 ( a ) ( 2 ) [ 1681i ] ; ( C ) report the results of the investigation to the consumer reporting agency ; ( D ) if the investigation finds that the information is incomplete or inaccurate, report those results to all other consumer reporting agencies to which the person furnished the information and that compile and maintain files on consumers on a nationwide basis ; Based on these laws, the information should have been reported by the furnisher and/or credit reporting agency that this information was inaccurately reporting and was deleted from my credit file back in XXXX I provided my a recent credit report from XXXX showing there's only one bankruptcy reporting that was dismissed which was a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX reference XXXX was removed years ago. I need this removed from my credit filed immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative: I recently reviewed my credit report and found unauthorized inquiries. I have already contacted the creditors below and they have not provided me with any proof that I initiated such inquiries, nor provided me with written authorization or any permissible purpose. Since they do not have my approval, written or verbal, I ask that you DELETE these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report immediately as there is no evidence of any authorization, nor any permissible purpose. As you know, according to Section 604 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports 15 U.S. Code 1681b, Subsection ( a ), the below creditors have not demonstrated any allowable permissible purpose - and any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under those circumstances and no other. As such, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i, Paragraph ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information ( A ) In general : If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. The following inquiries are unauthorized, and I ask that you DELETE the following XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general lf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Last reported XX/XX/year> {$620.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX Original creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Last reported XX/XX/year> {$300.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX  Original creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Last reported XX/XX/year> {$230.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX Original creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Last reported XX/XX/year> {$130.00} Open balance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Original creditor XXXX  Original creditor is XXXX  on all XXXX marks right when my student loans and bankruptcy is off my record almost 2 years ago this creditor is making it so I can never own a credit card and I never once had a credit card in my life ..the way he is marking up my credit I will never be able to use a real actual credit card.. I dont think anyone knows what life is like without one..and my accounts have been frozen for Almost 2 years.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against TransUnion for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report after two previous disputes, which constitutes a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Account Information : - Account Number : XXXX - Creditor Name : XXXX  - Date of Charge Off : XX/XX/2019 - Amount : {$0.00} The account in question is an auto loan that was reported as charge off but has been paid in full. Despite providing documentation in previous disputes that demonstrates the inaccuracies of this information, TransUnion has failed to remove it from my credit report. Additionally, this account is reported solely by TransUnion and not by other credit bureaus, which further indicates an error in the reporting. 
The FCRA requires credit bureaus to delete disputed information within five business days after the reinvestigation if the dispute is not resolved, as stipulated in 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ). The continued presence of this incorrect account on my report violates the following FCRA provisions : 1. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) - Credit bureaus are legally required to ensure maximum accuracy of the information they report. The fact that this charge off appears exclusively in TransUnions report suggests that TransUnion has failed to verify the accuracy of its data.

2. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) - TransUnion is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation when the accuracy of any item in the report is questioned. The failure to correct the disputed information after two attempts constitutes a violation of this obligation.

TransUnions lack of compliance has caused significant financial damage and emotional distress, impacting my ability to access credit fairly. I request the CFPB to investigate this matter thoroughly and take the necessary actions against TransUnion for its continued non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

I am seeking the immediate deletion of this inaccurate account from my credit report and any other remedies deemed appropriate by the CFPB to ensure that TransUnion fulfills its legal obligations. Attached to this complaint, please find the supporting documentation, including the original disputes, proof of payment for the auto loan, and my current credit report reflecting the erroneous information.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in enforcing compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Transunion for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Transunion for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report following two reinvestigations, which is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Account Information : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge XXXX Amount : {$0.00} Despite providing clear evidence of the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account and requesting its removal from my credit report, Transunion has failed to comply with the law and has retained the inaccurate account information.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act mandates that if a reinvestigation does not resolve a dispute, the credit bureau must delete the disputed information within five business days. The repeated failure of Transunion to adhere to this requirement is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and has caused me financial harm and distress.

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take immediate action against Transunion for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate deletion of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Ttransunion upholds its obligations under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, IN XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, IN XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, IN XXXX REQUEST FOR DETAILED VERIFICATION METHOD : We hereby invoke all rights under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 7 ) and FCRA 623, necessitating a comprehensive explanation of the procedures employed to investigate the disputed items. Please note that a simple e-Oscar 2-digit code readout will not suffice.

Regrettably, credit bureaus frequently rely on a mere software that fails to conduct exhaustive investigations, falling short of the legal standards for verification. Our legal team is keenly interested in understanding the process your investigators follow to reach their conclusions.

15 USC 1681 603 ( A ) ( 2 ) ( E ) The term investigative consumer report means a consumer report or portion thereof in which information on a consumers character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living is obtained through personal interviews with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer reported on or with others with whom he is acquainted or who may have knowledge concerning any such items of information. However, such information shall not include specific factual information on a consumers credit record obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from the consumer.

Verification means to make sure one actually owes the alleged debt, see XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). The definition of verification according to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is... averment that the party pleading is ready to establish the truth of what he has set forth. ... The examination of a writing for the purpose of ascertaining its truth ; or a certificate or af idavit that it is true.. The court said Confirmation of the correctness, truth, or authenticity of a pleading, account, or other paper, by an affidavit, oath, or deposition. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) ; and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) ; and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). 

I request a complete list of all documents and correspondence ( s ) with the original creditor, including, but not limited to : 1. The names and contact details of ALL employees involved in this investigation.

2. Concrete evidence tracing back to the original creditor ; and 3. Comprehensive information about the entire lifecycle of the loan.

4. The identity of the individual or entity that initially issued the loan.

5. The exact date when the loan was granted.

6. The original contact details associated with the loan.

7. Copies of all correspondence and documents sent in relation to this matter.

8. Copies of insurance contracts paying the creditor, securities held as a result of the contract, or tax benefits they have received from holding this account.

If an investigation can not be conducted or the required documents can not be located, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) mandates the removal of the information from the credit reports, including the complete deletion of the account.

However, if an investigation of the account records can be carried out and inaccurately reported information is identified, it is necessary to update the credit reports to accurately reflect this information.

DEBT INVALIDATION NOTICE - Please find enclosed the correspondence sent to the alleged creditor. The absence of a validation response from the creditor automatically invalidates the account, serving as evidence of identity fraud. By law, this account must be expunged from the credit report. We request an updated credit report reflecting the resolution of the account dispute.

NOTICE OF FRAUD ALERT - This serves as a notice that you are now implicated in fraud by verifying information that can not be substantiated/ validated due to the absence of an authenticated contract with the creditor. If the agency fails to remove this information, we will be compelled to initiate legal proceedings for deliberate non-compliance under FCRA 616 and 15 U.S. Code 1681n.

OPPORTUNITY TO CURE - A point-by-point response to these demands in the form of an afidavit is legally required. As the XXXX, He who does not deny, admits, and An unrebutted affidavit stands as truth. According to Restatement 2nd 69, failure to respond within fifteen days will be taken as an admission that the debt is unverified, all legal claims are relinquished and are to be released, and the entity named on the account is a victim of identity fraud. If the debt is not verified, a demand is made to dismiss and withdraw the claim, and rectify any negative credit reporting that may have been associated with the alleged debt for all Credit Reporting Agencies ( CRAs ) and Credit Bureaus ( CBs ).

FINAL APPEAL TO AVOID LITIGATION - Legal proceedings can be costly and are best avoided. If necessary, I am prepared to represent myself in court and file a case in forma pauperis at no cost. However, I understand that your organization may need to engage an attorney, which could be expensive. This is so even if I choose to utilize Small Claims Court and require all claimants only, to appear with evidence and testify with first hand knowledge only. Therefore, this is a sincere attempt to settle this matter before resorting to litigation. I am open to resolving this issue in a private and amicable manner.

Thank you for your consideration and attention to this matter.

This complaint is in regards to the debt collector SST wrongfully charging me hundreds of dollars in interest on debt they acquired from XXXX XXXX, which was mishandled by XXXX in the midst of them going out of business. 

XX/XX/year> : XXXX XXXX XXXX approves a debt consolidation loan for me. Part of it is allocated to XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$15000.00}, the exact amount I owe to XXXX. XXXX mails XXXX a check to their listed address at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX with my information on it. 

XX/XX/year> : XXXX XXXX sends me an email that my account is late being paid. I immediately respond to them via email and explain that a check was sent. 

XX/XX/year> : XXXX staff responds via email that they are checking to see if the check was received. 

XX/XX/year> : I receive an email stating XXXX is shutting down, and all account debts are being transferred to SST on XX/XX/XXXX. It also states XXXX will stop taking payments on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and all further payments should be directed to SST. I emailed XXXX XXXX and follow up to see if they have received the check, as I did not hear back from them prior. They tell me they have no more information to share. I press the issue and tell them if they have not received my check, I will have to cancel the check. 

XX/XX/year> : XXXX XXXX replies and says they have not received the check and to cancel it by contacting my bank or creditor. 

XX/XX/year> : I receive notice via email that my XXXX debt amount ( {$15000.00} ) has been successfully transferred to SST, and I get my account information. I contact XXXX Personal Loans to cancel the check they made out to XXXX  and have the same amount sent to SST, with all my new SST account info, via XXXX online inbox option. I get a reply telling me to call. I call XXXX XXXX XXXX customer service line, explain the situation to the representative, and give her my new SST information, along with their mailing address, so the new check can be sent to SST. 

XX/XX/year> : I am notified by XXXX via my secure inbox that the loan disbursement I asked to be sent to SST has been addressed to me directly. 

XX/XX/year> : I receive a check in the mail from XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$15000.00}. This is highly confusing to me as I have them specific instruction to send the check to the creditor, SST. Thinking this may be an error on their part, I dont deposit the check. 

XX/XX/year> : SST deposits a mailed check in the amount of {$15000.00} to my account. The only proof I see is in my accounts transaction history ; there is no image of the check, check number, or where it came from. I notice the change to my SST account and believe XXXX sent a check to SST. 
My SST account states I still must pay {$490.00} in interest ( my payoff amount ). I deposit the check XXXX XXXX XXXX sent me via mobile deposit to my bank after checking the mobile deposit amount limits. The check clears in my account, but two holds- for two amounts adding up to the amount of the check- are placed on my account so the funds are not immediately accessible. 

XX/XX/year> : I notice the interest charge and write an email to SST noting that I should not be charged interest and that I will not be making further payments as they have been paid in full. I receive an automatic email reply to call SST during business hours. 

XX/XX/year> : I sent a follow up email response telling them my written correspondence should be sufficient information for them to close my account. SST calls me twice, and I do not answer. They leave a voicemail telling me to call them back. 

XX/XX/year> : SST responds to my email with a request to call them For your protection, Systems & Services Technologies , Inc. does not discuss individual account information via the internet. This policy prevents identity theft and secures your privacy. 

XX/XX/year> : SST calls me twice, and I do not answer. One of the calls has a voicemail telling me to call them back. I send them an email telling them to stop calling me and explain the situation in writing again. I tell them if the interest charge is not removed by XX/XX/XXXX, I will be calling. 

XX/XX/year> : SST calls me a combined total of 5 times from XXXX different phone numbers. I do not answer any of these calls. They do not leave voicemails. 

XX/XX/year> : SST sends me an email with an attached document - no password protection or login to my secure account necessary - stating the check they cashed had been returned. They had deposited the stopped check addressed to XXXX, and it was returned. 

XX/XX/year>, end of day : Both parts of the XXXX XXXX XXXX check are now clear and accessible in my checking account. 

XX/XX/year> : I deposit the amount of {$15000.00} to SST from my checking account. I receive a confirmation and keep record of it. 

XX/XX/year> : SST sends me a new monthly statement via email, with a new interest total of {$660.00}. SST calls me from a ( XXXX ) area code phone number. I do not answer, and they dont leave a voicemail. 

XX/XX/year> : I send SST a very thorough email outlining every detail of the situation and our recent interactions. I make it clear to them how dissatisfied I am and how I believe they are trying to take advantage of me. I tell them I see them calling, but I will not answer and that I want everything between us in writing in case I need to involve an attorney. 

SST has not responded to my email and has called me again on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX. I did not answer, and they did not leave voicemails.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a text from what I thought was my bank, asking if I had authorized a wire transfer. I replied " No '' and within seconds, my phone rings and caller ID said " Bank of America '' so I answered. The man ( american accent ) said there was a suspicious wire transfer attempted from my savings account. To summarize, during the two hours I was on the phone with him, he said he was transferring all of savings balance to checking and locking that account. He said it wouldn't show up on my online dashboard and I logged in and sure enough, I didn't see anything and told him so. I asked name, which department and everything. He always had an answer and since my phone said BOA, I appreciated the lookout. While I thought I was on hold to talk to a fraud manager, he said he didn't want to make me wait any longer and that I would get a call back. When a few days went by, I called the bank to check on everything and found out that it wasn't the bank I was talking to. They helped me start a claim but said the since it was a wire transfer, I probably wouldn't get the money back. I went to a branch location to open new accounts since the accounts affected were for my business. The clerk sent me a security code while in his office and it came under the scammer message I had received. I showed him and he didn't know what to say. He said he had never seen a fraud impersonate the bank so deeply and even went on to suggest that the person was an EMPLOYEE or former employee because of all the knowledge this person seemed to have! He showed me the transfer on my transaction history and showed it went to a person called " XXXX XXXX '' at XXXX XXXX. I got a letter in the mail on XX/XX/XXXX from the bank and they informed me they closed my claim and stated/claimed " Our investigation found that the transaction in question was completed using a device that is consistent with previous valid account activity. '' So my conclusion is that the scammer hacked my device while on the phone and sent it from my online banking on my phone. I am begging you, please, please help me with the bank to get my money back. We have only banked with BOA since my wife and I got married in 2008. I am an honest, hard working man just trying to earn clean money and support my family. Almost {$10000.00} is an astronomical amount of money for my business. I have already filed with FTC and plan on also contacting my XXXX Attorney XXXX office for help as well.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I requested that a Chase Bank check be distributed to heirs of the XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. I presented the Judgment of Possession and personal identification to XXXX XXXX XXXX, Vice President and branch manager of the Chase Bank branch located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, La. XXXX. XXXX XXXX prepared several documents and had me sign one document which she said was being done according to bank policy. That document is attached. Nothing came of the transaction. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I telephoned the XXXX branch and stated that I wanted to fax whatever, documents might be needed to prove death, domicile and heirship, and have the check distributed to the heirs of XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. The bank executive to whom I spoke stated that I should not fax any documents to the bank. At that time a fax number was published online to the bank branch. I was informed that XXXX XXXX no longer worked at the branch. I was also told that all heirs would have to appear at the branch simultaneously, with valid identification to have the meager sum of the check distributed to them. The check is for {$640.00} ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. That would me that my sister ( who has XXXX problems and rarely leaves her home ), and since our brother passed away, his adult daughter, whose childhood home is in XXXX, Louisiana, and who now lives out of state, and his minor daughter and his wife, who works full time, and myself would have to assemble to receive the proceeds from the check which was issued in an inconvenient and irregular manner through the sole fault of Chase Bank. 

Prior to the above attempts, after my parents passed away their joint succession was filed on XX/XX/XXXX. The sole heirs of XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX were sent into possession of the estates on XX/XX/XXXX, when a judge for XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX of the State of Louisiana signed the Judgment of Possession. To the best of my memory despite presenting the Judgment of Possession to the branch located at XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX, Louisiana, the heirs were asked to execute a small succession affidavit to access the funds. The Judgment of Possession listed the bank accounts of XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX as assets. 
After a telephone call to a regional bank manager, a meeting was set up for the distribution of the money in our parents ' accounts. I received a telephone call from XXXX XXXX XXXX, Vice President and manager of the branch located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, La. XXXX, in a neighboring city, A meeting was set for XX/XX/XXXX. Once there we were kept waiting and eventually asked if we would reschedule. We declined, and finally, checks were cut and the funds in our parents ' checking accounts was distributed. The heirs in receipt of the funds were my sister, XXXX XXXX XXXX, my brother, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and myself. Sometime later the check, made out to our father, which was executed after the bank was put on notice of the probated succession was received in the mail. The bank has made every attempt to access the funds legally belonging to the heirs of XXXX and XXXX XXXX inconvenient and difficult if not impossible. By this means the bank has retained the funds as an asset to their benefit and the detriment of the rightful owners.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my ongoing frustration regarding two unauthorized transactions taken from my bank account. Despite my diligent efforts to dispute these transactions on several occasions, my claims continue to be rejected. 

The first transaction occurred in XX/XX/XXXX, where a total of {$3300.00} was withdrawn from my account. The second transaction took place in XX/XX/XXXX, amounting to {$1600.00}. Both transactions were conducted through ATM withdrawals and XXXX XXXX transfers, which I firmly did not authorize. 

During the time these transactions took place, I was in XXXX, and I provided proof of my situation to the bank. This included documentation of XXXX XXXX XXXX and confirmation of my address change. However, the bank 's denial letter claims that either I or someone I authorized made these withdrawals. It is critical to note that the banks policy clearly states that only the cardholder has access to the account, and I have never authorized anyone else to use my card. 

In light of this, I requested a list of authorized users on my account, only to be informed that no such users exist. The bank 's policy explicitly prohibits any additional users, reinforcing my assertion that I did not permit anyone else to access my funds. 

To further support my case, I have filed a report on identitytheft.gov, as well as a police report concerning my stolen California ID. Despite these efforts, the bank continues to deny my claims without adequately addressing the substantial evidence I have provided. I hope for a timely resolution to this matter and would appreciate any assistance in rectifying these unauthorized transactions.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX XXXX : # XXXX,, has violated my rights. 

I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear Ally Financial, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 
Below is why I am requesting all of my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance.

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Freedom mortgage took over our loan without our knowledge. It caused for lots of confusion in where payments were going. We had no idea and were paying both mortgage companies for over XXXX  months. During the transition our home burned down and we were displaced and not regularly receiving mail so I called in multiple times. We were sending payments in to freedom mortgage but it wasnt going to the correct department. We had no idea. They have provided an incorrect address twice in XXXX  years. They also adjusted our mortgage without our knowledge making the auto pay not be enough to cover. They have never been paid late, as all of our payments have been on auto draft from my bank. Ive been trying to resolve this for a year and Ive been sent to several escalation departments or supervisors but no action taken. Ive provided historic payments for 18 months showing money being mailed on the first of each month. When reviewing with customer service they acknowledge that the payments did come in but were not processed timely due to them being in the wrong desk of freedom mortgage. The supervisor corrected the address with my bank for future payment but refused to modify the adverse reporting. He also share that there was some type of late charge that had been carried over from a previous mortgage when they took my loan. Ive never been told of that but its whats been reported as over 90 days late and transfers month to month. Im in dispute about the {$440.00} late fee and refused to pay it with clear explanation to validate it. That could not be provided. We have over XXXX in equity in our home and recently experienced life altering circumstances forcing us to request equity. Because the the adverse reporting, we are unable to access our equity and when trying to get away from Freedom mortgage, no one will take us due to the late payment reported. The supervisor I mentioned advised me to report this to the credit bureaus and even gave their address and process for adverse reporting. He said he was looking in the notes and could clearly see the problems but was not able to modify on his end but the investigation would show it when they called and it should be corrected. XXXX XXXX reached out but said that I need to get freedom to change it so thus nothing is being done and my family remains in dire need to access our equity. Please help us!!!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a victim of identity theft on XX/XX/XXXX I received multiple text messages from an XXXX XXXX XXXX USAA stating there was fraudulent activity on my account and to call the back at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I immediately called the number and a " representative '' came on the line and verified my online ID, name, rank and date of birthday, I had no idea this was a bad actor as he had all my credentials. The rep informed me that I had ( 3 ) charges that had occurred in XXXX XXXX, I confirmed these were fraudulent charges and that I was not in the area, he informed me that I needed to change my login credentials and provided me with a " temporary password '' I had no idea that they were locking me out of my accounts. I immediately notified my son XXXX, as his USAA accounts are linked to mine, and informed him to work with the bank when they called, I had no idea that these people were bad actors and my XXXX XXXX XXXX did as I instructed. The fraudsters got hold to all my accounts this included my son XXXXXXXX XXXX accounts which were linked to mine as well as another banking institution. Within the hour I called USAA back because after multiple attempts I could not access my account, this is when the bank notified me they knew this scam was occurring and locked the accounts. The fraudsters were able to get my sons XXXX and withdrew {$2800.00}. USAA refuses to acknowledge that this was fraud and said the charge was authorized even though they know it was fraud there was no more than XXXX in both mine and my son 's accounts at the time, so fraudsters wired in {$2500.00} and withdrew {$300.00} from my account and {$60.00} from XXXXXXXX XXXX account ending in ( XXXX ) and now want us to pay it back. 
During the XX/XX/XXXX phone call the real USAA representative opened a case on the same day and informed me they knew of this scam and that it's ( 2 ) different individuals working in tandem, why were consumers not notified? I received Permanent Credit Issued letter 's dated XX/XX/XXXX, confirming that our accounts were credited back the money that had been stolen, only to have that decision reversed on XX/XX/XXXX without notice or evidence for the change. I placed a call to the bank requesting information about the decision and was told that this was an authorized transaction, but would not provide evidence of such, they said that my son 's XXXX of {$2900.00} was used for " good 's and services ''. I disputed the charge my son was informed by the fraudster that his XXXX that was attached to his checking account was also hacked and asked him to change his credentials he did not authorize criminals to steal money he didn't have. I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX from USAA called a Debt Validation Notice stating that I now owed the {$2800.00} so I called the bank on XX/XX/XXXX, the bank to dispute and was informed that the original representative did not classify the fraud properly and they would escalate to the dispute team once again. On XX/XX/XXXX I sent a written dispute to USAA via fax and priority mail again requesting that our accounts be restored as this was fraud. I received a call on XX/XX/XXXX from USAA stating that the case had been reviewed again and they saw the fraud and would again credit the accounts. I have requested for my son 's accounts to be closed and again was reminded it would be 30 days before they could close the accounts. On XX/XX/XXXX the again debited the account {$2900.00} and on XX/XX/XXXX the the account was charged off in the amount of {$2800.00}. I am infuriated USAA began to take money out of my accounts to cover a charge that was fraudulent and now mine and my XXXX XXXX credit has been harmed with a charge off that is not valid. I have requested transcripts from mine and my son 's conversations and reminded the bank that I would file claims with both CFPB and attorney general regarding this incident. I will no loner bank with this instruction I have no history of fraud or non-payment of my bills and after 23 years of banking with this institution I am very upset to know this was not properly resolved.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I sold my home on XX/XX/scrub> 2024. The buyers assumed my home mortgage loan from Flagstar Bank on this date. The title company and my realtor stated that I would receive a check in the mail 4-6 weeks after the closing date for an XXXX XXXX. That time has passed and I opened a case with the mortgage company on XX/XX/XXXX to see when my check would arrive. 

Flagstar Bank admitted to sending the check to the property that was sold on XX/XX/XXXX, instead of my new residence. They stated my new address was not on the paper work to send the check to, which is incorrect. They have my new address and I know this because I received the loan assumption and release of liability notice/document nearly two weeks after the sale closed. 

Flagstar opened a case to investigate this matter and they told me the issue would be resolved with a new check sent out to no later than XX/XX/year>2024. 

On XX/XX/scrub> 2024, I received an email from Flagstar Bank regarding my case and that it had been closed. The email did not contain the resolution, so I called them to find out. The representative that I spoke with stated my check was being sent to my new address that day and I should receive it in 3-5 business days. That time goes by and I call them again on XX/XX/year>2024 and asked where my check was. They stated that I should expect it in the mail no later than Friday XX/XX/year>, due to the bank holiday that prior Monday. 

That time and went again, so I called Flagstar and they told me that the check was sent to the sold property on XX/XX/year>2024 and it was cashed by the buyers of the property. Flagstar stated that the check was sent in the buyer 's name and not mine to the property address. The buyer called Flagstar and opened a case on XX/XX/year>2024 and asked what the check was for. A Flagstar representative told them it was a surplus check and they could cash it. 

On my end, no notice was sent to me regarding this cashing of the check. Flagstar willingly told the buyer that they could have this escrow refund. Then two different representatives of Flagstar told me I would receive my check in the mail ( NOTE : they do not send checks with a tracking number either ).

I spoke with a new Flagstar representative and their customer service management on XX/XX/year>2024 who stated that they need to check with the assumptions department to find out what happened and see how I can get my escrow refund. They did not give me a timeline as to when OR if this issue will be resolved. 

In summary, Flagstar Bank sent my Escrow Refund check to the buyer of my previous home, in their name. That buyer cashed that check with Flagstar 's approval. Flagstar told me twice that I would receive a new check at my new address and in my name. Flagstar then told me the new check was never sent, as the first was cashed by the buyer of the home.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Equifax for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report following two reinvestigations, which is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Account Information : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge Off : XX/XX/year> Amount : {$0.00} Despite providing clear evidence of the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account and requesting its removal from my credit report, Equifax has failed to comply with the law and has retained the inaccurate account information.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act mandates that if a reinvestigation does not resolve a dispute, the credit bureau must delete the disputed information within five business days. The repeated failure of Equifax to adhere to this requirement is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and has caused me financial harm and distress.

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take immediate action against Equifax for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate deletion of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Equifax upholds its obligations under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear American Express, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 
Below is why I am requesting all of my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance.

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely,
