Product: Credit card
Consumer complaint narrative: All I can tell you is I have had problems logging into the website because I have more than XXXX retail account that is managed by the same bank and it makes saving login information a nightmare. And since paperless billing is strongly encouraged and sometimes even costly if not signed up for, the inability to login is exactly like operating with zero account access other than any email and text notifications signed up for in the beginning. So without access to detailed billing information, I was shocked to learn recently that XXXX dollars in my monthly payments were allocated to the balance subject of deferred interest. I was informed that since I did not make special arrangements to allocate specific funds over and above the minimum payment amount each month to be used for paying off the portion of the total amount owed subject to the deferred interest month in incremental payments over the period of time that the interest is being deferred, then all the interest that is accruing during that time period will be added to the card balance all at once. So the ~ {$800.00} charge with 24 months of deferred interest payments that has already accrued nearly {$200.00} in interest so far, will continue to accrue interest until the end of the 24 month period, which by then will amount to {$600.00} or more, UNLESS I make special arrangementsright awayto add almost {$60.00} to each of my normal monthly minimum payments for a total exceeding more than twice my current monthly payment amount, and what is most disturbing is not so much everything I already mentioned because this aint my first XXXX XXXX by shady lenders, its the fact that the whole thing started with me going to the retail store, being offered a discount for applying for a credit card, being approved, and then having that item I purchased on a deferred interest plan, yet my card limit well exceeded that purchase, and NEVER ONCE BEING ADVISED THAT IT WAS UP TO ME TO MAKE THE SPECIAL ARRANGEMENTS AS EXPLAINED ABOVE. WHAT A RACKET

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
CAPITAL ONE AUTO FINANCE BLATANTLY VIOLATES SEVERAL FCRA regulations. 

CAPITAL ONE AUTO FINANCE account XXXX was CHARGED OFF on XX/XX/XXXX, but CAPITAL ONE AUTO FINANCE continues to report it as a charge off every month in this manner updating it monthly. Not only that it also add additional charges/fees after charge off, so balance keeps going up every month. Charge off account should not have any updates after it was charge off. This inaccurate information falsely manipulates statute of limitations, and proves that CAPITAL ONE AUTO FINANCE deceptively report incorrect information to credit agencies. 
Despite being charged off, CAPITAL ONE AUTO FINANCE has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code 4681.

Additionally, CAPITAL ONE AUTO FINANCE has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ) Furthermore, XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened to sue you for very old debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was contacted in XX/XX/XXXX by a woman who threatened that if I didn't resolve my old debt with XXXX XXXX for the balance of {$2600.00}, that a process server was on the way to my previous home address where my family was located. Being fearful of potential embarrassment and not wanting the added stress of legal matters, as I was about to become a father 4 months later, I agreed to settle the matter under duress. I was then transferred to another representative by the name of XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ), where I was set up on a payment plan. I made an initial {$200.00} payment followed by $ XXXX for 24 months, with the option for the entire debt to be wiped away if I paid {$1100.00} by XX/XX/XXXX. The company is with Lewis , McDonnell & Associates. 

Recently, I was terminated by my job in XX/XX/XXXX. While I was able to make the XXXX payment, I called in to explain the situation for XX/XX/XXXX. The debt collector told me that they would give me until the end of XXXX, but, then threatened that if a payment wasn't submitted, that a lawsuit would likely follow, despite a balance of less than {$1000.00} remaining. I then started thinking of the call in XX/XX/XXXX, and by luck, an assignment within XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX focused on the XXXX Fair Debt Collection Practices Act where debt collectors can not call impersonating attorneys or threats of any litigation. I now believe that not only was I unfairly and misled into this debt, but, if an investigation proves so, then I want the debt wiped clean and want all money paid to them to be returned, as it was a contract that was entered under unlawful practices.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or around XX/XX/XXXX I applied for a personal loan with SoFi online ( SoFi loan # XXXX ), and was initially approved for {$100000.00}. 

On or around XX/XX/XXXX SoFi did a HARD inquiry into my credit On or around XX/XX/XXXX SoFi updated the offer and reduced the loan amount to {$40000.00}, and asked me to accept or decline On or around XX/XX/XXXX I want to accept offer. I am unable to accept offer on the SoFi APP, and unable to accept the offer on www.sofi.com On or around XX/XX/XXXX I contact SoFi customer service and speak with an agent, " on a recorded line. '' And am told there is an issue with their system, and an IT ticket has been submitted to allow me to accept this offer XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX I return to the SoFi APP and website, and still receive error message, and am not able to accept offer. Also during this time I am in contact with SoFi both outbound and inbound calls stating the offer will be extended to allow for the IT issue to be resolved XX/XX/XXXX I receive a call from XXXXoFi stating the offer will be extended another 15 days to allow for the IT issue to be resolved. I am still wanting to accept this offer, BUT am unable to accept XX/XX/XXXX I log in to the APP, and see the offer was declined by SoFi, that the offer expired due to me not accepting. 
I call SoFi and am told offer expired. And even though I was told the offer would be extended, I was told this was now incorrect. I was only offered to apply again.

SoFi wasted my time for more than a month, making me think I was approved for this loan. My goal of this loan was to pay off a 27 % loan. SoFi wasted my time for 30 days and should be held liable for wasting my time and interest on this loan, and since it seems they had no interest in actually funding this loan, should remove the hard inquiry

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have done my banking and trading at Charles Schwab for more than two decades. My checking account was involved in a scam/fraud incident in XXXX. Charles Schwab shut down my account for more than two weeks to investigate the specifics of the fraud against my account. When my account was reopened by Schwab Bank it had a negative balance of approximately - {$4500.00}. 

Because I could not access my Schwab checking account, I opened a new account at XXXX XXXX  to reestablish my checking outside of Schwab. I intended to use the two Social Security deposits made within the two-month look-back period to set up my account at XXXX XXXX. 

Charles Schwab Bank refused to allow me access to my Social Security deposits, as required by law for Federal Benefits deposits made within the two-month lookback period. Banks must protect Federal Benefits deposits made electronically during the two-month lookback period. They refused to do so, saying the deposits were in my account when the fraud occurred. That is not an exception to the law requiring them to protect the Federal Benefits deposits and provide the account owner with unfettered access to those funds. 

Charles Schwab Bank released my XXXX Social Security Administration deposit saying it was not deposited when fraud occurred. Nevertheless, I still can not access my XXXX Social Security funds deposited on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. My Social Security deposits are my sole source of income. My current checking account balance is about {$400.00} and is supposed to last until XX/XX/XXXX. That is not doable given my obligations to pay apartment rent, electricity, gasoline, and groceries over the next 25 days. This would not be my circumstance if Schwab Bank was held to their federally required obligations to obey Federal law requiring them to protect my Social Security deposits made electronically within the two-month lookback period and allow the account owner unfettered access to the Federal benefits funds. 

I need help getting access to my Social Security benefit deposited to my Schwab checking account on XX/XX/2024, for {$3100.00}. 

I also encourage regulators to quantify the other Federal benefit deposits to other accounts receiving Federal benefits at their Schwab Bank accounts where those accounts may have been or have been involved in fraud. Based on my experience with Schwab, I imagine the number of depositors affected may be significant. If they ask Schwab to provide access to their Federal benefit deposits they are told " no '' because the funds were deposited when the scam/fraud occurred. That is knowingly blatant disregard of the Federal laws that lay out specifically Schwab 's obligation to protect and provide access to Federal benefit deposits in the owners ' account ( s ). 

I would appreciate a prompt response from you and your agency about this matter. I have few groceries on hand, gasoline is below a quarter of a tank, and I need to pay for my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

My desired outcome is to allow me prompt access to my XX/XX/2024 Social Security deposit of {$3100.00} so I can move that deposit to my new checking account at XXXX XXXX. These funds enable me to meet my financial obligations for rent, utilities, food, medicines and transportation.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Removal of Inaccurate Charge-Off Under FCRA Section 1681 ( e ) ( b ) Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information that appears on my credit report. Specifically, I am disputing the following account : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> Amount : {$46.00} The information regarding this account is inaccurate and incomplete. Under Section 1681 ( e ) ( b ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they include in consumer reports.

I believe that your agency has failed to meet this standard in regard to the reporting of this charge-off. I respectfully request that you re-investigate this matter by contacting the original creditor to verify the accuracy and completeness of this information. If the account can not be verified or is found to be inaccurate, I demand that it be promptly removed from my credit report in accordance with FCRA 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

Additionally, under Section 611 of the FCRA, credit reporting agencies must investigate disputes within 30 days. If the charge-off can not be verified, the credit reporting agency is required to delete the inaccurate information from my credit report.

Please send me written confirmation once the investigation is complete and the inaccurate charge-off has been removed. I expect a response within the 30-day period, as required by law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company disputes the facts presented in the complaint

Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST Collection agency name : TD BANK Address : XXXX, MN XXXX Account number : XXXX Your NAME : XXXX XXXX Your address : XXXX Highway XXXX, XXXX SC XXXX Dear TD BANK I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint to report a series of discriminatory practices by Bank OZK that have caused my wife and me significant emotional and financial distress. I strongly believe the banks actions were motivated by XXXX and religious bias, resulting in the unfair treatment of my wife, a XXXX immigrant, and the eventual closure of my account. This behavior is not only unacceptable but appears to violate federal laws, including the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ).

Key Details : 1. Initial Interaction ( XX/XX/year> ) : On XX/XX/year>, I visited the Bank OZK branch in XXXX, XXXX, with the simple intention of adding my wife to my existing account. My wife had recently received her work authorization card, and we were excited to take this next step. When we met with the banker, XXXX, her demeanor became visibly cold and uncomfortable once she realized my wife was XXXX and an immigrant. Despite my request to simply add my wife to the account, XXXX proceeded to ask a series of irrelevant and inappropriate questions, such as how long my wife had been in the country, where she worked, and where her business was located. 
She also asked whether we were sending money abroad and specifically mentioned XXXX and the XXXX. I explained that I have been using XXXX for business purchases, just as I have for over a year, and that there had been no new changes to my account activity. Despite this, XXXX continued to ask strange questions and even stated that she had never handled anything like this before. Her tone was XXXX, and it became clear that she was uncomfortable with our request. 
XXXX. Document Requests and Email Exchange ( XX/XX/year> ) : The next day, XXXX contacted me requesting additional documents, including our marriage certificate and lease, which I found unnecessary for simply adding my wife to the account. Nevertheless, I complied and sent the requested documents, along with a note clarifying that I only wished to add my wife to the account and was not requesting any other changes. 
XXXX responded with an email stating that the bank was questioning wire activity related to foreign transactions. I clarified that I do not send money using wire transfers but make business purchases through platforms like XXXX and XXXX, just as I have done over the past year. Despite this explanation, XXXX responses remained dismissive, and the questioning felt unjustified and discriminatory. 
Concerned by these interactions, I contacted Bank OZKs corporate office to raise my concerns about potential discrimination. After a XXXX hour investigation, a corporate representative called me back, apologized for the inappropriate questions, and reassured me that everything was resolved. I was told there would be no further issues. 
XXXX. Account Denial ( XX/XX/year> ) : Despite the reassurances from corporate, XXXX contacted me the next day to inform me that the bank had decided not to add my wife to the account. No reason was provided. When I requested an explanation, XXXX was unable to offer XXXX, and after some time passed without a follow-up, I sent an email expressing my belief that federal laws, including those prohibiting discrimination, had been violated. Shortly after, the branch XXXX contacted me but was similarly unable to provide a valid reason for the denial. 
During this conversation, I expressed how distressing this situation was and how incidents like this make it scary and dangerous for Muslims to live in XXXX. The branch XXXX, clearly upset, hung up on me. This response further demonstrated the dismissiveness and lack of regard for the seriousness of my concerns. 
XXXX. Attempted Check Withdrawal and Debit Card Issuance ( XX/XX/year> ) : On XX/XX/XXXX, I received my paycheck and decided to visit the XXXX branch instead of the XXXX branch to avoid further conflict. When I arrived, I was informed by the banker there that corporate had instructed them not to cash my check or issue me a new debit card. The banker explained that Bank OZK no longer wished to do business with me due to unspecified risks. When I requested a copy of the email from corporate that contained these instructions, I was told that it could not be provided. 
I also asked if I could withdraw the almost {$XXXX} I had in my account, but the banker said she was unable to do that either. I left the branch feeling confused and deeply concerned about the safety of my funds. 
XXXX. Withdrawal of Funds and Closure Letter ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Bank OZKs customer service line to update my address, as I wanted to ensure that my remaining balance would be sent to the correct location. However, I was told that no one at the bank was authorized to speak with me, and I was directed to email any further concerns. Later that day, the branch XXXX from XXXX called me and said I could come in to withdraw my funds, which I did. I was assisted by a banker, XXXX, who had known me from previous visits. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX sent me an email containing an official letter regarding the closure of my account. The letter claimed that my account would be closed on XX/XX/year>, and that I had until that date to withdraw my funds. This directly contradicted the fact that I was denied access to my account on XX/XX/XXXX, a full 10 days before the official closure date. The banks actions are inconsistent and raise serious concerns about the true motivations behind this account closure, particularly when combined with the inappropriate questions and tone of my previous interactions. 

Additional Steps Taken : I have also contacted the Council on American-Islamic Relations ( CAIR ) to seek support regarding the discriminatory treatment my wife and I have experienced. Additionally, Congresswoman XXXX XXXX XXXX office has expressed interest in the matter and indicated that they would pursue a congressional inquiry upon my filing a formal complaint with federal agencies. Furthermore, I have reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX office, as I am aware of her involvement with the CFPB and her previous work addressing issues Muslims face in the banking sector. 

Why This Matters : This experience has left my wife and me feeling deeply marginalized and discriminated against. I strongly believe that we were treated unfairly due to my wifes religious and XXXX background, as well as our XXXX faith. The inappropriate questions, the denial of service without reason, and the sudden closure of my accountall of these actions point to discrimination.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX our mortgage began to be serviced by Newrez. We had arranged with the original mortgage XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, that we would be responsible for the payment of homeowners insurance and real estate taxes. In early XXXX we received notice that XXXX was starting to charge us escrow fees to pay real estate taxes. I immediately called Newrez to resolve the matter as we had already paid the first half of the taxes. After much discussion, I was told that the matter would be sent yo the Escrow department for research. I made my regular payment when due.

I received no response from the escrow department. Instead, Newrez made the 2nd half payment. They then billed for the regular laymejt, escrow amount and charged a late fee. I contacted Newrez and agreed over this. I explained that until they gad resolved everything that I was not going yo make a payment as I did notvwantvit to get even more confused. The Newrez escrow debt. finally decided that we were correct and there would be no escrow collected for future taxed, but they would to recover the taxes they had paid. I protested this and made arrangements to repay the tax payment in full. It was agreed that there would be no late fees or interest on any unpaid balance once the taxes were repaid. The payment was made. The late fee and interest is still being charged. During all of this we discovered that the automatic payment we had tried to set up was not working. We were told that
the account information for our credit union was not entered correctly. We had set up payment information for one time payments from the same account. One time payments went through. We copied and pasted the account information from the Newrez one time payment screens into the automatic payment screens. They were identical. When we checked later we discovered that a number had been dropped out of the system. We are not able to correct this as it can not be done with any outstanding balance showing.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I booked an hotel room online for one room, at the XXXX XXXX, in XXXX, XXXX for 2 nights, totaling {$240.00}.

I had my daughter call the hotel earlier that afternoon ( on the day we were to check in on ) and she spoke with a gentleman who had an accent.

She explained to him our situation and asked him if we were to arrive after midnight, would our room still be reserved and would we be able to check in upon arrival still? He stated yes that we would. He also stated that he was " typing it into the notes under our confirmation # and that way there would be no issues. '' Upon arrival ( XXXX ), I walked up to the front desk to approach the XXXX lady ( XXXX ), when a man walked up after me yet right in front of me while I'm standing to be assisted next. Even though she watched this take place, she assisted the XXXX gentleman regardless. She was being incredibly nice to him. However, once I walked up to the desk, again, not only did she make me wait for an extended period of time but she was aggressive and very rude to me.

When I tried to explain to her that my daughter called the hotel earlier that same day and spoke with a gentleman who had a thick accent, and that he stated that he included what we spoke about and us checking in late in notes under our confirmation number, she stated : " sorry, but we've already booked out your room since you didn't show up or call before midnight. '' There was no reasoning as to why she did this except that it's because I was a XXXX  female that she had issues with. XXXX ( who stated that she was a manager at that hotel ) continued to be aggressive and rude.

When I stated that it makes no sense why she's acting the way that she is and stating our room was booked, when we called many hours ( that afternoon ) before arrival, and when I had booked that room for a total of 2 nights, she stated : " you need to leave the premises as you have no room here. '' She stated that I would be refunded when she " had a chance to issue a refund. '' I ended up leaving but not until I requested a manager above her in which she stated " I am the manager and there is no one above me. '' I left the hotel livid.

My daughter and I had to scramble to find another hotel that was close enough to where we would be going later that day but also not booked up and a room that we could reserve a room for the 2 nights needed. Thankfully, we found one, even though it was now 15 minutes away. By the time we got our room reserved, we received only 3 hours of sleep in total, before we had to get up to go to the appointment set up for that same day.

When I arrived back at my home and I didn't see a refund issued by the XXXX XXXX, I decided to reach out to my credit card company ( Goldman Sachs ), issued as an Apple credit card I decided to go ahead and dispute the charge, since I never received what I paid for ( 2 nights for 1 room ). They gave me a provisional credit while it was being investigated and until it was resolved. 

The very first dispute was in XX/XX/year> ( I believe that's the date it started on ).

Since then, my credit card company has reversed the provisional credit so many times ( at least 8 times ), and since then I have been disputing this charge for over a year now. Goldman Sachs 's refuses to issue me a permanent refund for the total amount ( {$240.00} ) that I spent on a product/service ( hotel room ) that I never received ( or for that matter refund me for any amount ). I have submitted sufficient documentation showing the amount of {$240.00}, with which I should have received back.

They continue to state that they never received documentation from me, even though I continued to send it each an and every time.

So, I decided to call the credit card company and I spoke with a representative who transferred me to a manager ( supposedly ). This person I was transferred to was very kind to me.

He stated that I could send the documentation to him ( while he stayed on the phone with me ), to make certain that my document arrived to the company and he stated that he would attach it to the dispute requested ( once again ).

Even though he did this for me and stated he received the documentation, I continued to receive emails from Goldman Sach 's stating that I need to submit documentation. So, once again I submitted the documentation.

After I sent what was asked for, I would then receive a email stating that the company was reversing my provisional credit, due to lack of documentation needed.

So, I called back once again and went through all of it over and over, time and again. This has went on for over a year now.

I'm fed up and frustrated and this is why I have decided to reach out to consumer finance, all in hopes of finally getting this resolved.

I will attach the same documentation to this form that I was sending to Goldman Sach 's each and every time. If there is additional documentation needed, please don't hesitate to reach out and let me know.

Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been a customer with Chime Bank for over seven years. Recently, during Hurricane Helene, my home was broken into, and several items were stolen, including my phone, debit cards, and personal documents. The hurricane hit on XX/XX/year>, and my family evacuated. When we returned home on XX/XX/XXXX, we discovered that looters had taken advantage of the situation. I reported the theft to the police and contacted Chime to report unauthorized ATM transactions. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I requested that my card be replaced and my transactions reviewed. I was told that while the usual dispute process could take up to 90 days, I was eligible for a temporary credit. Despite this, my claim was denied the same day, and the documentation provided by Chime only reflected the information I had already shared. I filed a rebuttal, and during calls with Chimes dispute team on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX, I was assured by XXXX representatives that a credit was pending. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email stating that my rebuttal was denied, and no credits would be issued. 

I am extremely frustrated by the misleading information I have received. As a loyal customer and someone who works in banking, I expect a transparent and fair resolution. I request an immediate review of my case and that the stolen funds be restored to my account. This is unacceptable, and I will take further action if necessary.

Product: Credit card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  from Home Depot through an online order. The product was set for delivery to my address at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NY XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, as confirmed by the XXXX tracking number XXXX. 

However, XXXX marked the package as delivered at XXXXXXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, but to XXXX XXXX, XXXX completely different location. I never received the package at my address. I immediately contacted XXXX and Home Depot to resolve the issue. 

Following my complaint, XXXX conducted a thorough search for the package and has since declared it lost, as documented in the attached claim status from XXXX. Despite XXXX confirming that they were unable to locate the package, Home Depot has repeatedly closed my claims without providing any resolution, refund, or replacement. Furthermore, Home Depot has never contacted me to inform me that my claim was being closed, nor have they provided any results or status updates on their investigations. I only discovered this when I followed up on my own. 

Currently, I have a balance of {$430.00} on my Home Depot credit card, which includes {$300.00} for the missing dishwasher. This amount is due by XX/XX/XXXX, as part of a promotional balance. I am being charged for a product that I have not received, and despite the clear confirmation from XXXX  that the package is lost, Home Depot has failed to remove the charge or provide a replacement. 

This is a breach of my consumer rights under both the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ), which protects consumers from being charged for goods they did not receive, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) if these charges remain unpaid and affect my credit. 

I am requesting immediate intervention from the CFPB to ensure that Home Depot either provides a full refund for the lost item or sends a replacement. Additionally, I ask that any associated charges be removed from my Home Depot credit card and that my credit score remains unaffected by this unresolved issue. Please see the attached documents for the full timeline, XXXX confirmation of the lost package, and details of the charges. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift resolution.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally request your assistance with an unresolved issue regarding a fraudulent transaction on my Cash App account. Despite repeated attempts to address this with Cash App, I have not received an adequate investigation or resolution. 

On XX/XX/year>, a fraudulent charge of {$350.00} was made to my account to XXXX XXXX, which I did not authorize nor initiate. I immediately reported the issue to Cash App 's customer support team, expecting a thorough investigation to be conducted. However, despite providing all necessary documentation and details, Cash App has failed to take appropriate action to investigate this transaction and has not refunded the funds. 

The lack of response and attention to this matter has left me frustrated and concerned about my account 's security and financial information. As a consumer, I rely on digital payment platforms like Cash App to safeguard my financial transactions, and their inability to provide proper support and resolution is unacceptable. The amount was deducted from my case app balance, not my checking account,, and I can not be disputed it through my banking institution. 

I am requesting that the CFPB take appropriate action to investigate this case and ensure that Cash App conducts a full and fair review of the fraudulent transaction, resulting in the prompt return of my {$350.00}. 

I have attached copies of all relevant documentation, including the transaction details, my communications with Cash App, and any other supporting materials. I trust that the CFPB will help resolve this matter promptly. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent issue. I look forward to your response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear Shellpoint Mortgage, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 

I have sent several notices with a list of XXXX documents to validate the debt but was only sent the loan documents, the note ( not the stamped paid in full copy ) and I requested a signed, certified penalty under purjury affadavit to validate their claim they loaned me money and validate the loan wasn't satisfied at closing. I have yet to receive all requested documents. Instead, they tried to foreclose. 


Below is why I am requesting all my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance.

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. My next step is to file my lawsuit to show the securities fraud, breach of contract and compel them to enter all requested documents into discovery to prove my claim.

Credit card

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I sent over a payment to Chase, they refused to accept my form of payment, I have no received any written response nor a form of resolution, below are laws that they are violating. 

Under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ), part of the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ), consumers are provided with the right to dispute billing errors, including unauthorized charges, errors in the amount charged, or charges for goods or services that were not received. This statute lays out the procedures for disputing a billing error and the obligations of the creditor when handling such disputes. 

A creditor shall not, prior to the end of the time period allowed for payment of undisputed amounts, report that an amount or amounts in dispute under this section are delinquent because the amount or amounts remain unpaid. ( 12 CFR 226.13 ( e ) ) Regulation Z, part of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), governs the time of payment and ensures transparency in credit and billing practices. It includes rules on dispute resolution, billing error correction, and the time limits for creditors to respond. 

The payment due date must be clearly disclosed, and any penalties for late payments must be specified. 

Disputes over the timing or application of payments are covered under the dispute resolution procedures mentioned in 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ).

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a follow-up complaint regarding XXXX  unsatisfactory handling of a fraudulent transaction on my account, which has contributed significantly to my current financial hardship. While XXXX eventually took action to resolve the dispute in XX/XX/year>, this response was both inadequate and excessively delayedparticularly considering the dispute was first raised between XXXX and XX/XX/year>. Fidelitys eventual resolution, while addressing the fraud, came far too late to mitigate the financial damage I have experienced as a direct result of their failure to act within a reasonable timeframe. 
Background I initially reported a fraudulent charge on my XXXX account in XX/XX/year>. Over the course of several months, I was given conflicting information, mishandled at various stages, and advised inaccurately about the steps I should take to resolve the matter. Multiple opportunities for XXXX to resolve this issue in a timely manner were missed, causing undue financial strain as I was forced to bear the cost of the fraudulent charge and associated interest. It wasnt until my complaints were escalated to both the CFPB and the Attorney General 's office that XXXX acted to resolve the fraud dispute in XXXX XXXX timeline that is entirely unacceptable given the nature of the claim and XXXX  fiduciary duties. 
Unsatisfactory Outcome While XXXX finally reimbursed me for the fraudulent charge, this outcome remains far from satisfactory. The months-long delay in resolving the issue has caused significant financial hardship in several ways : 1. Delayed Reimbursement : The prolonged period between when the fraud occurred and when XXXX reimbursed the charge meant that I had to account for the fraudulent charge while managing my regular financial obligations. Although XXXX ultimately handled the interest related to the fraudulent charge, I was still unable to pay off my balance in time due to the extended presence of the fraudulent charge on my account. This led to a ballooning balance during that time, which further compounded the financial difficulties. 
2. Interest Accrual on Legitimate Charges : While the fraudulent charge itself was eventually addressed, my inability to pay down the full balance in the interim resulted in significant interest accrual on other legitimate purchases. These charges would not have incurred such high interest had XXXX resolved the dispute promptly, allowing me to properly manage my balance. The ongoing interest accumulation on legitimate charges continues to worsen my financial situation. 
3. Credit Impact ( Potential ) : Though this situation has not yet resulted in missed payments or derogatory marks on my credit report, the rapidly increasing balance due to accrued interest has left me in a precarious position, making it increasingly difficult to manage payments going forward. If this situation remains unresolved, the risk of missed payments and a negative impact on my credit will rise, especially as the ballooning balance threatens to overwhelm my ability to make timely payments. 
XXXX 's Failures at Every Step XXXX 's failures at every step of this processfrom their mismanagement of my fraud complaint, to their lack of timely communication, and their disregard for the financial consequences their delays causeddemonstrates negligence and bad faith. The inordinate delay in processing the dispute does not excuse their responsibility, and a mere " resolution '' months after the fact is insufficient to address the harm caused. It should not take the involvement of the CFPB and the Attorney General for XXXX to act in accordance with their legal obligations. 
Ongoing Financial Hardship As a direct result of XXXX failure to promptly resolve this matter, I have been left in a financially precarious position. Specifically : The delayed reimbursement led to missed payments on other financial obligations, as I was forced to divert funds to cover the fraudulent charge. 
Multiple 0 % APR credit cards taken out during this period have since come due, leaving me with skyrocketing monthly payments that are impossible to manage. 
My business startup has also suffered significant losses due to my inability to manage the debt caused by XXXX failures, with first-year losses likely to exceed {$50000.00}. 
My financial position has deteriorated to the point where I can no longer qualify for a debt consolidation loan, which could have helped alleviate the escalating debt situation caused, in large part, by XXXX 's negligence. 
The current interest rates on credit card debt are far higher than historical averages, compounding my financial struggles and further preventing me from making timely payments.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX  I had tried to transfer money from my Marcus savings account at Goldman Sachs to an external account at XXXX XXXX. It was a small amount and generally would be transferred in a day or two. The never transferred from Marcus to XXXX but I did see that the transaction was reversed ( or didn't go through ). 

I didn't really think much of it and funded my money from a different account and went on with life. 

Fast forward to about XX/XX/year> and I saw that my account at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX charged me for an insufficient funds fee when I had a monthly payment deducted from that account but didn't have enough money to cover it. Upon further investigation I realized that Marcus by Goldman Sachs hadnt sent my pre-existing setup monthly transfer from Marcus to XXXX. 

I called Marcus to let them know about this issue I saw and they told me my account was frozen. I said how can you freeze my account without notifying me about it by making a warning message or alert when I logged in to their account online either via web or their app. They couldn't explain it other to say " we called you but you didn't answer ''. 

I told them I never received a call and didn't think it was right they could freeze my account without making me aware of them doing that since I had been a customer for many years and I had a monthly transfer setup to XXXX for about 1-2 years without prior issues. 

I asked them to refund my fee from XXXX since it was their fault they didn't transfer my money. They asked me to get the following information and mail it to them, which I did : Statement, my last name, purpose of fee, etc Goldman Sachs bank USA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Case : XXXX ** Mailed on Tuesday XX/XX/year> from XXXX XXXX They ended up denying my request for reimbursement. I called them up and asked them why and they said " because we had called you ''. I reiterated to them that I never received a call nor did I see any warnings, statements, us mail or alerts that my account was frozen. They said sorry this decision was final. 

I voice my frustration with the person on the call but literally felt like Goldman Sachs is making XXXX  of dollars in their banking services but can't even refund a long time customer for a fee that was the direct result of an action they took on my account without successfully notifying me of an issue. 

Today, months later, I was watching a XXXX show about a bank called XXXX and people being scammed and they suggested to contact the XXXX XXXX  for help. I thought maybe there is something like that in the USA where I can get help and did a search and found the CFPB.

Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST Collection agency name : XXXX  FUNDING Address : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX  address : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear LVNV I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 
2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 
Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 
Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the inaccurate reporting of payment information on my credit report. Specifically, your company has reported 30-day late payments for XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>, which is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This information is incorrect and must be removed immediately.

Furthermore, I have confirmed that Stellar Finance 's business registration is inactive in the state of Texas, and the companys right to transact business has been forfeited. As such, Stellar Finance lacks the legal authority to report any account or conduct business activities within the state. 

Additionally, I previously informed your company that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, and no efforts were made to properly verify the legitimacy of this account. I have attached business registration details and data breach documentation to support my dispute. 

Outside of these issues, the account must be removed for the inaccurate payment history alone, which I have also included for your reference. 

Please take immediate action to correct these errors and remove this account from my credit report. I expect written confirmation of the removal within 30 days, as required by law.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Navy Federal Credit Union Attention : Checking and Savings Collections Operations Department XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, VA XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Overdrawn Account and Request for Removal of Collection Account Account Number : [ Account Ending in XXXX ] To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the outstanding balance of {$460.00} on my Navy Federal Credit Union checking account ending in XXXX. This dispute is made under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1666 ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ).

I believe this balance was wrongfully placed in collections due to unsupported claims of unauthorized debit card transactions made on XXXX XX/XX/year> for {$1100.00} and on XXXX XX/XX/year> for {$930.00}. These claims were denied without sufficient investigation, despite my continued efforts to resolve the issue. As a result, I am disputing the collection on the following legal grounds : 1. Insufficient Investigation of Disputed Charges : Under Regulation E ( Electronic Fund Transfer Act, 15 U.S.C. 1693 ), XXXX XXXX is required to investigate any unauthorized electronic funds transfer disputes properly. I provided all necessary information regarding the unauthorized transactions, and I request further details and evidence used to deny my claims. If XXXX XXXX can not provide evidence to support the denial, these transactions should be reversed, and my account should be corrected.

2. Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Per the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ), creditors and their representatives must ensure that the debts they report are valid and legitimate. Reporting a debt that includes charges resulting from unsupported or fraudulent transactions constitutes a violation of the FDCPA. I request that XXXX XXXX promptly remove this collection account and refrain from reporting the debt to any third-party agencies, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

3. Right to Correct Inaccurate Information ( Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : As you are aware, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information. XXXX XXXX decision to deem my account a loss is based on incomplete investigation and an unsupported decision regarding the unauthorized transactions. Therefore, the reporting of this debt is inaccurate. I demand that XXXX XXXX promptly remove this collection from its records and from any consumer reporting agencies to which it has been submitted. 

4. Right to Documentation and Proof : I formally request all documentation related to the denied claims of {$1100.00} and {$930.00}, including transaction logs, investigation details, and communications. If this information can not be provided, the claims should be considered unsupported, and my account should be reinstated to its original status. 

Conclusion : Based on the aforementioned laws and my rights as a consumer, I request that XXXX XXXX remove the outstanding balance of {$460.00} from collections immediately and correct my account. Additionally, I request confirmation in writing that no negative information has been reported to any credit or consumer reporting agencies, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Please respond to this dispute within 30 days of receipt, as required under federal law. Should this matter remain unresolved, I am prepared to pursue further action with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or seek legal recourse. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, My car insurance which is XXXX ( entity of XXXX ) electronically transferred {$23000.00} and some change to my Ally account due to my vehicle being a total loss. On or around XX/XX/XXXX, my mother wrote a check for {$25000.00} to help me pay off my next car when I did indeed buy it. I did a mobile deposit to Ally with that check. My moms bank was calling her to verify the amount and transaction but she did not call back in time so the amount was reversed from my account. She finally called her bank ( XXXX ) to let them know she indeed did write it and they informed her to let the payee know to resubmit the check. I could not resubmit the same check so she wrote another one and voided the prior check. I called to let them know the check was reversed and approximately 2 hrs later Ally restricted my entire account even after letting them know this information and also having verbal confirmation from the person who wrote the check. I even sent them documentation on where the completely unrelated insurance money came from, but they will not even release that. Due to this, i have no money to pay bills or purchase another car. I have an elderly person at home and we have no way of getting around. My motor vehicle status is in a lapse due to having plates and no vehicle and i continue to pay insurance on my totaled car so i do not lose my insurance. This is all causing extreme hardship and convenience.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Request for Removal of Nonpublic Information and Violation Notice For Account Number XXXX Dear Capital One, This is my final notice to formally request the removal of my nonpublic and transaction history to be deleted from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, also know as credit reporting agencies immediately. I am enforcing my consumer rights and privacy to what can and can not be shared with non affiated third parties. Any rights that was inserted into the terms of the credit card agreement at time of application, I am revoking any and all permissions to share anything about me and my experience with your financial institution. 
Below is why I am requesting all of my transaction history to be deleted : 1. As a financial institution you must provide an initial notice to each customer explaining their privacy policies and practices regarding nonpublic personal information when the account was initially established and annually.

2. You must have permissable purposes in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I did not give you permission to report my transaction or nonpublic information about my experience with you.

3. As a financial institution you have an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of your customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of our nonpublic personal information. You have not done that and have share my information to various non affilates.

4. As a financial institution you may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party ( credit reporting agencies ) any nonpublic personal information without my written consent.

5. You have never provided to me a clear and conspicuous disclosure in writing or in electronic form on when the reporting of a late payment would occur before the time that such information is initially disclosed. Which would allow me the opportunity to direct that such information not be disclosed to the credit reporting agencies.

6. As a financial institution, you are obligated to disclsose to your customer as to how they could opt out. I was never sent an explantion on how to exercise my nondisclosure option.

As a financial instition you may feel you have a right to report any and all information about my experience with you but there is no law that supports your claim. There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance.

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely,

There are numerous laws that states I have the right to opt out and you must comply or be in violation of {$1000.00} per incedent. I am giving you 4 days to consult with your legal team to verify everything I have stated and to delete all of my nonpubic, transaction history from all CRAs immediately. If you fail to comply, I am ready to take legal actions. Please verify with your legal team, under Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions can face substantial fines for each instance of non-compliant disclosure after you have been advised to stop numerous times. The amounts could potentially reach up to {$100000.00} per violation. As a consumer whose private information is being disclosed without consent may be able to sue the financial institution for damages, including compensation for emotional distress and legal fees. Be advised, any officer or director of the financial institution may also face personal penalties for violations, including fines up to {$10000.00} per violation. Therefore, there is the potential for criminal penalties for intentional or egregious violations brought against the institution or individuals involved, potentially leading to imprisonment. If I do not receive a favorable response within 4 days, this notice will be sent to the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) to take enforcement actions against your institution for non-compliance. 

I trust you will take this matter seriously and resolve the issue promptly. Please provide written confirmation that my transaction history has been removed from XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX immediately.

Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am an XXXX  service member stationed in XXXX  and would like the Louisiana SCRA applied to my account.

RS 29:312 - Limits on creditor interest rates A. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, no creditor in connection with an obligation entered into on or after XX/XX/2005, shall charge or collect from a person, or spouse of a person, who is on active duty interest or finance charges exceeding six percent per annum during the period that the person is XXXX on XXXX XXXX. 

B. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, interest or finance charges in excess of six percent per annum that otherwise would be incurred but for the prohibition in Subsection A of this Section are forgiven.

C. The amount of any periodic payment due from a person, or spouse of a person, who is on XXXX XXXX under the terms of the obligation shall be reduced by the amount of the interest and finance charges forgiven under Subsection B of this Section that is allocable to the period for which the periodic payment is made.

D. In order for an obligation to be subject to the interest and finance charges limitation of this Section, the person, or spouse of the person on XXXX XXXX, shall provide the creditor with written notice and a copy of the military or gubernatorial orders calling the person to XXXX XXXX and of any orders further extending XXXX XXXX, not later than one hundred eighty days after the date of the person 's termination of or release from XXXX XXXX. 

E. Upon receipt of the written notice and a copy of the orders referred to in Subsection D of this Section, the creditor shall treat the obligation in accordance with Subsection A of this Section, effective as of the date on which the person is on XXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Az XXXX XXXX RESURGENT/LVNV FUNDING XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, SC XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX : Dispute of Collections Action : Case # XXXX To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally dispute the inaccuracies reflected in my credit report concerning the collection actions associated with your agency. Attached you will find a copy of my credit report with the disputed items highlighted for your review. 
Specifically, I am contesting the following entry : RESURGENT/LVNV FUNDING Account # XXXX Dispute Item and Explanation : Permissible use violation, reporting to a third party inaccurate Private and personal Information, not providing original documentation of consumer relationship/debt or promise to pay, or contract. 

As mandated by state and federal laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I demand that you provide verifiable proof of this alleged debt. It has come to my attention that you have already contacted a third party regarding this matter, which is a blatant violation of the FDCPA. This misconduct is unacceptable and further undermines your credibility as a debt collector. 

I hereby instruct you to immediately cease all collection efforts until you have furnished adequate verification of this debt. You are also directed to refrain from contacting any third partiesincluding my employer, neighbors, or family membersabout this collection. All future correspondence must be conducted in writing and sent directly to me. 

Furthermore, I assert that any reporting of this matter to credit reporting agencies is premature. You are required to halt any negative reporting until you have thoroughly investigated my dispute. If any negative information has already been reported, you must notify the credit bureaus to remove such information pending the outcome of your investigation. 

Your next communication with me must either confirm that the creditor has failed to verify the debt and that the matter is closed or provide solid proof of my responsibility for this debt. If you assert that the debt is valid, I expect a comprehensive explanation for your refusal to remove it from collections, along with copies of all relevant documents, including applications, bills, communications, and payment records. 

I expect your acknowledgment of this notice within 14 days. Failure to comply will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter to the appropriate regulatory authorities and seek legal recourse. 

Sincerely, _______________________________________ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: I sold my home in XXXX with which a transfer of a solar panel loan was involved. Before my home sold, we secured an approved transfer of the loan to the buyer ( the process itself was very difficult and the company tried to deny the buyer of the home multiple times without explanation ). After we received an approval, we submitted the transfer and assumption paperwork and our home sold to the buyers a few days later. In XXXX I received notification that the account was in collections in my name, and the company denied ever issuing the approvals even though we have everything in writing and on company letterhead, and emails! They said they issued a denial via mail without informing any of the parties involved in the home sale, days after issuing the approval and only two days prior to when our home was set to be sold to out of state buyers. After I spent countless hours on the phone and via email attempting to resolve this, I am at a standstill. Since XXXX, the company accepted their approval of the loan, and transferred to the buyer. My credit report is still affected almost 90 days later, and as of last week this debt was temporarily removed. This week, the debt was reinstated on my credit report as belonging to me after I submitted a dispute directly with the credit bureau. My credit score was negatively impacted by at last XXXX points for the last 4 months minimum, and it's caused an incredible amount of stress, I've not been able to refinance my student loans or even open up a new high yield savings account. An account executive confirmed last week XX/XX/XXXX on the phone that in order for it to be re-instated on my credit report, it needs to be confirmed by the company that the information is accurate ( meaning they reinstated the debt and missed payments as belonging to me ). The company also fraudulently back dated the payoff dates in my payment portal to show the loan was paid off XX/XX/XXXX, which is at 10 days before our home sold, to cover up this entire situation. I have proof that this was not done until at least XX/XX/XXXX ( this account view that I downloaded shows the debt on my portal, delinquency letters, etc ). Multiple times throughout this process I requested proof of submission of the correction sent to the credit bureaus, and nothing was provided. The company refused to take accountability for this situation or attempt to resolve this. The account executive I spoke with XX/XX/XXXX had empathy, but also acknowledged this ridiculous situation as something that should never have happened. I have filed formal reports on the company 's website, with the IL Attorney General, with the XXXX, and now with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. I have spent an incredible amount of time trying to resolve this myself ( over XXXX hours of work XXXX, phone calls, emails, report filings, consultations with lawyers ) when it should have never been my situation to begin with, it's caused an incredible amount of stress and damage to my financial situation the last 6 months. I am certain that our only way forward on the path to resolution is going to be with legal assistance, and ensuring that this company does not do this again to other people.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I reviewed my consumer report and noticed adverse items being furnished by Bully City Financial for an alleged debt in the amount of {$320.00}. As of XX/XX/XXXX, Bully City Financial has been notified at the address specified in Exhibit ( A ) of ; the misleading and inaccurate information, my right to refuse to pay such alleged debts and to cease all further communication conveying the inaccurate information. This included but not limited to ; telephone calls, emails or any furnishing of information to the consumer reporting agencies. 

Bully City Financial never notified me prior to furnishing the alleged debt or ANY correspondence/communication in regards to the alleged debt. pursuant to sections 814 ( d ) and 817 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA or Act ), 15 U.S.C. 1692l ( d ), 1692o ; title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act ( Dodd-Frank Act ) Bully City Financial must cease ANY and ALL collection attempts in regards to the alleged debts mentioned within until Bully City Financial sends a copy of verification of the debt or of a judgment to the consumer in writing or electronically in the manner required by 1006.42 ; Congress finds there is abundant evidence of the use of abusive, deceptive and unfair debt collection practices pursuant to 15 U.S.Code 1692. It has been well over 30 days and Bully City Financial has strict liability and must comply with all statutes and regulations set forth. Bully City Financial has failed to comply and respond to such notice and correspondence. Negligence of the law is no excuse. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Bully City Financial shall be held liable due to Non-compliance. ( 15 usc 1692k ( c ) ) Midland Funding, LLC v. JJohnson, 137 S. Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Dispute Request for Removal of Incorrect Addresses, Names, and Employers I am writing to formally dispute incorrect information on my credit report related to my addresses, names, and employers. I have previously submitted disputes to correct this information, but my requests were ignored, and no action has been taken. As a result of your inaction, I am also filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to address your failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Under the FCRA, you are required to ensure the accuracy of the information you report. The following inaccuracies must be corrected immediately : Incorrect Addresses : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Incorrect Names : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Incorrect Employers : XXXX XXXX FCRA Violations and My Rights According to Section 611 of the FCRA, you are required to investigate and resolve disputes within 30 days of receiving notice. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted from my report promptly. Your failure to act on my previous disputes is a violation of this federal requirement.

Additionally, Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA mandates that you maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy. The presence of inaccurate addresses, names, and employers reflects a breach of this duty.

Demand for Immediate Action and Penalties I demand that you : Immediately remove all incorrect addresses, names, and employers from my credit report.

Provide written confirmation of these corrections.

Ensure future inaccuracies are promptly addressed and corrected.

Apply all applicable penalties under the FCRA for failing to address these disputes properly and in a timely manner.

If the requested changes are not made within 14 days, I will pursue legal action for non-compliance and further escalate my complaint with the CFPB.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I expect written confirmation of the corrections within the specified timeframe. 
I only have one Correct Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, ohio, XXXX I only have one Correct Spelling of my name when applying for Credit i dont use my middle name : XXXX XXXX I Only have one correct employer : XXXX XXXX XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information and to have my personal and financial information protected. The presence of these inquiries constitutes a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 
Specifically, I did not authorize these inquiries, and they were made while my credit report was frozen, which further demonstrates that they were illegal and unauthorized. The details of the unauthorized inquiries are as follows : Inquiry XXXX : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX NY XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Inquiry XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX Tx XXXX XXXX of Inquiry XX/XX/XXXX Inquiry XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Tx XXXX Date of Inquiry XX/XX/XXXX Inquiry XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date of Inquiry XX/XX/XXXX I request that these inquiries be removed from my credit report immediately. I am enclosing copies of my credit report showing the inquiries, Also, I have a spoken to several operators/representatives from your company in the membership department who has acknowledged on audio tape that my report was frozen from XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. 
If these inquiries are not removed, I am prepared to escalate this matter by seeking legal counsel and filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). The FCRA provides for statutory damages in cases of willful non-compliance, and I take my rights very seriously.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Beginning XX/XX/year> until XX/XX/year>, I had been rate shopping for a mortgage loan. Equifax has listed on my credit report five ( 5 ) hard inquiries, one for each mortgage company that checked my credit. I have never denied that I entertained rate quotes from these mortgage companies. My issue is according to the policy of Equifax if a person is rate shopping for mortgage loans within a specified number of days, then the hard inquiries are consolidated and count as one ( 1 ) hard inquiry. The hard inquiries are not consolidated as they should be according to Equifax policy.

I previously filed a dispute for this same matter. Apparently, the dispute was not fully read or misinterpreted, because notices were sent to the five ( 5 ) mortgage companies that I had been rate shopping. These notices stated that I disagreed with my credit file being retrieved as a hard inquiry, so I received phone calls, emails, and documentation via USPS mail that the inquiries were legitimate. The legitimacy of the inquiries has never been in question, only the consolidation by Equifax which to this date has still not occurred and is impacting my credit score.
