Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against TransUnion for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report after two previous disputes, which constitutes a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Account Information : - Account Number : XXXX - Creditor Name : XXXX - Date of Charge Off : XX/XX/year> - Amount : {$0.00} The account in question is an auto loan that was reported as charge off but has been paid in full. Despite providing documentation in previous disputes that demonstrates the inaccuracies of this information, TransUnion has failed to remove it from my credit report. Additionally, this account is reported solely by TransUnion and not by other credit bureaus, which further indicates an error in the reporting. 
The FCRA requires credit bureaus to delete disputed information within five business days after the reinvestigation if the dispute is not resolved, as stipulated in 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ). The continued presence of this incorrect account on my report violates the following FCRA provisions : 1. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) - Credit bureaus are legally required to ensure maximum accuracy of the information they report. The fact that this charge off appears exclusively in TransUnions report suggests that TransUnion has failed to verify the accuracy of its data.

2. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) - TransUnion is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation when the accuracy of any item in the report is questioned. The failure to correct the disputed information after two attempts constitutes a violation of this obligation.

TransUnions lack of compliance has caused significant financial damage and emotional distress, impacting my ability to access credit fairly. I request the CFPB to investigate this matter thoroughly and take the necessary actions against TransUnion for its continued non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

I am seeking the immediate deletion of this inaccurate account from my credit report and any other remedies deemed appropriate by the CFPB to ensure that TransUnion fulfills its legal obligations. Attached to this complaint, please find the supporting documentation, including the original disputes, proof of payment for the auto loan, and my current credit report reflecting the erroneous information.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in enforcing compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
reviewing my credit report I get XXXX hard inquiry that is not correct Disputed inquiry XXXX : FACTUAL DATA, XX/XX/year>, Unspecified. 

TRANSUNION is violating the following laws : Basis for Dispute Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) states that I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these unauthorized inquiries and remove them from my credit report.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report. 

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report. 
Request immediately delete those hard inquiries

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Rent Recovery Solutions has unlawfully reported an alleged debt of {$1400.00} to my XXXX credit report without contacting me. 

I don't recall having a contractual relationship with this collection company, RENT RECOVERY SOLUTIONS, nor have I received any correspondence from them. Please consider this letter as my formal dispute of the alleged debt and a request for verification of its validity. Please provide proof that this alleged account belongs on my credit report and that my rights have not been infringed upon ; otherwise, please terminate this account immediately. In compliance to 15 U.S. Code 1692e ( 6 ) Debt collectors are legally obligated to adhere to 15 U.S. Code 1692e ( 6 ), which forbids them from providing false information or insinuating inaccuracies about the nature, amount, or legal standing of a debt. It is against the law to make deceptive statements or misrepresentations concerning the debt being pursued for collection. 


Furthermore, I kindly request that you provide me with proper documentation proving your legal authority to collect any alleged debt. I also request that you provide me with a written response within 30 days of receiving this letter, confirming the actions you have taken to resolve this matter. Failure to respond within the given timeframe will be interpreted as an acknowledgment of the debt 's invalidity and will result in further actions to protect my rights as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA and all other applicable laws and regulations governing debt collection ). I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have multiple, active, in progress, unresolved consumer disputes in my CFPB account. 
As of XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed my credit report has decreased by over XXXX points for each credit bureau. The CFPB has failed to comply with : 15 U.S. Code 6805 - Enforcement- ( a ) In general Subject to subtitle B of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 [ 12 U.S.C . 5511 et seq. ], this subchapter and the regulations prescribed thereunder shall be enforced by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, the Federal functional regulators, the State insurance authorities, and the Federal Trade Commission with respect to financial institutions and other persons subject to their jurisdiction under applicable law. 

12 CFR 1016.4 Initial privacy notice to consumers required- ( a ) Initial notice requirement. You must provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects your privacy policies and practices to : ( 1 ) Customer. An individual who becomes your customer, not later than when you establish a customer relationship, except as provided in paragraph ( e ) of this section; and ( 2 ) Consumer. A consumer, before you disclose any nonpublic personal information about the consumer to any nonaffiliated third party.

12 CFR 1016.7 Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods- ( a ) ( 1 ) Form of opt out notice. If you are required to provide an opt out notice under 1016.10 ( a ), you must provide a clear and conspicuous notice to each of your consumers that accurately explains the right to opt out under that section. The notice must state : ( i ) That you disclose or reserve the right to disclose nonpublic personal information about your consumer to a nonaffiliated third party ; ( ii ) That the consumer has the right to opt out of that disclosure; and ( iii ) A reasonable means by which the consumer may exercise the opt out right.

( 2 ) Examples ( i ) Adequate opt out notice. You provide adequate notice that the consumer can opt out of the disclosure of nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party if you : ( A ) Identify all of the categories of nonpublic personal information that you disclose or reserve the right to disclose, and all of the categories of nonaffiliated third parties to which you disclose the information, as described in 1016.6 ( a ) ( 2 ) and ( 3 ) of this part, and state that the consumer can opt out of the disclosure of that information; and ( B ) Identify the financial products or services that the consumer obtains from you, either singly or jointly, to which the opt out direction would apply.

( ii ) Reasonable opt out means. You provide a reasonable means to exercise an opt out right if you : ( A ) Designate check-off boxes in a prominent position on the relevant forms with the opt out notice ; ( B ) Include a reply form together with the opt out notice that, in the case of financial institutions described in 1016.3 ( l ) ( 3 ) of this part, includes the address to which the form should be mailed ; ( C ) Provide an electronic means to opt out, such as a form that can be sent via electronic mail or a process at your Web site, if the consumer agrees to the electronic delivery of information ; or ( D ) Provide a toll-free telephone number that consumers may call to opt out.

( iii ) Unreasonable opt out means. You do not provide a reasonable means of opting out if : ( A ) The only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt out right; or ( B ) The only means of opting out as described in any notice subsequent to the initial notice is to use a check-off box that you provided with the initial notice but did not include with the subsequent notice.

( g ) Time to comply with opt out. You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it.

( h ) Continuing right to opt out. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time.

( i ) Duration of consumer 's opt out direction.

( 1 ) A consumer 's direction to opt out under this section is effective until the consumer revokes it in writing or, if the consumer agrees, electronically.

On XXXX XXXX via the CFPB complaint website, I have opted out of XXXX, Equifax, XXXX reporting services according to 12 CFR 1016.7 for the accounts : 1. XXXX XXXX  XXXX. XXXX XXXX According to the Fair Fredit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy ''. XXXX, Equifax, XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the consumer. I have a right to make sure that my private information is not shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information ''. XXXX XXXX  XXXX and XXXX XXXX are financial institutions by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 states " Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, or implied are now all revoked. 
15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unlessthe consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option ''. XXXX XXXX  XXXX and XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my non disclosure option. In addition, 15 U.S.C. 1681a section 603 states that " ( II ) adverse to the interests of the consumer ''. CFPB, XXXX, Equifax, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and XXXX XXXX has committed continuous adverse reporting against my interests by reporting derogatory marks on my credit report, decreasing my credit score by over XXXX points in XXXX hours without regard to my active CFPB complaints, and by also reporting high credit card utilization, and late payments. 
15 U.S. Code 1681e states " Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title ''. CFPB, XXXX, Equifax, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX  XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. 

Total Damages pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance- {$55000.00} 2ND OPT OUT NOTICE BEFORE LAWSUIT- Pursuant to 12 CFR 1016.7- " You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it. Continuing right to opt out. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time ''. I XXXX XXXX, am opting out of CFPB, XXXX, Equifax, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and XXXX  XXXX reporting services.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative: I was already on SAVE plan. In XX/XX/XXXX I consolidated all my federal direct loans together for the one time account adjustment with the safe plan. My loans were then transferred from XXXX XXXX to MOHELA through the US Department of education. MOHELA processed the consolidation, but never the save plan. Two months went by. They still hadn't processed it so I resubmitted it again on XX/XX/XXXX. I called them and told them about that, so they put me on there forbearance stating that it takes time to process. However, with their forbearance student loan interest kept accumulating. Will come XXXX, the safe plane gets put on hold placing SAVE plan borrowers in interest free government forbearance. MOHELA refuses to put me on that forbearance because they never processed my safe plan in a timely manner. I have been an income base payment plan since XXXX They put me on a standard repayment plan when I consolidated, even though I consolidated them with the safe plan. They refuse to process the repayment plan in a timely manner consequently causing me harm with increased student loan interest accruing, not allowing me to be in the government forbearance while they figure out what to do with the safe plan. I can not afford the standard repayment plan so I have to keep going in regular for parents until the government gets things straightened out. It's not fair, because I should be put with all the other safe plan people hanging in limbo, but I'm not because MOHELA won't do anything in a timely fashion.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: I was notified on XX/XX/year> that Federal Student Aid ( FSA ) had approved me for PSLF. On XX/XX/year> XXXX conveyed a message to MOHELA to discharge my loans. I called MOHELA on XX/XX/year> and requested that they detail why they had not discharged my loans after receiving notification from FSA to discharge my loans through PSLF, but MOHELA stated they had an account transaction error and it would take up to 90 days to " rebuild my account '' and then discharge my loans. This makes no sense and is not transparent, and should not take this long. It makes no sense that MOHELA needs to rebuild the account to issue forgiveness, when FSA has already stated that forgiveness needs to be issued to my account. My loans should be discharged and then if the account needs to be rebuilt for refund purposes, this can happen on the back end.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST Collection agency name : National Credit Adjusters , LLC Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account number : # XXXX Your name : XXXX XXXX Your address : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear : National Credit Adjusters , LLC I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this account. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the bankruptcy reporting associated with the reference number XXXX. It has come to my attention that LexisNexis is reporting this bankruptcy, which I believe to be inaccurately attributed to me. Below is a summary of the bankruptcy information I am disputing : Reference Number XXXX Bankruptcy Type XXXX  XXXX Date Filed XX/XX/year> Court Name US Bankruptcy Court Filing Location XXXX, OH Pending Discharge Date Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FRA ), I am requesting that you verify whether this bankruptcy is correctly matched to my personal information. Specifically, I ask that you review your records, validate the accuracy of the identification information used, and ensure that this bankruptcy is indeed associated with my file. 
As you are aware, the FCRA requires that all information reported by consumer reporting agencies be accurate and verifiable. If you can not provide documentation proving that this bankruptcy is accurately matched to me, it is your obligation under the law to immediately delete this information from my file. Inaccurate or unverifiable information must be removed within 30 days of my dispute, per FCRA guidelines. 
Failure to correct or verify this information constitutes defamation of character and damages my reputation. If you fail to act in accordance with the FCRA and remove or correct the inaccurate bankruptcy reporting. I will have no choice but to pursue legalreporting. I will have no choice but to pursue legal action for defamation, along with any other remedies allowed under law I will attach a copy of my ID

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by TransUnion Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion due to multiple violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in relation to the reinsertion of inaccurate and unauthorized information into my credit report. Additionally, the credit reporting agency failed to provide or request documentation I specifically asked for during the dispute process, compounding their non-compliance with the FCRA. 

Background Information : Credit Reporting Agency : TransUnion Disputed Account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX On XX/XX/year>, I disputed this account on the grounds of inaccuracy. Following the dispute, Transunion deleted the account from my credit report, as confirmed in writing on XX/XX/year>. However, upon reviewing my most recent credit report on XX/XX/year>, I discovered that the same inaccurate and unauthorized information had been reinserted.

FCRA Violations : Failure to Notify of Reinsertion : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ( ii ), a credit reporting agency must notify the consumer within five business days if previously deleted information is reinserted into the credit report. I was not informed of this reinsertion.

Failure to Obtain Certification of Accuracy : Before reinserting the disputed information, TransUnion was required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ( i ) to obtain certification from the furnisher that the information is accurate. No such certification was provided. 

Failure to Provide Furnisher Information : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ( iii ), the agency must provide the name, address, and phone number of the furnisher of the reinserted information. This was not done. 

Failure to Ensure Accuracy : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) mandates that credit reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information. By reinserting inaccurate information, TransUnion has violated this provision.

Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation : As per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), credit reporting agencies are obligated to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information. Reinserting inaccurate data without verification shows a failure to comply with this obligation.

Failure to Provide or Request Documentation : Throughout the dispute process, I specifically requested documents verifying the accuracy of this account, as well as contact information for the original furnisher of the data. TransUnion Reporting Agency failed to provide or request this documentation, demonstrating further non-compliance with FCRA standards.

Requested Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate and unauthorized information from my credit report. 
Written confirmation that this information has been permanently removed and will not be reinserted unless in full compliance with the FCRA. 
Full disclosure of the source of the reinserted information, including the furnishers name, address, and phone number. 
An updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 
Explanation of why the requested documentation was neither provided nor requested from the original furnisher. 
The reinsertion of this inaccurate and unauthorized information has caused me significant harm, including a lower credit score and emotional distress. The violations committed by TransUnion have impacted my ability to obtain favorable financial terms. I request that the CFPB take immediate action to investigate this matter and ensure that the credit reporting agency is held accountable for these serious breaches of the law.

I have attached copies of my original dispute letter, the deletion confirmation, and a copy of the new dispute.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and any actions you will take to resolve this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Enclosures : Copy of original dispute letter Proof of deletion confirmation Copy of new dispute Copy of FTC Identity Theft Report
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Well, I would like them to send me a written notice with my full name, Social Security number, the date when this alleged debt began, and records showing which company I supposedly owe. I want the names, addresses, Social Security number, and all the relevant information they claim to have, provided to me in writing. If they can not provide these details, I would like the debt to be removed from my credit report, as it is unfair for them to have no valid information about me while I allegedly owe them money. 

I also want to know exactly which company they are, because according to what I found online, they are a law firm. If thats the case, then they should have all my information. 7 ) when I tried to do the international wire transfer in the local currency of the recipient international bank. Bank of America failed to disclose any type of fees of the recipient bank. but only showed bank of America exchange rate to that currency.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
My checking account in Chase has been set up to auto-pay the account balance of my XXXX XXXX credit card each month for well over a year. 

Chase did not make the autopayment one month. The prior months had been paid with no problem. 

As you will see in the XX/XX/year> screenshot from the Chase portal " ebill history '' which I will attach, payments have been consistently made until the bill due XX/XX/XXXX. 

The second screenshot from XX/XX/year> from the Chase portal " all bill pay activity '' shows that payments were consistently made through XXXX. As you can see, payments resumed normal activity in XXXX. 

When I called to see why the payment hadn't been paid, the excuses evolved. First, they claimed they didn't receive the bill from XXXX XXXX. When I told them I can see the XXXX XXXX bill in the Chase portal right next to where it says unpaid, they decided to offer a different excuse. 

They asked if I received an email on XX/XX/XXXX about the XXXX - XXXX did. It said it wouldn't pay the XXXX XXXX bill. I hadn't opened the email ( because the subject was the same it was every month : " Your new XXXX XXXX XXXX is ready '' ). I told them that XX/XX/XXXX was after the due date ( of XX/XX/XXXX ) and that I was out of the country and couldn't have paid. When they found out I was out of the country, they jumped on a whole new bandwagon and asked where I was. When I responded XXXX, they told me it was a high risk XXXX country and that XXXX have been why it wasn't paid. It is complete XXXX  to suggest that when an American traveler goes to XXXX ( not an XXXX country and Chase even has a branch in XXXX ) automatic payments aren't made. I asked to see where I could find this on the Chase website so that I could prepare myself for the future ( fully knowing this is XXXX  and there wouldn't be a list on the website ). Eventually the woman said they'd have to call me back. She asked for when to call and I gave XXXX times. I asked what number I would be called from and she said she didn't know but maybe from an XXXX number and that I would be called back within XXXX or XXXX business days. 

After XXXX business days, I called back and gave the reference number. The man said that they had tried calling me during the time I has specified. I checked my phone and messages and confirmed I had not been called. He said to give them more times to call and they would call me back. In indicated that was the exact same thing they said last time and that I didn't believe him that they had called me previously so I didn't trust it this time. He said he was sorry I was unsatisfied with his resolution, said someone would call me back, and hung up on me. 

The above is highly annoying but it's not why I am contacting the CFPB. What happens next is downright fraud : After being hung up on, I immediately called back, when through all the rigamarole to get to someone who could look at my case. I started fresh, indicating that I had expected a return call in XXXX or XXXX business days but no call had come and I wanted to know the resolution. This new person opened my case and said " I can see we spoke to you on XX/XX/XXXX and explained why the bill wasn't paid and the case has been closed. '' I was outraged. Clearly the person who had just hung up on me had altered my file after he spoke to me. Instead of saying " they tried to call you '' the message was now " we spoke with you on XX/XX/XXXX and have now closed the case. '' This is fraudulent. My phone records will prove it and Chase will not be able to find a recorded conversation with me on XX/XX/XXXX. The new person indicated that we should open a new case to pursue the answers to the questions I still had ( which is why wasn't the bill paid- I don't believe that it has anything to do with me being in XXXX and have no idea why that would impact my auto payment. So, a new case is established and I am waiting for resolution. 

However, my reason to coming to the CFPB is because of the man who hung up on my who altered my file by saying we had a conversation on XX/XX/XXXX and closing the case. 



The Reference number for the first case : XXXX ( This is the XXXX where I was told that the bill may not have been paid because I was in a high risk country ( since when is XXXX high risk? ) and where the man told me they tried to contact me and then hung up on me then altered the file to show that they HAD reached me and then closed the case. ) The second case which we opened fresh to address the original complaint is : Case number : XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Portfolio Recovery Associates : I am writing to address the adverse marks on my credit file that have been attributed to me. While I would willingly acknowledge and assume responsibility for any valid debts, I am unable to do so in this case without Proper Validation and Proof of Claim. As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPAL ),

15 USC 1692g, I am formally requesting comprehensive validation of the alleged debt.

I seek evidence establishing that I am the party obligated to settle this debt and that there exists a legally binding contractual obligation compelling me to do so. For clarity, I request that all communication be limited to written correspondence until adequate validation of the purported debt is provided. To assist you in meeting this request, please furnish the following required documentation : XXXX. Name and address of the original Creditor. 
XXXX. Complete payment history, as per the precedent set by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ; XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Provide a detailed verification by line item, including information on the purchase date, itemized amounts, receipt of goods, and any relevant details directly from the original creditor. 
XXXX. Date of Last Activity. 
XXXX. Full, accurate social security number that may help to identify me as the correct person you are trying to collect from. 
XXXX. Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor, indicating the commitment to pay the original creditor. 
The obligation between your company XXXX Portfolio Recovery Associates ) and me that authorizes the collection of the alleged debt, along with any transaction binding me to an agreement to pay your company. 
XXXX. Proof of photo identification ( i.e., drivers license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) presented at the time of incurring the debt. 
XXXX. Letter of sale or assignment of from the original creditor to your company, including any agreement with your client granting the authority to collect on this alleged debt. ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt ). XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) + information relating to the purchase of a bad debt is not proprietary or burdensome. 
XXXX. Proof that you are authorized to collect the debt on behalf of the creditor by providing the Assignment Contract.

9. Verification of the debt is within the statute of limitations.

10. Any other pertinent information regarding the creation of the debt by your collection agency like ( XXXX. Where the debt originated from, 2. ) The sum paid by the bad debt buyer for the plaintiffs debt, 3. ) How the total amount was determined and 4. ) A list of documents that authorize the collection of debts ).

In the event you will not or can not send all demanded documentation or can not validate every charge you state I have made to make this balance, then I demand this issue be resolved and dropped in full. I wish to point out I am going by the FEDERAL LAWS & I expect for your company to do the same.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Removal of Inaccurate Charge-Off Under FCRA Section 1681 ( e ) ( b ) Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information that appears on my credit report. Specifically, I am disputing the following account : Creditor Name : WFBNA CARD Account XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> Amount : {$910.00} The information regarding this account is inaccurate and incomplete. Under Section 1681 ( e ) ( b ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they include in consumer reports. 

I believe that your agency has failed to meet this standard in regard to the reporting of this charge-off. I respectfully request that you re-investigate this matter by contacting the original creditor to verify the accuracy and completeness of this information. If the account can not be verified or is found to be inaccurate, I demand that it be promptly removed from my credit report in accordance with FCRA 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 

Additionally, under Section 611 of the FCRA, credit reporting agencies must investigate disputes within 30 days. If the charge-off can not be verified, the credit reporting agency is required to delete the inaccurate information from my credit report. 

Please send me written confirmation once the investigation is complete and the inaccurate charge-off has been removed. I expect a response within the 30-day period, as required by law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection
Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
This company has violated my consumer rights by attempting to collect on a debt that I do not owe, and they continue to report this debt to consumer credit bureaus despite it being invalid. The alleged debt is beyond the statute of limitations for collection under Maryland law, which is three years. The statute of limitations does not restart when a debt is sold or transferred to another collection agency, meaning their continued collection efforts are unlawful. 

The following are clear violations of federal and state consumer protection laws : 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a ) ( FDCPA ) : The company has failed to provide the written contract or any validation documentation proving that I owe this debt, as required by the FDCPA. Without validation, they have no legal grounds to collect or report this debt. 

15 U.S.C. 1681n ( FCRA ) : By failing to ensure the accuracy of the information reported and continuing to report this account without proper validation, the company and the credit bureaus ( XXXX and XXXX ) are in violation of the FCRA. They may be held liable for negligence and non-compliance. If willful, these violations could result in liability for actual, statutory, and punitive damages. 

12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) : The company has failed to provide necessary validation information before reporting this collection account to my credit report, as required by federal law.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) : I was not given the opportunity to dispute this account before it was reported to the credit bureaus, which violates my rights under federal law.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) : The company lacks the authority to report this account to consumer reporting agencies without providing all required disclosures and debt validation. 

In addition to federal violations, the company is also in violation of Maryland consumer protection laws : Maryland Consumer Debt Collection Act ( MCDCA ) : The company has engaged in unfair and deceptive debt collection practices by failing to validate the alleged debt and continuing collection efforts.

Maryland Financial Institutions Article, 11-301 & 7-101 : The company is not licensed to engage in debt collection or lending activities in Maryland, as required by law. Conducting such activities without the proper licensing is illegal. 

I have attached a copy of my full complaint letter, detailing these violations in greater depth.
